loans.name: Thien's Group

texts.en:
Thien T. D. is 37 years old  and has one child  who is attending high school.  Being a farmer,  her main activities focus on growing rice and vegetables and  raising chickens.  After divorcing in 2008, she has to work more in order to provide a good education for her  child. She has increased the numbers of paddies to grow more kinds of vegetables so that she  can earn a stable income to manage her family life. Participating in SEDA's credit program since 2006, she has repaid her loans on time and used the loans effectively to develop her farming. She is requesting a loan of 8,066,000 VND to buy food for her chickens and fertilizer for rice.

Dui T. N. is 35 years old and has two children. She is raising 10 pigs for meat. She is requesting a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy food for them,

Loan T. D. is 45 years old and has three children. She is raising 100 chickens for eggs. She is requesting a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: To purchase food  for chickens and fertilizer for rice

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Not having finished her course on nursing in college, Girlie A., 31, refuses to give up on her future. She works on her own micro business to make sure that she'll be better off in the end. She is married to Renante and they are blessed with seven children, three of whom are already working.  The other four are at home. Their family resides in Carmona, Cavite.

Girlie has a mineral water refilling business.  She also sells liquefied petroleum gas tanks and rice.  She also rents out four rooms for local transients and bed spacers.  In addition, Girlie manages her direct selling business of cosmetics, apparels, footwear and accessories. She has juggled these businesses for years now, and monthly she earns an estimated net income of around Php10,000.

To help her grow her businesses, Girlie has applied for a loan worth Php14,000. She will add this to her current capital in order to be able to purchase more cases of mineral water, additional LPG tanks, and sacks of rice. Girlie believes this loan will help her greatly in increasing her profits.

Girlie has the same challenges as the other micro entrepreneurs, such as irresponsible non-paying customers and tough competition. But being part of the fellowships in CCT* as a community partner enables her to find ways to solve and overcome these issues.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: additional cases of mineral water and three tanks of liquified gas

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

She has operated a food stall business, including fruit juice sales, for the past three years. She sells the food and juice in a shop, to her neighbours. Sultan faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice and fruit for making fruit juice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice and fruit for making fruit juice.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es: La señora Lilian V. V. tiene treinta años de edad, sólo ha estudiado la primaria, tiene dos hijos dependientes de 12 y 8 años, es madre soltera, vive a 8 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba en la zona de maica-quenamari ella se dedica al cuidado y producción de leche cruda y gracias a un oportunidad que se le presento, necesita capital de inversión, está comprando una vaca lechera más para su actividad, la misma que es de tradición familiar, desde pequeña ha trabajado con sus padres y tiene sus propias vacas.  Quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida para sus pequeños hijos los cuales aun van a la escuela.
texts.en: Sra. Lilian V. V., 30, only has a primary school education. She is a single mother of two children, aged 12 and 8 years. She lives 8 km from the city of Cochabamba in Maica Quenamari. She cares for milk cows and produces raw milk. Thanks to an opportunity that has arisen, she is buying one more milk cow, and needs investment capital. Dairy farming is a family tradition. Since she was small she has worked with her parents, and now she has her own cows. She wants to improve living conditions for her small children, who are still in school.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her dairy farm

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 57 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lolita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Lolita has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Nabiha

texts.en:
Nabiha is 52 years old and the married mother of four children. To help provide for her family, she has worked baking special village bread for the past nine years. Nabiha also sells vegetables. To invest in her shop and improve it, she is requesting a loan from the Kiva Partner Al Majmoua to buy cement and building stones for necessary design improvements. She would like to partition her shop to separate her businesses and also provide space to create an additional business that will be a good investment to improve her family's social and financial situation.

Nabiha is a hardworking woman with an excellent reputation. She works hard to provide her family with their basic needs. Nabiha hopes her children will one day know how much she loves them and will take good care of her when she gets old. In the future, Nabiha hopes to expand her business and bring in more employees to help her.

loans.use: to buy cement and stone to improve her bakery

loans.name: Celso David

texts.es:
Celso David tiene 31 años, es soltero vive con la madre y con no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS,	 se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Celso se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es casarse e irse de viaje.

Le gusta ver películas y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Celso David, 31, is single, has no children and lives with his mother.  He lives in the Ventanas Cantón in Provincia de Los Ríos.   

This communal bank is called UNIDOS VENCEREMOS and is located in Recinto La América in Ventanas Cantón.  Our bank focuses on short-term farming that includes planing corn, rice, and gandul beans.  Celso has worked as a farmer cultivating corn and rice for a long time.  Each month he makes purchases in Ventana and sells his products at the market there.  

He is taking out a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers knowing that the support of this loan will help him buy what he needs.  He deals with challenges like pests, crop diseases, and variable weather. Celso dreams of getting married and going on a trip.  He likes movies and sports.

loans.use: The purchase of seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Las Originales Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Originales lo conforman por tres mujeres trabajadoras y  emprendedoras. La coordinadora es la señora Juana de 51 años quien se dedica al comercio de calzado. Ella inicio su negocio hace ocho años vendiendo por encargo actualmente tiene un taller y vende por docena.

Las otras dos integrantes del grupo son Darling  quien desde hace más de tres años vende cosméticos Avon, marca de gran prestigio en Nicaragua y ropa  y Sonia  vende tortillas y frijoles cocidos.
texts.en:
The Originales group is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising women.  Juana, age 51, is the coordinator.  She sells footwear.  She started her business eight years ago; she sold by orders.  She currently has a shop, and she sells by the dozen.

Darling is another member of the group.  She has been selling Avon cosmetics, a very prestigious brand in Nicaragua, and clothes for over three years.  The other member of the group, Sonia, sells tortillas and cooked beans.

loans.use: to buy materials like leather, thread, and insoles, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, owner of Native Hand by Hand and Silver Fashions, comes from a family of artisans in Ecuador. Alongside her siblings and parents, she would spend 12 hours a day creating beautiful handmade clothing and jewelry and selling it at markets.  When she moved to San Francisco in 1985, she had to put her artisanal talents temporarily on hold as she cleaned homes to make a living. However, after she gave birth to her daughter in 1993, her commitment to family and her love for handicrafts led her to resume selling artisanal crafts.   

“When I gave birth to my daughter, I realized how important it was to be able to spend more time with her. I needed a job that would allow me to take care of my child.” 

As she had once done in Ecuador, Rosa began selling her clothing and jewelry in the streets of the Mission, a San Francisco neighborhood—but this time she is able to earn a living through the arts while working significantly fewer hours than she did as a child or in her career cleaning houses. 

“I work extremely hard. Owning my own shop gives me the freedom to create my own schedule and spend time with family, as well”, Rosa noted. 

Word of Rosa’s beautiful jewelry has spread over the years and her business has grown so much that she was able to open up a storefront right in the Mission, named Native Hand by Hand and Silver Fashions. But in 2009, when she wanted a loan in order to expand her business, she was considered “unbankable” by major banks because she did not have any credit history. After a friend referred her to Opportunity Fund, she used a microloan to buy more inventory. She was able to pay back her loan and increase her credit score to 727. Now she has established her credit history and become more integrated into the U.S. financial system.

Rosa wants to expand her business even more in order to pay for her daughter’s college and she needs a loan for $1,500 to purchase additional inventory for her store.  “I am so proud of my daughter for having graduated from high school this spring,” she said. But along with this joy comes the necessity of providing for further education. This second microloan will aid her in supporting her family and following her dreams by continuing to grow her business.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Rosa from  United States

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her store, such as jewelry and handmade crafts.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Gemma has a shop that sells beverages, snacks, & canned goods. She has had this business for 17 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks. 

Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, & snacks

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 46-year-old single man who has been selling coffee since 2010. He is a hard worker who tries his best to struggle for his living. Hussein is a well-known man, with good client service and he serves quality coffee. Hussein has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two consecutive cycles. His previous loan was used to improve his business and it had a positive effect on his social and financial situations. This time he's requesting the loan to buy a new espresso machine, in addition to increasing his tobacco capital. Hussein is working hard to expand his business, through increasing his machines and capital, and hopes to expand his place to a wide coffee shop, that attracts different populations.

loans.use: To buy a new espresso machine

loans.name: Marvin Adrian

texts.es: Marvin Adrián tiene 31 años, su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas, tiene más de dos años en esta actividad por lo que anteriormente quedo desempleado y no tenía la forma de mantener a su familia, la lucha constante que realiza en esta actividad ha hecho de Marvin un futuro empresario el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de maíz, cal, leña, bolsas plásticas entre otros. Uno de sus sueños es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en: Marvin Adrián is 31. His business is making and selling tortillas. He has done this for over two years, as before he was unemployed and had no way of supporting his family. This work is a constant struggle and is making him into a businessman. This loan is for the purchase of corn, lime, firewood, plastic bags, and other items. One of his dreams is to finish building his home.

loans.use: to purchase corn, lime, firewood, plastic bags, and other items.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Takku Liggey est créé depuis le 15 décembre 2008 lors de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois; il est composé de vingt femmes qui sont issues de différents quartiers de la ville mais qui se réunissent chaque mois pour leurs activités de commerce.

La présidente du Banc Villageois Fatou âgée de 44 ans,est une femme mariée mère de neuf enfants dont deux jumelles, elle a en charge une fille de sa sœur et une autre de sa cousine.Elle mène un petit commerce de tissus,encens,parfums, pâte alimentaires....elle a une bonne expérience de  dix ans. Elle est debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo habillée en vert fluo et a levé la main gauche.

Elle achéte ses produits au marché central de la ville et revend dans son quartier.
Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter une cuisinière pour faire de la pâtisserie puisqu'elle excelle également dans ce domaine.
Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille surtout pour la scolarité et le petit déjeuner des enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Takku Liggey was created on December 15, 2008 when the "Village Bank" was inaugurated. It is made up of 20 women who come from various neighborhoods of the town but who come together every month for their business activities. 

The president of the Village Bank, Fatou, 44, is a married woman and the mother of nine children with two sets of twins. She is also responsible for her sister's daughter and a cousin's daughter. She has a little business selling cloth, incense, perfume, pasta, etc. She has 10 years' experience. She is standing on the far right in the photo, dressed in fluorescent green and raising her hand.  

She buys her products at the central market of the town and sells them in her neighborhood. She wants to use her loan to buy a stove to make pastry since she also excels in this field. Her goal is to help her husband support the famiL., especialL. in terms of schooling and breakfast for the children.

loans.use: to buy a stove to make pastries.

loans.name: Enih

texts.en:
She was born in 1962. She has four children--only one of them is below fifteen years old. She lives with her family in Azire-Mankon, Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon. She went through a lot of trauma when she was attacked by armed robbers. She has also suffered ill health which led to an operation. Inadequate capital for her business has also been a major problem for her.

She joint GHAPE in 2008. She has received, and successfully repaid, Empowerment Credit two times. She invested these loans in her retail business where she sold food items like palm oil, garri, and kernel oil. She used the profit from these loans to buy some piglets and also to buy household utensils.

Given a loan, she plans to stock palm oil, garri, and kernel oil and to use some of the money for transportation. She is convinced that this loan will help her succeed because she has all the experience she needs in this line of business. Her activity will be of help to the community because it will reduce the distance people take to get to the market to buy food stuffs.

With the proceeds from this business, she will purchase a piece of land which she will subsequently use as a business site. She will also take care of her family’s needs and save some money for rainy days. She prefers a GHAPE loan because the method of repayment is easier, no collateral is required, and also because of the training GHAPE gives its members.

loans.use: To purchase oil, garri (tapioca), and kernel oil and to pay for transportation.

loans.name: Tito De Jesus

texts.es:
Tito es un señor de 22 años de edad, el cual vive con su familia, en una comunidad llamada el Upala de San Carlos, en la provincia de Alajuela. En Alajuela existen cinco parques nacionales, una reserva nacional de fauna silvestre, cinco zonas protectoras y varias reservas forestales. También en la provincia se ubica el Museo Juan Santamaría, el cual exhibe artesanías producidas localmente. Esta zona ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña.

Desde hace varios años que Tito de Jesús tiene este negocio de actividad agrícola, ya que cuenta en estos momentos con el propiedad que le heredaron sus padres, pero le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados. Dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante.

Actualmente Tito de Jesús está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢250.000 (doscientos cincuenta mil colones) para la compra de semillas de maracuyá. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Tito de Jesús es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Delirio, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Tito is a 22-year-old gentleman who lives with his family in a community called el Upala de San Carlos, in Alajuela province.  In Alajuela, there are five national parks, one national wild animal reserve, five protected areas and several forest reserves.  The Juan Santamaría Museum, which exhibits locally-produced handicrafts, is also located in this province.  This is the country's top coffee and sugarcane producing area.

Tito de Jesús has owned his farming business for several years.  He owns the estate his parents passed on to him but he lacks what he needs to boost his business and benefit the neighbors in his community.  He says that this current project interests him a lot.

Tito de Jesús is requesting a micro loan for 250,000 colones to buy passion fruit seeds.  He hopes that this will enable him to grow his business and improve both his own quality of life and that of his family.

Tito de Jesús is a member of the 'Delirio' Community Loan Company, one of EDESA's 110 member organizations in Costa Rica.  This will be his first loan and, with it, he hopes to continue growing both on a personal and financial level.  He also hopes to participate actively in his community's loan organization.

loans.use: to sow passion fruit

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced and has one child. She owns a small business selling thread and other supplies for knitting and sewing. Irina started this business 5 years ago when she was left without a source of income. Today, her profit is about 5,000 Grivnas a month.

Irina would like to borrow 7,000 Grivnas to purchase assorted stock. She hopes that a large assortment of goods will attract even more clients and increase sales.

loans.use: to purchase assorted stock to sell

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is married and has five children. She is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. Mila is a farmer and grows assorted crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 12 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase feed for her hogs as her new business. Mila has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 43-year-old married Kenyan lady with seven children. She is in the business of selling general items and cereals at her retail shop, and her customers are those living in the same neighborhood. 

The business is located in a commercial area. She hopes to grow her business into a wholesale one and her dream is to educate her children to the university level. 

The main challenge she faces is poor roads and that means delay with the delivery of her store's stock. She is using her loan of kes 20,000 to increse the stock of cereals in her shop. She is interactive and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy cereals for selling at her retail shop

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es: La Sra. Clementina  hace 15 años  que vive en la zona  de  San  José cerca  de la localidad  de el  Torno,  ella  se  dedica  a la  venta de comida y refresco  por mas de 7 años, su esposo es el señor Gonzalo el trabaja de guardia de seguridad en una institución de la ciudad de Santa Cruz. La señora se encuentra muy agradecida por el crédito ya que lo estaba necesitando para poder terminar de construir el baño de su casa y el saldo para capital de trabajo ya que se compra de ocasión otro carrito hamburguesito, se encuentra pasando la tercera secuencia con la institución es una buena clienta y se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Clementina has lived in San José, near the town of El Torno, for 15 years.  She has been selling food and drinks for more than 7 years.  Her husband is called Gonzalo and he works as a security guard in an institution in the city of Santa Cruz.

Clementina is very grateful for her loan which she needs to finish building a bathroom in her home.  She will use the remainder as working capital as she will buy another second-hand burger cart.  Clementina is in her third loan cycle with the institution.  She is a good client and feels grateful to the institution for the support that they have given her.

loans.use: to buy building materials for her bathroom and to use the remainder as working capital

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is a married man with four children who are enrolled in school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the family income. He owns a house with neither electricity nor running water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Kassim has operated a café for the past two years. His clients are his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge is the lack of storage for his stock of food. He dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase corn flour, wheat flour, sugar and rice for his café. He decided to join Yehu to acquire the funds to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase corn flour, wheat flour, sugar and rice for his café.

loans.name: Orsmak

texts.en:
Orsmak is 22 years old, and her husband, Sothea, is 27 years old. They live in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  They have been married since 2007 and have one young daughter. 

Orsmak and her husband sell rice and soft drinks from their home. They also grow rice during the rice farming season. 

Orsmak is applying for a loan in the amount of $500 to buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for her rice farming business.

In the photo, Orsmak and her husband and young daughter are at home.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 56 years old and married with three children.

Fatima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a wholesale retail of dry goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional dry goods to sell.

Fatima has borrowed and paid for eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the wholesale retail of dry goods for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Fatima aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.en:
Domitila is a 44-year-old single mother of 7.

She has been in business for the last 7 years from which she earns a monthly income of 3,000 KES. She is applying for her third loan of 15,000 KES. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

Domitila hopes to use the profits to open another grocery shop and to build her own business premises.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, potatoes, cabbages, and onions for sale.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina is a 39-year-old entrepreneur form Yerevan. She runs a little shop where she sells food. Irina would like to increase her sales and develop her business. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase some more inventory for the shop. This loan will help Irina to increase the business income and expand her shop in the future.

loans.use: to pay for inventory for her shop

loans.name: Paul Ricardo

texts.es:
Paul es un joven de 19 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Guadalupe, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima templado, así como también por que en esta ciudad de cultiva el limón, arroz, entre otros. Paul ha tenido muchas dificultades, en especial eocnomicas, es por ello que solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero a el le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Mecanica. Paul es muy trabajador, el se dedica a su trabajo como chofer de mototaxi, el ofrece sus servicios de transportes por todas las calles de su ciudad, y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar; Paul cree que el va bien en el trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y conduce con responsabilidad.

Paul está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general de su vehículo y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Paul is a 19-year old young man.  He lives in the city of Guadalupe, which is known for its temperate climate and for growing lemons, rice and other items.  Paul has had a lot of difficulties, in particular financial difficulties.  Because of that, he was only able to go to school through 5th grade.  He would have liked to have studied mechanics.  Paul is very hard-working and makes his living driving a "mototaxi" (a trike used to transport passengers).  He offers his transportation services all over his city.  With the fruits of his work, he helps his parents with the household expenses.  Paul believes work is going well for him because he is very friendly with his customers and he drives responsibly. 

Paul is very grateful for the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they provided him with, Paul will be able to provide general maintenance for his vehicle.  And he will then be able to improve his income and keep working toward making his biggest dream a reality, owning his own house.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en: My name is Maria G. I work selling products for home decoration and personal use like bath towels, tablecloth, bed sheets, curtains, pillow covers. I have my business for about 4 years, my clients prefer to buy my products because they have very good quality at low prices, my business produces income to support my family, my goal is to increase my inventory to have more sales and with the profit I get be able to buy a new sawing machine to elaborate my products and support my family.

loans.use: Will buy cups, glasses, towels, tables, tablecloth, plastic decorations.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a single mother of two children who are 19 and 25 years old. In August 2004, she began selling electronics and accessories. Adelaida rented a shop and began selling televisions and stereos by order. Over time, she realized that when people can see products in the store, the products sell more quickly. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $375 to buy a larger inventory, which will improve her sales and help her business to grow.

Adelaida is a very enterprising woman who needs your loan in order to get ahead and help her children by providing them with education so that they can have a better future. You can contribute to this family’s wellbeing. Decide to help them, they will be very grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Adelaida es madre soltera de dos hijos de 19 y 25 años. Inició en agosto de 2004 con la venta de aparatos electrónicos y accesorios para los mismos, para poder ofrecer sus productos. Adelaida rentó un local y empezó ofreciendo televisiones y grabadoras por pedido, con el tiempo se ha dado cuenta de que cuando los clientes ven los productos se venden de una manera más rápida, por lo que ahora solicita el préstamo de $375 dólares para la compra de mercancía, lo que hará incrementar su inventario, mejorar sus ventas y hacer crecer en su negocio.

Adelaida es una mujer emprendedora que necesita de tu préstamo para poder superarse y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos brindándoles educación para que puedan tener un mejor futuro, tú puedes contribuir a que ella y su familia tengan un mayor bienestar, decídete ayúdalos, te estarán muy agradecidos

loans.use: To buy product inventory

loans.name: Juana Jesus

texts.en:
My name is Juana de Jesus and I make bread and other bread products at home, which I deliver to people's houses in my community. I have been doing this for several years and it provides me enough income to support my family. Thanks to my business we can send our children to school, since my husband's income is only enough to buy food.

Mi nombre es Juana de Jesus, soy comerciante, mi actividad principal es la elaboración de pan y nacatamales, los que elaboro en mi casa de habitación y los distribuyo a domicilio en mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, gracias a estos ingresos podemos dar educación a mis hijos ya que con lo que mi esposo gana solo nos da para los gastos de alimentación.

loans.use: Purchase flour, eggs, margarine, butter, baking soda, vanilla,  cinnamon, and sugar.

loans.name: Oktay

texts.en: Oktay A. owns and operates a small fruit and vegetable stand at his local Bazaar in Khachmaz which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Oktay is looking for funding so that he can increase the quantity and variety of produce he has to offer to his customers.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of fruits and vegetables he can offer.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sinten

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Sinten is a pig farmer. Today she owns 2 piglets to be fatten, and 1 mother pig. Pig price condition are high today because of high demand. To fatten piglets it need 5-6 months time before it could be sold. Within a month to buy feed for thes pigs, Sinten spent RP90,000 (about US$10)/month. In 6 months Sinten could profit Rp200,000 (about US$220) from piglets that she has fatten. This profit was used by Sinten to finance family needs, saved, also as business capital. Sinten lives in a semi permanent building (hut) made from woven bamboos. Loan from DINARI will be used to buy a mother pig, with the hope to produce more piglets.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Ketut Sinten adalah seorang peternak babi. Saat ini baru memiliki 2 ekor babi penggemukan dan 1 ekor induk. Kondisi harga babi saat ini sedang tinggi karena banyaknya permintaan di pasaran. Untuk penggemukan biasanya membutuhkan waktu 5-6 bulan baru bisa dijual. Dalam 1 bulan, untuk membeli pakan babi-babi tersebut Sinten menghabiskan Rp. 90.000,- Dalam waktu 6 bulan Sinten mendapat keuntungan Rp. 200.000,- dari penjualan anak babi yang sudah digemukkan. Keuntungan itu dipergunakan Sinten untuk membiayai kebutuhan keluarga, ditabung dan juga untuk modal usaha. Sinten tinggal di sebuah rumah semi permanent yang bangunannya terbuat dari gedeg. Pinjaman dari DINARI digunakan untuk membeli induk babi dengan harapan induk babinya dapat menghasilkan lebih banyak anak babi.

loans.use:
To buy mother pig so that it could produce more piglets

Membeli induk babi, sehingga akan mendapat lebih banyak anak babi

loans.name: Sukmariah

texts.en: Sukmariah is 37 years old and she's married. She sells some snacks and beverages in a small shop. She usually earns an income of $10/day.  Since she has become a member of MBK, her income has eventually increased.  She would like to have a IDR 900,000 loan to complete her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To complete her shop

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is young entrepreneur and mother of two boys.  Two years ago, Loida had opened a small cafeteria in her community, but she had to close it because she didn't have access to capital to get raw materials and other goods to run the business.

A few months ago, she took her first loan from FSMA to start up her cafeteria.  She got her old customers back and attracted new ones.  Now her business is beginning to flourish.

Loida is requesting a second loan of $375 to purchase more materials and foodstuffs, which will improve her cafeteria, attract more customers and help her raise her children in a more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy needed materials for cafeteria business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 46 year-old Rehema M.. She is married with five children, aged between 13 and 27, and has two other dependents who are her niece and nephew. In 2004 Rehema established a shop selling general items, and now requires a loan of $1050 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her general store in bulk.

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en: Etibar D. is 42 years old and lives in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. He is married with two children. Etibar started raising cattle 8 years ago and would like a loan of $850 to buy another cow for his business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María R. is a strong woman who became a widow 15 years ago, being left to take care of her 4 children, to whom she always wants to give the best, on her own. Because she is the head of household, she started selling cosmetics door-to-door. Little by little, things started to turn around for her. She currently sells perfume and cosmetics in order to meet her customers’ demands.

Nevertheless, Ana María currently does not have enough merchandise to offer to her customers, which is why she is requesting a loan of $375.00 USD to be repaid in 6 monthly installments. With this money, Ana María will be able to move her youngest children forward because she would like to one day see them attend college. With your help, Ana María will be able to make her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana María R., es una mujer con mucha fuerza, Hace 15 años que enviudó quedando a cargo de sus 4 hijos. A los cuales desea brindarles siempre lo mejor. Debido a que ella es el sostén de su casa fue por lo que comenzó a vender cosméticos casa por casa. Y poco a poco fue cambiando su giro. Actualmente vende perfumes y cosméticos para poder complementar las necesidades de sus clientes.

Sin embargo actualmente Ana María no cuenta con la mercancía suficiente para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Ana María podrá sacar adelante a los hijos más chicos a quienes desea que estudien una carrera universitaria. Con tu ayuda Ana María logrará hacer su sueño realidad.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Kazija's Tusichukiane Group

texts.en:
Kazija is 38 years old and is married with 7 children, ages 12 to 20 years old. Kazija has been a food supplier since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Kazija now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have small businesses. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Kerelie

texts.en: Kerelie, a widow, is very thankful to Kiva for the previous loan.  Kiva's loan has helped her tremendously. From the profits, her family can now have food to eat and clothes to wear. Her business is progressing and she is sure, with Kiva, her life will be better. She has already completed paying her installments and is requesting another loan.

loans.use: To increase stock and income.

loans.name: Gezira 2019-B Group

texts.en:
Monica L., the group leader, currently has a business selling local brew and has applied for this loan in order to open up a bar. Monica is 40 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 7 and 27. Her husband is a teacher and her children of school age attend school. Each week, Monica makes approximately 30 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Monica is joined in her small group by Rose P., Tereza W., Jackline N., and Flora K.. Rose P. also sells local brew but would use her loan to buy flour. Tereza W. sells local brew as well and wants to buy firewood. Jackline N. has a business selling charcoal and wants to stock more charcoal. Flora K. sells bread and has applied for this loan in order to buy cooking oil to resell.

loans.use: To open up a bar

loans.name: Reine

texts.fr:
Ms. Reine A. was born on June 7, 1972 in Cotonou and in married to Dominique GOUSSI, an auto mechanic. This couple has in their care four children: Chantal (age 18) in 9th grade, Eric (age 13) in 5th grade, Gloria (age 9) in 4th grade, and Joinita (age 3). Ms. Reine A. sells various condiments in one of the municipal marketplaces in Cotonou called AÏDJEDO. She resides in Midombo, a district in Cotonou. She has been doing this work for six years. Thanks to her business, she helps her husband support the family. After her first loan of 60,000 francs CFA in 2007, her business experienced a remarkable improvement, and today she has many customers that she is unable to satisfy entirely, due to a lack of financial means. Also, she wishes to stock up in bulk. She is requesting her third loan to deal with the difficulties that she is experiencing in meeting the expectations of her numerous customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Dame A. Reine est née le 07/09/1972 à Cotonou et est mariée à GOUSSI Dominique électricien auto. Ce couple a à sa charge quatre enfants que sont Chantal 18ans et en classe de troisième, Eric 13 ans et en classe de CM2, Gloria 9 ans et en classe de CM1 et Joinita 3 ans. Dame A. Reine vend divers condiments dans l’un des marchés de la municipalité de Cotonou du nom d’ AÏDJEDO. Elle réside à Midombo un quartier de Cotonou. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 6 ans. Grâce à cette activité, elle vient en aide à son mari pour les charges de famille. Après son premier crédit de 60000 Fcfa en 2007, son activité a connu une évolution remarquable et aujourd’hui elle a de nombreux clients qu'elle n'arrive pas à satisfaire pleinement faute de moyens financiers. Elle souhaite également faire ses approvisionnements en gros. Elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour faire face aux difficultés qu'elle éprouve à satisfaire ses nombreux clients.

loans.use: To buy two boxes of tomato paste, two baskets of fresh tomatoes, a basket of fresh chili peppers, and other condiments

loans.name: Sanu Devi

texts.en:
Sanu Devi M., a resident of Thecho, lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two children. Her husband Mr. Sanjay M. is a carpenter. He opened his own furniture shop two years ago. He makes various kinds of furniture such as beds, chairs, tables, and drawers in his shop, according to the orders he receives from customers.

The demand for this furniture is increasing, so to meet the demand of the customers, he needs to purchase timbers but due to lack of funds, he is unable to purchase the timber. So Mrs. Sanu Devi is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 25000.00 to help her husband to purchase timber for his work because her husband's is the only source of income in her family.

Mrs. Sanu Devi has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 8 and her son is in grade 2.

loans.use: To buy timber for furniture-making

loans.name: Koffi Mensah Edem

texts.fr:
Monsieur Z. Koffi Mensah Edem, âgé de 27 ans est célibataire sans enfant. Il n’a pas fait de longues études. Il a eu très tôt le goût du commerce et s’est lancé depuis 2002. Ses pas l’ont conduit à installer un débit de boisson dans un coin animé de son quartier. Son affaire n’a pas traîné à prospérer.
Il se trouve souvent confronté à un manque de stock. Ainsi il a besoin de ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock par l’achat de 50 casiers de bière.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi Mensah Edem Z., 27, is single and has no children. He was not able to stay at school for long. He got into commerce at a young age and began work in 2002. Events led him to open a drinks depot in a busy corner of his neighborhood. His business soon began to prosper.

He often finds himself out of certain items. Thus, he needs this, his first loan to add to his inventory by buying 50 cases of beer.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 50 cases of beer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To replenish her small grocery store

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 4 hijos, tiene un copetín en su casa, donde atiende con sus hijos.

Comenzó a montar su pequeño copetín hace 4 años, ya que anteriormente trabajaba como vendedora ambulante.

Gracias a los créditos que recibió de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo aumentar sus ingresos, y ahora, tiene proyectado construir un salón más amplio para su negocio para lo cual esta juntando unos ahorros.

El destino que dará a este crédito que solicita será para la compra de mercaderías e ingredientes para preparar las ricas comidas que ella vende entre ellos pan, azúcar, sal, verduras, frutas, gaseosas, carne, chocho, arvejas, arroz, harina, huevos, etc.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana is from the city of Santani and she has 4 children whom she attends to at home. She also owns a vendor car that she started riding about 4-years ago; previously she had been working the cart on foot.

She is thankful to receive this loan from Fundacion Paraguaya which will increase her income and now she intends to build a bigger store with this pooled savings.

The goal of this loan is to be able to buy goods for ingredients to prepare tasty meals that she will sell. They include: bread, sugar, salt, vegetables, fruits, drinks, meat, chocho, peas, rise, flour, eggs and so on.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat, eggs, vegetables, fruits, drinks and etc...

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe tiene 55 años, es casado, tiene tres hijos, pero vive con su esposa y el último de sus hijos. El se dedica a su pequeña tienda, que con tanto esfuerzo logró adquirir hace 4 años, gracias al esfuerzo que puso en su actividad como agricultor. A Felipe  le agrada atender a las personas  y tener  un trabajo que no te demande demasiado  esfuerzo, sino que solo demanda tiempo, ya que dedica tiempo a su negocio le resulta  rentable, además  siendo  una de las pocas tiendas que  hay en la comunidad es mucho más  fácil obtener clientes  fieles. Aunque lo difícil es  tener que realizar las compras de los productos en la ciudad y  traerlas a su comunidad. Es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, nunca tuvo problemas en sus pagos respectivos. Felipe  invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de mercadería  para surtir su  tiendita que día a día va creciendo.
texts.en:
Felipe is 55 years old and married. He has three children, but only the youngest still lives at home. Felipe dedicates himself to the small store that he has, with substantial effort, built up over the last four years. Felipe enjoys attending to people and likes that while the store takes up a lot of his time the work itself is not physically demanding. With his dedication, Felipe's business has become profitable and because it is one of the few stores in the community, it has been relatively easy to build up a faithful client base. On the other hand, the most difficult aspect of his business is that he has to buy his supplies from the nearest city and transport them back to his community. This is his fourth loan from MFP and he has never had problems in making repayments on his earlier loans. Felipe will use the money to purchase merchandise to stock his little store that, day by day, continues growing.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarita B. is a tailor in the town of Tangal in Lalitpur District, Nepal.  Mrs. B. lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband, Mr. Rajip B., makes traditional brass religious statues. She has one son who attends pre-primary school.

Mrs. B. opened her tailoring shop 8 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular clothing like the Kurta Sulwar, blouses, ladies long dresses, and others. Now Mrs. B. is requesting a loan of NPR25000.00 loan to buy material for her work.

loans.use: To buy tailoring inventory

loans.name: Nouriatou

texts.fr: Née en 1970 à Badou et mère de quatre (04) enfants, Mme Nouriatou O. est une femme très dévouée et dynamique qui fait le commerce de légumineuses et ingrédients de cuisine (piments secs et verts, oignons, cubes…) et plusieurs autres articles de ménages. Très appréciée dans le marché de la place où elle exerce, elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner régulièrement en grande quantité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et s’occuper d’avantage de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Badou and mother of four children, Mrs. Nouriatou O. is a very dedicated and dynamic woman who runs a business selling edible plants and cooking ingredients (e.g., dried peppers and green chilis, onions, seasoning cubes) and various other household items. Highly thought of in the marketplace where she sells her goods, Mrs. O. is requesting a loan in order to be able to stock up with large quantities of goods on a regular basis. This will allow her to better meet the needs of her customers and take better care of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cooking ingredients

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 20 year old man who lives in the Bekaa. Mohamad has owned a clothing shop for four years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. 
His clients can be anybody. Mohamad decided on doing his business because it was his father business and his father has owned the store for over twenty two years, as well as his experience in sales. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Mohamad will use the loan to purchase new games for his shop.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua D. is 65 years old. She is widowed and the mother of seven children but currently all her children are fully independent. Afua has 8 grandchildren and she takes care of four of them. Her husband died through a prolonged sickness about 9 years ago. She has been very supportive in keeping their home through her current business. She lives with her grandchildren and her youngest child in a rented apartment in a town called Wasa Simpa in the western region of Ghana.

Afua has traded in coconut oil for 25 years. Coconut oil is produced from coconut fruits. She produces the oil and supplies it to food vendors to prepare their meals. She even treks to the villages to purchase the finished goods elsewhere when demand is very high.

Afua belongs to a village bank called "Joy." She hopes to receive GH¢400 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of coconut and an electric milling machine to increase her efficiency and produce larger quantities. She believes the loan will help expand her business to raise more income to support and to provide food for her family and finance an education for her youngest child and her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy more bags of coconuts and an electric milling machine

loans.name: Foluke

texts.en: Foluke sells provisions like noodles, milk, detergent, bathing soap, etc. She hopes to expand this business. Foluke is 40 years old and married with a child. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Tseelham

texts.en:
Tseelham J. lives with her husband and three children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All three of her children are high school students.

Tseelham has a small sewing shop. In 2004, she rented a small working space in the basement floor of an apartment building in the city. In Mongolia, it is common for apartment owners to rent out basement space for commercial use and it is usually the cheapest working space available. She sewed various clothes for children, using a manual sewing machine. After lots of hard work she has expanded the business by purchasing two automatic sewing machines. Her business capital has increased from 150,000 MNT ($1 USD=1500 MNT) to 1,800,000 MNT.

She requests a loan to purchase more raw materials for sewing traditional costumes. In April and May, there will be graduation ceremonies for colleges and universities. In Mongolia, it is a tradition for girls to wear traditional costumes during their graduation ceremonies, which causes demand for traditional costumes to spike. In the future, she would like to have her own work space, from which she could run her business more efficiently and comfortably.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials for sewing traditional costumes.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas A., 40, is married and is the father of five children: three sons and two daughters. His children study in primary and junior high schools. The last born is yet to start school. His wife trades in provision to make some income to support him financially. Thomas lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Takorase, a farming and trading community in the eastern region of Ghana.

Thomas repairs and mends bicycles in his community. He works with bicycle spare parts such pedals, seat, etc., in a shed by the road side. Thomas has been in the business for four years and wants a loan to buy bicycle spare parts to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama N. is a fifty-three year old woman. She is married and has eight children. Three of her children are currently in school. She lives with her family at Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and sells banku with fried fish. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers as this dish is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as breakfast, lunch as well as supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her income to support her children’s education. She has been in business for 20 years now. She belongs to the village called ‘St. Peter’s’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia U. is a 43-year-old married mother of two school-aged children, from the city of Dipolog. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Virginia joined Kiva partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan she has taken out with PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell in her general store

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella sells second-hand clothes and bags. Stella is 47 years old and married with 4 children. Stella hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more second-hand clothes and bags to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes and bags to sell

loans.name: Benkelema 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  dix femmes du groupe Benkelema 1 sont toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 30 ans, 3 enfants et  résident à Flacoda, un hameau de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région administrative (Sikasso) de la république du Mali, dans des familles traditionnelles élargies.Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne (prêt agricole)qui  cadre avec leur activité primaire, étant paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne après avoir remboursé  le premier sans aucune difficulté.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt, pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles envisagent exploiter 18 hectares en arachide, riz et mil et espèrent  sur  une production moyenne de 3 tonnes par hectare soit 54 tonnes.
Une partie de  la récolte sera consommée et le reste  stocké, puis vendu au comptant aux revendeurs et à quelques consommateurs.
Le bénéfice  sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, prendre en charge les frais scolaire, de santé des enfants et acheter les trousseaux de mariages des filles.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Benkelema 1 are all married and average 30 years of age and three children.  They reside in traditional extended families in Flacoda, a hamlet in the sub-prefecture of Fakola, prefecture of Kolondièba in the third administrative region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali.  They know one another through ties of kinship and community. With the introduction of farm loans (agricultural loans), which fit with their primary work, they being peasants, these women seized the opportunity and are now on their second farm loan after having repaid the first one without any difficulties at all.  The group members intend to use this loan for the costs of labor and weeding and for buying seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides.  They envision working 18 hectares of peanuts, rice, and millet and are hoping for an average production of 3 tonnes per hectare, thus 54 tonnes.  Part of the harvest will be consumed, and the rest will be stored and then sold in cash transaction to retailers and to some consumers.  The profit will be used to make loan interest payments, to cover the costs of schooling and healthcare for the children, and to buy wedding items and accessories for the daughters.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and weeding

loans.name: Nyame Ye Odo Group

texts.en:
The group leader is Beatrice.  Beatrice is 45 years old, divorced, and the mother of three children. All of her children are currently in school. She has been a food vendor for eight years. She prepares and sells apoti in her neighborhood. Apoti is prepared by pounding ripe plantain and mixing it with flour. It is enjoyed by most Ghanaians as an appetizer. She requests a loan that will be used to buy supplies in bulk, such as ripe plantains, flour, and vegetable oil. She will thus be able to prepare apoti in bulk. With the loan she will increase her earnings to save more for the educational needs of her children.  

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame ye odo’ which literally means God is love. She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. In this group, members commit to each other as social collateral to access the loan and apply peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy ripe plantains, flour, maize etc.	in bulk

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn G. is from the village of Landing, Camella Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old and married with one infant.  Merlyn has been selling both food and daily use products in the local community for more than a year, earning about 1000 PHP a month.

Merlyn recently joined HSPFI hoping to access financial services that will help improve her ability to engage in business activities, and therefore her living situation. Merlyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand her sale business.

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Mrs. Bora K. owns a pig breeding business. Her husband, Mr. Uk Borin, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She wants to expand her business by purchasing five more piglets for breeding and she will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer for the rice field.

Mrs. Bora Keanwas born in 1972 and she lives in Chuos village in Takeo province. She has three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school and the other stays at home to do the housework. Her husband is present on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for a rice field

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 40 years old and she is married with 4 children. she sells provisions in retail to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purhcase of colas

loans.name: Oscar Alonso

texts.es: Oscar Alonso Martínez tiene 35 años de edad, es un hombre casado y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Su actividad económica es una panadería la cual surge como una nueva fuente de ingreso para su familia. Este le ha permitido mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y brindarle un trabajo a su esposa en el mismo hogar lo que permite estar al cuidado de los niños el mayor tiempo posible, pero han  sufrido mucho con el alza de los precios en los productos ya que la harina  es indispensable para la elaboración del pan. Por esto es que solicita a Fundación León 2000 un financiamiento de manera que le permita comprar productos por mayor a un menor precio y así ofrecerles a sus clientes un precio justo. Los deseos de Oscar son aumentar sus ventas y mantener el núcleo familiar estable en todos los ámbitos.
texts.en:
Oscar Alonso Martínez is 35 years old, married, and has two young children. His business is a bakery, which is a new source of income for his family. It has allowed him to improve his quality of life a little, and offers a job to his wife in the same house, which allows her to care for the children for the most time possible. But they have suffered a lot with the rise in prices of the products, since the flour is essential for making of bread. For this reason, he is requesting from Fundación León 2000 financing in a way that will allow him to buy products in bulk at a lower price, and as such offer his customers a fair price. Oscar´s wishes are to increase his sales and maintain the stable family core in all environments.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Arcoiris Group

texts.es: El grupo “Arco Iris II” esta representado por la señora Durvin Gabriela y conformada por 17 miembros los cuales realizan diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta D. arena, cosméticos y perfume, pulpería, rebobinado D. balatas, comida, carpintería, ropa y calzado, abarrote, modista y a la atención en taller mantenimiento D. motos. Dentro del mercado hay mucha competencia pero ellas saben que si existe mucha oferta D. productos o deben diversificar su mercadería o mover sus puestos a otro lugar como ferias vecinales. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. D. mercadería para diversificar sus productos, la compra D. insumos para realizar sus productos al por mayor y la adquisición D. herramientas D. trabajo que ayuden a generar un mejor ingreso D. productos y mayor calidad en el acabado. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los socios ya trabajaron bajo la modalidad D. bancos comunales por lo que saben como administrar sus fondos para obtener un mayor beneficio y así poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida.
texts.en:
The “Arco Iris II” group is led by Durvin Gabriela and is maD. up of 17 members who engage in a variety of commercial activities like the sale of sand, cosmetics and perfumes, general stores, brake relining, food preparation, carpentry, clothing and footwear, grocery store, seamstress, and a motorcycle repair shop. There is a great deal of competition in the market but they are aware that if supply is great then they either have to diversify their product offerings or move their stands to other places like the neighborhood flea markets. The funds requested will be used to buy merchandise that will allow for diversification, to buy raw materials so that they can sell wholesale, and to buy work tools which will help them generate higher profits and better product quality. As far as their credit history goes, the members of this group have experience working with communal banks and know the operational methodologies so they are able to administer their funds well to get the greatest benefits from them thereby providing their families with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hewad Group

texts.en:
The Hewad group has three members: Naseer Ahmad, Hewad, and Samiulllah. They all live in district 3 in the city of Jalalabad. Naser is the group leader. He is 23 years old, married, and lives with his father, mother, and two sisters. He has a shop where he sells fresh fruit. He is a hard-working man, and with the income from his shop, he supports his family. When he gets the loan, he plans to start selling retail food. He hopes to have a good income and bright future.

Samiullah is the second member of this group. He has a retail food business. This is the only business that supports his family of three members.

Hewad is the third member of this group. He sells vegetables and is responsible for paying for all the expenses of his family.

They all have requested a group loan of 30000 Afghani to expand their businesses. They would like to say lots of thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Heliodoro

texts.es: El señor Heliodoro López, desde hace doce años se dedica a la agricultura, con sus propios esfuerzos logro establecerse una manzana de café, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son los recursos económicos para darle el mantenimiento que requiere la producción, un de los factores que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden, con el financiamiento va comprar fertilizantes e insumos para inducir.  Don Heliodoro habita en un barrio pobre de la Concepción Masaya, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como agricultura y comerciante, para apoyarle con los gastos básicos de agua, luz y otros gastos del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos de 25 ,20 y 16 años, los mayores ya son casados e independiente, el de 16 años actualmente estudiante de secundaria, los planes hacia su familia es apoyar en sus estudios a su pequeño y darle una mejor condición de vida para que sean un hombre de bien. Agrade por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic a través de los fondos Kiva; ya que son muchas las familias que se benefician y logran optar por un mejor bienestar ya que la crisis económica por la  que enfrenta el país, no le permite trabajar con sus propios recursos.
texts.en:
Señor Heliodoro López has worked as a farmer for twelve years and through hard work now has a plot of land on which he grows coffee. The biggest problem he faces is lack of money to keep production high. For example, insects and disease are a constant problem. As well, he needs cash to buy fertilizer and other items to help the plants grow. Heliodoro and his wife live in a poor neighbourhood called Concepción Masaya. She works as a farmer and businesswoman to help with basic household expenses such as water and electricity. They have three children aged 25, 20, and 16 years. The oldest two are already married and independent; the 16-year old is currently a secondary school student. Heliodoro wishes to help him with his education and give him a better life so that he can become a man of standing. Heliodoro is grateful to Kiva and its partner Afodenic for the loans which have benefitted many families and given them a better standard of living. Because of the economic crisis that the country faces, he would not be able to find the necessary resources to work his land without help.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer etc for his coffee plants

loans.name: Asana

texts.en: Asana, thirty years of age, is married and mother of three children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a tourist-attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana. As a result, the major occupation of the people is mainly fishing. Asana is a trader. She runs a provision store by the roadside in the community. She procures her goods from Accra. Asana has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions to resell

loans.name: Kakunama 2 Twetungure Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
T. Rose is the leader of her lending group in Ibanda. She is a friendly, determined and hardworking lady and is married with six children who are in secondary and primary schools. She also cares for two dependents.

Rose has had a retail shop as her business for eight years and, although she tries so hard to make it stand, she faces a challenge of bad debtors that take goods and fail or take very long to pay back. However, she is able to make 140,000/= in profits per month due to the good products and good customer care that keep on attracting more and more customers. Rose has a dream of expanding her business further so that she can have a very happy family in future.

Rose also has plantations and animals like cows and goats that she keeps and she is able to make monthly profits from the sale of produce that usually helps with expanding her businesses, taking care of her family, and paying her children’s school fees.

Rose needs another loan to be able to restock her retail shop with more goods like sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil and bread, plus buy more cows for her kraal’s (a fenced enclosure) expansion.

loans.use: To restock her shop and to buy more cows for her kraal

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es: Mujeres Victoriosas es un grupo integrado por cuatro mujeres luchadoras estas son Guadalupe del Carmen H. quien vende gaseosa, Concepción H. quien tiene una distribuidora de gaseosa y vende ropa por encargo, Joselyn Teresa M. vende ropa y zapatos y Ana L. quien también vende ropa.
texts.en:
"Mujeres Victoriosas" [Victorious Women] is a group made up of four determined women: Guadalupe del Carmen H. sells soft drinks, Concepción H. distributes soft drinks and sells clothing, Joselyn Teresa M. sells clothing and shoes, and Ana L. also sells clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 44 years old. He and his wife Agnes M. have 4 children who attend school.  He has operated a motorcycle transport business in the town of Naivasha since 1987.  He now wants to try his hand at poultry farming.  He hopes to sell the poultry to established hotels in town.

Geoffrey was introduced to KADET by a friend who knew he was seeking financing for this new venture. He finished the set training and applied for this loan, which will be his first with the organization.  His dream is to grow his poultry farming business and become one of the major distributors of poultry meat in Naivasha.

loans.use: to establish a poultry business as a secondary-income business

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina H. is from the village of Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Merlina is separated from her spouse and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Merlina owns & operates a a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Merlina has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Merlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Merlina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon, a 55-year-old man, is married and has three children in school.  He is a self-motivated man who has been running a pharmacy for fifteen years.  Besides the pharmacy, he also does farming for extra income. His wife is also a business lady. He says that since he joined Faulu Kenya, his living standard has improved. He has requested for a loan of KES 80,000 to add stock of medicine. He hopes to open other business outlets in the future. He sees himself expanding his business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: Add inventory for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio F. is from the village of Pag-asa, Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. He is 19 years old. Rogelio is single. To make a living, Rogelio owns and operates a service-based business using his motorcycle. The main source of income for the business comes rom providing transport services to local community members. Rogelio has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Rogelio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Rogelio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide better service

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora María Auxiliadora E. es trabajadora de la escuela Efrain Tijerino Mazariego de Chinandega se desempeña como maestra de primaria, es casada habita en el barrio Santa Ana, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.
  La señora María Auxiliadora E. tiene dos años de  trabajar con CEPRODEL, el crédito anterior lo utilizo para realizar unas mejoras en su casa de habitación y lo cancelo en tiempo y forma demostrando ser una persona responsable en cuanto a obligaciones y esta vez lo invertirá siempre en mejoras de su casa.
texts.en:
La señora María Auxiliadora E. es trabajadora de la escuela Efrain Tijerino Mazariego de Chinandega se desempeña como maestra de primaria, es casada habita en el barrio Santa Ana, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. La señora María Auxiliadora E. tiene dos años de trabajar con CEPRODEL, el crédito anterior lo utilizo para realizar unas mejoras en su casa de habitación y lo cancelo en tiempo y forma demostrando ser una persona responsable en cuanto a obligaciones y esta vez lo invertirá siempre en mejoras de su casa.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construcción (zinc, perlines, clavos, mano de obra

loans.name: Kimheng

texts.en: Mrs. Kimheng H. 65 years old and lives in Boeng Kandal Village, Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Peng Brich, are farmers who grow corn and rice on a four-hectare plot of land for a living. For her farm, Mrs. Kimheng H. decided to ask for a loan to purchase corn seed and fertilizer and to hire laborers to plow her farm. This couple has four children; one is employed in a casino club, one is a farmer, and the other two are students in the local school and also help with their parents' farm. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To purchase corn seed and fertilizer and to hire laborers to plow her farm.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan y su esposa son productores lecheros. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad de Tahari – Achacachi Prov. Omasuyos a 2 horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera para  incrementar su producción de leche.
 
Es su segundo crédito con IMPRO. El buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Hernan and his wife are dairy producers. This activity is the main source of the income they use to support their family. Their home is located in the community of Tahari - Achacachi, in Omasuyos Province, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. Hernan will use the loan to buy a dairy cow, in order to increase his milk production. This is his second loan with IMPRO. His excellent payment history qualified him to apply for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a dairy cow

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa B. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 25 years old, is married, and has four infant children. Luisa owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling flowers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Luisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Luisa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines.
