It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Copo De Nieve Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer German Busch, se reúne la Asociación Comunal COPO DE NIEVE, con 8 integrantes 

Una de las integrantes es Barbara V. de 34 años, casada  y madre de 4 niños. Tiene el negocio de fabricación y venta de alfombras hace 15 años, y con el préstamo tiene planificado comprar material de trabajo como hijos e hilacha, le colaboran en el negocio sus hijos y su mamá. 
Las demás integrantes de éste grupo cuentan con variados negocios y necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería, materia prima según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
In one of the central offices of Pro Mujer in German Busch, the communal bank "Copo de Nieve" meets. The group has 8 members. One of the members is Barbara V.. She is 34 years old, married, and is the mother of 4 children. She has had a business making and selling rugs for 15 years. With the loan she plans to buy materials for her work such as yarn and fabric remnants. Her children and her mother also participate in this business. The other members of this group have a variety of businesses, and they need this loan to buy merchandise and raw materials according to the type of business that they have.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw material (yarn)

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Шерматова Мавчуда проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 40 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном продает фрукты. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Mavjuda S. lives in the town of Kulob. Age: 40 years. Married, with four children. Education completed: secondary. She has been a vendor at the local market for over five years. She mostly sells fruits. She is taking out a loan in order to increase her stock level.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her stock level

loans.name: Daudi

texts.en:
Daudi is a farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been operating his mixed farm for 20 years and has employed two people from his community.  His main produce is tea which he sells to the  Kenya Tea Development Authority and Finlays Company. He also produces milk which he sells locally. He has established a poultry project and runs a hotel in the same area. 

Daudi is 51 years old. He is married with 7 children between the ages of 3 and 35. Six of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.30,000 to purchase and feed a dairy cow. The extra income earned from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children in school and expand his farming business. He faces the challenge of lnsufficient capital to expand his activities.

In the future, he would like to expand his business, build his own house and educate his children well. He is grateful to Juhudi for giving him a loan and expects to repay it and get another loan.

loans.use: To purchase and feed a dairy cow.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad R. is from the village of Unidos. She is 60 years old and is married with eight adult children.

Trinidad owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Trinidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “HATUN SONCCO ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Margarita; ella tiene 48 años de edad, es  casad y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a  la venta de comidas, la socia vende huevos con papa y aji por las mañanas en el mercado ella está en la sección de arroz con huevo  y ella también  alterna sus actividades  con el  hogar, La socia desea que sus hijos por los cuales trabaja tanto terminen sus estudios en el instituto y en la universidad para que tengan mejores posibilidades en la vida.   La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes para su negocio de comidas que irá diversificando.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Hatun Soncco communal bank. The bank is located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Cusco Department. The member is Margarita; she is 48 years old, married, and has 2 children. She works selling foods. She sells eggs with potatoes and garlic in the mornings at the market. She is in the section for rice with eggs, and she alternates her activities with responsibilities at home. The member wants her children, for whom she works so hard, to finish their studies at the institute and the university so they have better options in their lives. She is asking for the loan to invest in buying ingredients for her food business, which she will be diversifying. Margarita is grateful for and appreciates the loan granted her through this medium, and she promises to make her loan payments as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to diversify her food sales business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years-old and a member of the Happy Women group from Kiva partner Faulu Kenya.  

She is a tailor who mainly makes and sells children’s outfits.  Most of her customers are her neighbors and friends.  Her husband is a waiter in a restaurant in the city centre.  She has requested a loan of 15, 000 Kes which she will use to buy fabric.  In the future, she hopes to provide a good education for her children.  In ten years, she wants to start a tailoring school.  She describes herself as a hardworking and aggressive business-lady.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Bujaga Farmers, Bushenyi Group

texts.en:
In this world, one needs a pinch of extra effort and hard work to earn a living, especially in this era of stiff competition. To maximize on this point, one M. Topha, aged 46, who studied carpentry, has been running a carpentry workshop for close to 7 years where he makes windows, chairs, tables, doors and many other more products for customers. This business is located in Ishaka, Bushenyi district.

Having had this enterprise alongside his farming practices which earn him an additional income, he is seeking this loan to help him purchase materials including timber, nails, covering cloth and leather covering materials for chairs. This will help him to improve the quality of his products on the market and get him more customers thus more revenue. 

He belongs to Bujaga Farmers group, Bushenyi.

loans.use: Purchasing materials including timber, nails, covering cloth and leather covering materials for chairs

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita M. is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 51 years old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Merlita owns a business  providing manicure and pedicure services. She has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Merlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena L. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 34 years old. Elena is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Elena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Toir

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Тоир проживает в районе Фархор. Возраст, 23 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Два года как занимается торговлей. У него имеется собственная торговая точка, где он продает муку и картошку оптом. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Toir Abduloev lives in the Farhor region. He is 23 years old. He is married and has two children. He has secondary education. He has been selling for two years now. He has own vendor space where he sells flour and potatoes in wholesale. He is taking out the loan to increase circulation and sales.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: To make a living, Rosemarie G. raises and sells pigs. She is 37 years old, married and has four school-aged children. They are from the village of Poblacion, Kadingilan, Bukidnon. Rosemarie has been in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rosemarie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Gina Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MI PERU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Gina; ella tiene 27 años y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche,huevos y golosinas como galletas ,dulces entre otros mas,la socia es una persona muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante siendo este su medio de salir adelante por su hijo. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar mas su tienda de abarrotes. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Gina belongs to the “MI PERU” (My Peru) community bank which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name.

Gina is 27 years old.  She is single and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store where she sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk, eggs, candies and cookies.  She is a very enterprising person and has a great desire to get herself and her son ahead in life.

She is requesting this loan to improve her grocery store.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To improve her grocery store

loans.name: Ulziiburen

texts.en:
Ulziiburen S. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in her sister's house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Both of her sons attend a secondary school, while her husband operates a meat trading business after having sold their house. Ulziiburen operates both a dairy products and a newspaper trading business in a rented stall at the grocery shop next to the bus station of Bayanzurh district.

In 2000, after moving from the countryside, she started her business by selling a variety of goods in Narantuul, Ulaanbaatar's largest and main market. After many years of operation, she has built a stable and successful operation. For the future, Ulziiburen plans to have her own grocery shop. A modest and open-minded person who says, “All I want is to have our own apartment where my family can live in a comfortable space, ” she is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more dairy products and fruits to sell at her stall for profit.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products and fruits to sell

loans.name: Pol

texts.en: Pol R., 58, lives in the province of Kompong Tom, and he six children, one is married, and is employed in garment factory as a sewing worker. The remaining five are single, and one of them is working in restaurant next to the local market. Pol R. can live in simple life because of selling firewood which he buys fR. other villagers in the bulk with low price and then sells out to gain profit. Pol R. could get an income fR. this carrier averaging $2 per day to support in his family with daily expense. Pol R. has no a life partner because he was divorced fR. his wife for years. Nowadays, Pol R. is seeking for a loan to buy two cows which can be rented out to farmers for additional income. The cow can also be used for breeding purposes so he can also raise its offspring. That is the reason why Pol R. would like to borrow a loan fR. Kiva.

loans.use: To buy two cows which can be rented out to farmers for additional income. The cow can also be used for breeding purposes so he can also raise its offspring.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de emolientes y mates, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria tiene una carreta, ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta emolientes y mates.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los mates y emolientes.              

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "MADRES TRABAJADORAS" (WORKING MOTHERS) communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco in Cusco Province in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Alejandrina is 33 years old, lives in a common-law arrangement and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling emollients and infusions.  She peddles her products from a cart that she uses for her sales, working from 5:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She wishes to expand and improve her current business.  She plans to use the loan to buy more ingredients for her emollients and infusions.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make infusions and emollients

loans.name: Mrs. Siek Thy Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of eighteen people who live in Trapeang Young village in Takeo province. Mrs. Siek T. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members who will each use their portion of the loan in varied ways to support their families. She is a weaver who can earn some money from selling silk cloth to support her family. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Siek T. is applying for a loan to buy more silk for weaving. Her husband, Mr. Tet In, is a laborer and a driver. This couple is bringing up four children, one of whom is a laborer, while the others are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people have formed a village bank loan in Kbal Kaoh village in Kandal province.

Mrs. Sok K. was born in 1954 and is the village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice for a living.  Her husband, Mr. In Sorin, was born in 1950 and works as a teacher.   He is able to earn a small salary to help support his family. This couple has two children: One is a photo designer, and one is working in Acleda bank and also studying. 

With her child studying, she now faces a problem because she doesn’t have enough money to pay for school fees.   She asks for a loan to pay for her child's school fees.

loans.use: To pay for her child's school fee.

loans.name: Siguidiale Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe SIGUIDIALE, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 36  ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Sirablekoro, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de pâte d’arachide, d’oignons, de céréales, du bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois.                                                                                      
Les femmes du groupe SIGUIDIALE sont à leur quatrième prêt. 
KADIA D. compte acheter une importante quantité de condiments alimentaires avec les grossistes des villages environnants. Elle effectue les ventes dans le village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Siguidiale group are all married 39 year olds with five children each. They all live in large traditional extended families in the village of Sirablekoro, in the Koulikoro region (the second largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They met through family and friendship links. They sell condiments, peanut butter, onions, firewood and charcoal. 
The women of the Siguidiale are on their fourth loan. 
Kadia D. aims to purchase a large quantity of condiments from the wholesalers of the nearby villages. She sells her wares for cash and credit sales in the nearby village, to a customer base made up of men and women. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 75 000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, for social ceremonies and to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: Purchasing condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 20 logs of firewood for sale.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is married and has one child who is still underaged.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Jamila has been operating a tailoring business for the past four years from a shop where local residents are her potential customers. In addition to the tailoring shop, she also operates a boutique to contribute to her income. Jamila faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the festive season she gets a lot of clients and earns more profit from the business. She dreams of establishing a boutique and dressmaking school in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 60,000 Jamila wants to purchase bundles of leso’s and cloth materials to sell. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: purchase leso’s and cloth materials to sell in her shop

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Maria tiene ya más de un año dedicándose a la venta de ropa nueva y usada a fuera de su vivienda.
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir. Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo.
Su propósito es tener ropa de buena calidad, para toda la familia, diferentes estilos y así poder tener más clientes y que la puedan recomendar con sus amigos y conocidos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio, ya que su esposo Gerardo se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Ana Maria has been selling new and used clothing from outside her home for more than one year.  Her business needs a greater variety of merchandise but she doesn't have the money she needs to invest.  This is why she is requesting a loan.

Ana Maria's goal is to have good-quality clothes for all the family, in different styles, and thereby attract more customers who will recommend her to their friends and acquaintances.  She plans to make her loan repayments from the profits she makes in her business since her husband Gerardo will take care of their family expenses with the income he makes from his job.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María es una pequeña comerciante, con su propio negocio de elaboración de espejo y cuadro de pinturas de oleo. Pues lleva más de ocho años trabajando en este negocio para el bienestar de económico de sus cuatro hijos.
Es atreves de Afodenic que aumento su negocio al elaborar más productos lo que han aumentado sus ventas. Así como la captación de clientes. Hoy con este nuevo préstamo podrá elaborar diez juegos de espejo estilo pata de león, así como marcos variados para la elaboración de cuadros.
texts.en:
María is a small merchant.  She has her own mirror manufacturing and oil paintings framing business.  She’s been in this line of work for over 8 years for the benefit of her four children.

Through Afodenic she enlarged her business making more items that have increased her sales and brought more customers.  With this new loan she will be able to make ten lion’s paw style mirrors as well as assorted picture frames.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make ten mirrors.

loans.name: Kambuga Bakyara Kwekamba Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Mary S. is the leader of Kambuga Bakyara kwekamba group in Kihihi. She is 52 years old and married. Her 3 children all go to school. Mary has been in the business of selling produce, mainly cereals, from Kambuga and Nyarutojo, for a period of 10 years. She sells to the local community and she is able to generate 100,000 weekly. She also has a restaurant from which she gets an additional income. 

To start the produce selling business, Mary used her own harvests and she has expanded the business over time. She is very hard working and her dream is to educate her children to higher levels and to expand her produce business. The loans have improved Mary's working capital and she needs a loan to be able to buy more cereals for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cereal to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is living in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Gtashen.  Anna was born in Gtashen and enjoys the nature, fresh air, and being close to her extended family.  Anna and her husband have been working on the family farm for the past twenty years.  She is very proud of her two sons (twenty-two and twenty-three years old) and looks forward to having grandchildren.  Anna would like a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel.  She expects this investment in her business to increase the family income by twenty percent.  With microfinance services, she plans to continue expanding the family business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora María Mercedes, vive en Morelia Municipio de Coapilla, ella es casada con el señor  Galileo, con quien procreo tres hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad.
    Ella es la  tercera vez que solicita un préstamo con Fundación Realidad y esta vez es para invertirlo en a compra de mercancía para surtir subtienda de abarrotes, en donde comenta que  a pesar que lleva  un año con ello le va bien ya que  ve que le está dando u buen resultado.
    En ello se inspiro por si sola ya que es un negocio bueno que le  dejara un buen ingresos en su hogar, con ello podrá seguir trabajando con le préstamo que ha estado solicitando.
    Su más grande seo es que con esta actividad y el préstamo, pueda  trabajar para tener sus propios a horros para sostener a su  familia y así poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
María Mercedes lives in Morelia, in Coapilla.  She is married to Galileo and they have three children who are still in their care.

This is the third time that María has requested a loan from Fundación Realidad.  She will invest her loan in buying merchandise with which to stock her grocery store.  She tells us that, in spite of the fact that she has owned her business for just one year, it is doing well and she can see that it is providing her with good results.

María made the decision to start her business as she knew that it was a good business which would make her good income for her household.  The loan that she has requested will enable her to continue working.

María's biggest wish is to be able to work (with her business and her loan) in order to build her own savings with which to support her family and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sugar, eggs, oil, beans, milk and other products with which to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
This is Jesusa, 49, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Domingo, a vendor. She has four children; all now have their own families. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.

Jesusa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Jesusa earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 386 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jesusa hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Cheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheap has been operating a crop-planting business since 2000 in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. She is a local cultivator and is earning an average of $2 a day. Other income comes from her husband’s occupation as a domestic construction worker. He makes around $3 a day to participate with Mrs. Cheap in covering the family’s daily needs. 

Presently, they always hire a motor taxi when they need to go anywhere as they don’t have their own vehicle. So Mrs. Cheap would like to take out a loan in order to purchase a used motorbike for their traveling needs; it can save money spent on motor taxi service. She hopes to use the remainder of the cash to pay for plowing and harvest costs.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorbike for their traveling needs and pay for plowing and harvest costs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy palm nuts.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a hardworking and ambitious businessman. He is married and blessed with four children who are school-going. For the last 11 years, he has been offering laundry services to make his living and he supplements this with the income he earns from farming. Previously, he used to work as a carpenter. He wants in the next five years to have opened up other branches so that he is able to realize his dream of owning a dry cleaning company. He is requesting a loan of a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dry cleaning machine. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for inculcating in him the saving culture.

loans.use: to buy a dry cleaning machine

loans.name: Chinh

texts.en: Chinh is a 59-year-old widower living in Ho Chi Minh city. He has 4 children. Chinh earns an income to support his children by running a business that specializes in laminating papers and objects with plastic. Chinh has been in the plastic lamination business for 7 years. He plans to use this loan to buy more plastic and other materials to expand his business by offering a greater range of lamination services and increasing the capacity of his business. Chinh hopes that through this loan he will be able to increase his income and better support his children.

loans.use: to buy more plastic and other materials

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 35 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is widowed and has 4 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Florence has a business of a small retail shop, which she has had for 4 years.         

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities, like sugar, for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Florence hopes to expand her business.     Florence is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities, like sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Luz Marina; tiene 31 años de edad,  la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 1 hijo de 9 años de edad; La socia es comerciante minorista, la socia  trabaja con animales  menores y vacunos, ella también produce lácteos los cuales lleva  a vender a las diferentes ferias y algunas veces los trae a la ciudad del Cusco, la socia  tiene entre sus animales menores, la crianza de cuyes, aves de corral y chanchos, ella también tiene vacas y la leche que estas producen las lleva  a vender, la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de alimento para los animales y también comprar sales minerales y vitaminas para sus vacas lecheras, la socia también desea invertir en la compra de animales menores como pollos para criarlos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento  para sus animales como sales minerales y vitaminas.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Solidaridad-Cachimayo communal bank, located in the district of Cachimayo, in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

Luz Marina, 31, has a live-in partner and a 9-year-old son, and works as a retail merchant.  She works with small animals and cattle, and also produces milk, which she takes to different markets and sometimes to the city of Cusco to sell.  Among her small animals, she raises guinea pigs, poultry, and pigs.  She also sells the milk that her cows produce.

Luz Marina needs the loan to buy feed for the animals and also to buy mineral salts and vitamins for her dairy cows.  She also wants to buy small animals to raise, such as chickens.  She is requesting the loan to buy chickens and feed for her animals as well as mineral salts and vitamins.

Luz Marina is grateful for the support that will be granted to her and also is committed to being disciplined in making the payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed, mineral salts, and vitamins for her animals.

loans.name: Amanecer Mercedes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMANECER DE MERCEDES” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Luz Karina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de bisutería y juguetería, venta de medias, comerciante, tejido a macramé, tienda de barrio, artesanía, cerrajería, repostería.

La señora Luz Karina,  indica hace cinco meses que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de respoteria o panadería que viene trabajando hace veinte y un años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de herramientas eléctricas para la panadería), que comprara de la Ceja y posteriormente la elaboración de sus productos los venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta sacar dinero rápido.

En la fotografía no aparese la señora Gloria, ya que se encuentra en consulta medica.
texts.en:
The “Amanecer de Mercedes” (Dawn of Mercy) communal bank is beginning its 2nd cycle of loans with Pro-Mujer (Pro-Woman), as part of the Centro Cascada (Cascade Center). The bank is composed of 8 members and is directed by a board headed by Luz Karina. The businesses pursued by members of the communal association are varied. Among them we have: selling costume jewelry and fruit juices, selling hose, a merchant, making macrame, a neighborhood store, making artisan crafts, a locksmith shop, and a confectioner's shop.

Luz Karina has been with Pro-Mujer for 5 months, having been invited by a promoter. At present, she has a confectioner's shop, or bakery, which she has operated for some 21 years.

The loan she now seeks is for buying electrical equipment from La Ceja for the bakery. With this she will bake her products and sell them by order. This form of work allows her to generate resources to help her family as much as possible, since she is single and has 4 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro-Mujer, Luz Karina said she likes the rapid access to funds.

In the photo, the member Gloria is not present due to a medical consultation.

loans.use: to buy electrical equipment for her bakery.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is taking a loan of 30,000 KES. With the loan she intends to establish a hardware business to earn more profit and improve her living conditions. She wants to purchase lumber for the hardware business. Elizabeth dreams of expanding her hardware shop to a wholesale store in the future.

loans.use: To purchase lumber for her hardware business.

loans.name: Olga

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia  do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais dois ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 3ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais dois sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 

Possui uma residencia que faz aluguer ha mais de 2 anos, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 2.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua segunda casa (ferro, areia, pedra, cimento e outros).  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para ampliar a sua casa e mobiliar.
texts.en:
Olga was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. She is married and has five children, two of whom are still in school. She attended school through the eleventh grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports two nephews who live with her.

She's had a guesthouse for more than 2 years and earns about 2,000 meticals a month. She uses her earnings for household expenses and is able to save some in her bank account (BIM).
She's never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 12,000 meticals, which she will use to purchase construction materials (iron, sand, stone, cement, etc.) to build her second house.
She is committed to paying off this loan in full and on time, and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to expand her house and furnish it.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (iron, sand, stone, cement, etc.) to build her second house.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 32 years old and single. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for the past four years. She gets a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from the business.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to purchase charcoal for resale. She will reinvest in her business the anticipated profit she will get.

Her dream is to have a stable income by being the best charcoal supplier on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: to purchase stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOQ ALLPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Kelly; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de libros, ella tiene un local donde vende libros escolares, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia también se dedica a vender productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas y lápiz labiales, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de libros y negocio de venta de productos de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar libros al por mayor y también para comprar perfumes, cremas y lápiz labiales al por mayor. 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “MOSOQ ALLPA” communal bank, which is located in Cusco district, part of Cusco province and department.

Sra. Kelly is 40 years old and married with three children.  She divides her daily activities between two jobs. She has a shop where she sells school books from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. and she also sells beauty products such as perfume, face creams and lipstick. Through these businesses she is helping her children get ahead and she would like to expand and improve both of them. She is requesting a loan to purchase books as well as perfume, face cream and lipstick, wholesale.

Kelly is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy books wholesale as well as perfume, face cream and lipstick.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single mother of one child who is enrolled in school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her child. 

Beatrice has operated a tailoring business for the past ten years.  Her potential clients are her friends, relatives and passers by. She faces a major challenge of competition from other tailors. She dreams of establishing a design school.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase more stock of fabrics and linings for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of fabrics and linings for her business.

loans.name: Goharik

texts.en: Goharik lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Totosgyugh.  Totosgyugh is her birthplace and most of her relatives live close by.  Goharik is happily married with four children: three daughters (27, 30, and 33 years old) and a 21-year-old son.  She has a high school education and has been farming for the past 22 years.  She dreams that all her children will have happy, healthy lives.  Goharik has also been trying to save money to renovate the family home.  She is looking for a loan to purchase seeds.  Her investment should increase the family income by 20%.  She has invested her own capital in the business and wants to increase this investment.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Gbenassou Gilbert

texts.fr: Gbenassou Gilbert est âgé de 46 ans et est marié à une marchande du nom de Béatrice. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et à charge. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge, en dehors de leurs enfants. Gbenassou Gilbert vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Gbenassou Gilbert n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Depuis dix sept ans environs, Gbenassou Gilbert exerce l’activité de meunier dans un marché du Bénin, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille. De façon secondaire, Gbenassou Gilbert  fait l’élevage de porcs dans sa région. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité par l’acquisition d’un nouveau moulin à maïs et des pièces de rechanges nécessaires au bon fonctionnement de son moulin, Gbenassou Gilbert sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce quatrième prêt lui permettra certainement de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle dans un bref délai. Les trois premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Gbenassou Gilbert is 46 years old and married to a trader called Béatrice. The couple have 3 children, some of whom are going to school and are in their care. They are also raising another child who is not theirs. Gbenassou Gilbert lives together with his wife and children, and the couple both take care of the household expenses.

Gbenassou Gilbert did not go to school. He has been a miller for around 17 years and carries out his business in one of Benin´s markets. His income allows him to take care of his needs and those of his family. He also has a sideline business breeding pigs in his local area.

Gbenassou Gilbert is requesting a 4th loan from ALIDé in order to buy a corn mill and the necessary spare parts for it, so that he can increase his level of business activity. This loan will enable him to better fulfill customer demand within a short time period. He has fully repaid his 3 previous loans.

loans.use: to buy a corn mill and spare parts.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen (in the photo) and her husband, Chann, live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one daughter who is in school. 

Yen sells Khmer noodles; she buys Khmer noodles from her village and transports them to sell in other villages. Her husband assists his wife in the business. Yen is asking for a loan of $500 to buy the neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.use: To buy the neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 68 years old and is married to Ngila. They have four children. She has been operating a small scale poultry farm for the past 16 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 5000.

She is applying for her sixteenth loan with KADET ltd of Kes 20,000. She will use the funds to purchase chicken and poultry feeds. With the anticipated profits she will pay her children's school fees.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a large scale poultry farm.

loans.use: To buy extra chicken and poultry feeds

loans.name: Jesudegbe Group

texts.fr: JESUDEGBE est un groupement composé de vingt neuf personnes qui sont résident dans un même quartier. Christine, la représentante du groupement (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 25 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Christine est mariée à un chauffeur nommé Mathias. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à sa charge.  Christine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Christine vend du maïs, du riz depuis dix ans. De façon secondaire, Christine vend également des tissus ; ce qui lui permet de répondre facilement aux besoins de ses enfants. Christine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Christine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement JESUDEGBE un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, du riz te des tissus.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Mrs. Elena is an entrepreneur, and an intelligent and hard-working woman. She is 47 years old and she has 5 beautiful boys. Two of them are married, while others are studying at the university. She wants to offer them an education because she wants them to be honest, working people so that this was the incentive to begin her own business. Now, she has been working in this for more than 11 years. Mrs. Elena works in used clothing sales and novelties, her job has allowed her to pay for the university of her two older boys and at this point they have finished their program. However she still has 3 boys and there are many expenses for her home. Mrs. Elena just requires your support of $925 USD to purchase merchandise that allows her to have a bigger quantity of her products. She hopes her sales will increase and her income will be bigger. You can support to Mrs. Elena with the boys\' education; they thank you for your caring and support.

This text has been translated from the following original business description in Spanish.

Doña Elena es una mujer emprendedora, inteligente y trabajadora, tiene 47 años y tiene 5 hijos de familia. Dos de sus hijos están casados, mientras que otros están estudiando la universidad. Ella quiere ofrecerles una educación para que en el futuro sean personas honestas y trabajadoras por lo que bajo este incentivo inicio su propio negocio hace más de 11 años. Doña Elena trabaja en la venta de ropa usada y novedades, su trabajo le ha permitido pagarles la universidad ya que dos de sus hijos, actualmente terminaron su carrera. Sin embargo aún faltan 3 y los gastos del hogar son muchos, por lo que Doña Elena solo requiere de un apoyo de $925 USD para comprar mercancía que le permita tener una mayor cantidad de sus productos, ya que de esta forma ella espera que sus ventas se incrementen y sus ingresos sean mayores. Apoya a Doña Elena con la educación de sus hijos; ellos agradecen tu cariño y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Glenda Experanza

texts.en:
I live in the city of Choluteca, and I sell used and new clothing. I offer my customers two options since some do not have sufficient resources to purchase new clothes. Together with my husband and two children we seek to expand our house. At this moment--thanks to God--my husband has a job, and, with my sales, together we supply and cover all the familial necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Vivo en la ciudad de Choluteca y me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, tengo dos opciones para mis clientes ya que algunos de ellos no tienen suficientes recursos para poder comprar ropa nueva, entonces me compran ropa de segunda. Mi familia es de dos hijos, mi esposo juntos hemos buscado la manera de sacar adelante mi hogar, gracias a Dios en este momento mi esposo tiene trabajo y con mis ventas suplimos y cubrimos todas las necesidades familiares.

loans.use: Purchase towels, shirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Reina Aurora

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Reina Aurora, I'm a salesperson. For the past three years, I've had a small shop in my own home that sells candies. I have a lot of customers, since my shop's location is excellent. Thanks to this business I can help with my family's and supplier's expenses.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Hola mi nombre es Reina Aurora, soy comerciante, tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas ( productos para consumo Humano) en mi casa de habitacion desde hace 3 años, cuento con buena clientela, tomando en cuenta que la ubicación de mi negocio es exelente, gracias a este negocio puedo colaborar con los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores.

loans.use: Purchasing meats, lard, potatoes, condiments, oil, etc...

loans.name: Efrén

texts.es:
Efrén is a native of San Juanito in the Mexican state of Chihuahua. He is married with three children, all still in school. Two years ago, after experiencing difficulty finding work as a result of his disability, Efrén decided to launch his own business selling sweets and snacks. Little by little he has won clients and grown his business. His love for his children and his desire to improve the well-being of this family have motivated him to work and to give his best effort every day.

Now that he has lots of clients, Efrén wants a sales stall where he can sell his merchandise. He is applying for a loan of $200 with which he will buy the wood to build his business site. He commits to repaying the loan in 3 months. Be an important part of the growth of this business. Efrén and his family appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Efrén es originario de la localidad de San Juanito en el estado de Chihuahua, es casado y tiene tres hijos que están estudiando, ante la dificultad de encontrar un empleo debido a su discapacidad Efrén decidió emprender su propio negocio hace dos años con la venta de golosinas y botanas, poco a poco ha ganado más cliente y ha hecho crece su negocio. El amor hacia sus hijos y el buscar un bienestar para su familia es lo que lo motiva día con día a trabajar y esforzarse.

Ahora que tiene muchos clientes Efrén quiere tener un puesto donde pueda vender su mercancía y está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de madera para poder construir su negocio, el se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio Efrén y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Remodeling his sales stall

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is divorced with one child. She lives in Zaporozhye and runs a small business selling toys in one of the city markets. Tatyana lives alone and has to provide for the needs of her family. Her husband left her with her baby daughter right after her birth and ever since, she has had to find ways to support herself and her family. Tatyana likes to work in this sphere of trade because she knows the demand for toys is high in any season. Tatyana believes that loans from Nadiya Ukraine have helped her expand her trade. Since she started her small venture five years ago, her turnover capital has grown to $2,400. Her net profit currently amounts to $600 a month.  

Tatyana is requesting this loan to increase her turnover capital and sustain her business. We believe Tatyana’s generous heart, love for children, and perseverance in work will help our client succeed and achieve her business goals as well as provide better living standards for her daughter.

loans.use: Increase turnover capital

loans.name: Thi Thuyet

texts.vi:
Ms Thuyết, 48 years old, is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a construction worker. Ms Thuyết learned how to make bean curd (tofu) from her mother in law. Everyday she's up at dawn to make fresh bean curd then she would sell it at the local market. Now all her bean curd making tools are so used, they need to be upgraded. Thuyết was planning to buy new tools in order to keep up with the production increase and also to assure the quality of her bean curd. When she learned of binhminh cdc, she applied for a loan. She plans to repay in 6 months. She would put aside part of the profit from the sale of bean curd plus part of her husband salary to pay back the loan.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Thuyết 48 tuổi có chồng làm thợ xây và có 2 con. Chị lấy chồng và có được nghề làm đậu phụ từ gia đình nhà chồng. Hàng ngày chị làm đậu từ sáng sớm và mang ra chợ bán. Sau một thời gian dài sản xuất nên hầu hết dụng cụ làm đậu đã trở nên cũ và không phù hợp nữa. Chị đang dự định mua mới một số dụng cụ để làm đậu được ngon và hiệu quả hơn. Được biết có chương trình cho vay vốn của binhminh cdc, chị đã đăng ký vay vốn với thời gian là 6 tháng. Chị dự định sẽ dùng một phần tiền lãi từ việc bán đậu và một phần thu nhập của chồng để trả vốn vay hàng tuần cho khoản vay này

loans.use: To purchase tool to make bean curd

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr:
Mr. Mohamed Samari is 28 years old, married and has four children. He has been the owner of a small grocery store for five years and manages it well. This store enables the people in his village to buy food supplies. He buys the products in Kpalimé, which is 30km from Adéta. He has a very large customer base. To satisfy customer demand, Mr. Samari would like a loan to increase his supply of merchandise.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Samari Mohamed est agé de 28 ans , marié et père de 04 enfants . Il est propriétaire d'une boutique d'alimentation générale depuis 5 ans et la gère convenablement. Cette boutique permet à la population de son village de s'approvisionner en produit de consommation. Il achète les produits à kpalimé, localité située à 30 KLM d'Adéta. Il a une clientelle très importante .Pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle Mr Samari souhait un emprunt pour augmenter son stock de marchandises

loans.use: To buy 10 cases of milk, 15 bags of rice, 8 bags of sugar and 10 cases of canned food in Lomé to sell in Adéta

loans.name: Kawaala 1C Group

texts.en: Cathy is 30 years old. She owns a restaurant and also offers outside catering. She wants to use the extra business profits to buy  more food warmers and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and buy another fridge.

loans.name: Abdulla

texts.en: S. Abdulla was born in 1961 in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has four children. He is primarily in the business of selling flour but also raises livestock . He trades in the bazaar and works with a wholesale flour supplier,  permitting him to sell his flour at very attractive prices.  Mr. Abdulla is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase additional flour inventory.

loans.use: To purchase additional flour for sales at the bazaar

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis has always worked to give the best to his beloved family. He used to only work in the agriculture business, but when he saw that demand would increase around sowing time he decided to open a small grocery store with the help of a friend. Now his friend is the administrator of the store. Luis has a fairly large crop plot at his disposal and therefore needs to acquire fertilizer to care for his crops and ensure their quality.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Luis desde siempre ha trabajado para otorgarle lo mejor a su amada familia, en un principio se dedicaba sólo a la agricultura y cuando observó que las necesidades se incrementaban en época de siembra decidió aperturar una pequeña bodega en casa con ayuda de su compañera, quien ahora está a cargo de la administración de la misma. Dispone de un espacio amplio de cultivo listo para su explotación y su solicitud atiende a la necesidad de adquirir abonos para prepararla y obtener mejor calidad de productos.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Suis

texts.id:
Mrs. Suis M. starts her electrical store in 2002. She sells various electrical supplies such as lamp, cable, electrical plug etc from major suppliers who deliver the goods to her store. She also sometimes buy her merchandise from another major/ bigger store at Denpasar. Her store is located at Kupaon street, one of the busiest street in Denpasar.

She uses the money she earn from this store to expand her business and also to improve her family's well being.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ibu Suis M. mulai menjalankan usaha jual alat-alat listrik sejak tahun 2002. Alat-alat listrik yang dijual seperti lampu, kabel, stop kontak yang ia beli dari supplier yang mengantarnya langsung, dan juga ia membeli dari seputaran Kota Denpasar dan dijual di daerah Kupaon. Karena letaknya strategis dan berada ditempat yang padat penduduknya, usahanya begitu ramai dan banyak pengunjung atau pembeli yang ketokonya. Dari keuntungannya ia bisa pakai sebagai tambahan usaha dan untuk keperluan rumah tangganya.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Thị Thuyet

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thị Thuyết (MS: 070005), 44 years old, is taking out a loan of 2,714,000 VND to buy feed for her pigs. She is a hardworking woman. Beside her pigs, she makes tofu and sells to the grocery stands in the area. Her husband always helps her. All children are grown up, married and moved out. She’s been a group leader before. The group was a successful, that’s why she’s selected to be group leader again. Her group has 7 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • N. Thị Minh (MS: 070011), 34 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs and chickens.
  • N. Thị Liên (MS: 070003), 33 years old, applies for a loan to buy scrap.
  • N. Thị Thơi (MS: 070001), 54 years old, applies for a loan to buy feed for pigs.
  • N. Thị Chuyên (MS: 070012), 41 years old, applies for a loan to invest in livestock.
  • N. Thị Mến (MS: 070015), 26 years old, applies for a loan to invest in pigs.
  • N. Thị Hồng (MS: 070032), 28 years old, applies for a loan to “đi chợ”
  • N. Khoa Bảo (MS: 070041), 48 years old, applies for a loan to rebuild his sprinkle system.

Đi chợ, a general Vietnamese term, describes the everyday trading activity of small items at village open market. Traders seek opportunity to buy items which can be resold to others at a minimal profit. These items can be anything, including products such as a little fish or a small bundle of vegetables. At times the Traders don't have a stand, but rather sell their wares directly from their person.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô N. Thị Thuyết (MS: 070005), năm nay 44 tuổi. Cô vay 2.714.000 VND để mua cám nuôi lợn. Cô là một người rất chịu khó. Cô làm đậu bán buôn cho các hộ bán lẻ. Chồng cô phụ giúp cô trong việc chăn nuôi và làm đậu. các con cô đã đi xây dụng gia đình. Cô làm nhóm trưởng kỳ I rất tốt và cô cũng thấy rất thích với việc hoàn trả tuần, nhỏ lẻ như vậy, cô đã tiết kiệm rất tốt cho gia đình. Cô cũng tiếp tục làm nhóm trưởng kỳ này và vận động thành viên mới tham gia vào chương trình. Chị N. Thị Minh (MS: 070011), năm nay 34 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 về mua cám nuôi lợn gà. Chị N. Thị Liên (MS: 070003), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 để lấy vốn đi mua bán phế liệu. Cô N. Thị Thơi (MS: 070001), năm nay 54 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND mua cám nuôi lợn. Chị N. Thị Chuyên (MS: 070012), năm nay 41 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn chăn nuôi. Chị N. Thị Mến (MS: 070015), năm nay 26 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn. Chị N. Thị Hồng (MS: 070032), năm nay 28 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để mua bán hoa quả ở chợ. Anh N. Khoa Bảo (MS: 070041), năm nay 48 tuổi. Anh vay 2.006.000 VND để lắp đăt hệ thống nước tưới trồng rau.

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Ahmed M.

texts.en: Ahmed is very grateful to Kiva for the last loan or $1200. He said that the loan has lifted him from poverty. Ahmed increased his inventory and diversified his business. He purchased palm oil and exported it to Guinea. With the income, he purchased a motor bike to provide transport services to the public, and he earns a net profit of $200 per month from the motor bike business. Ahmed also repaired his house and managed to send one of his children to college. He is very thankful to Kiva and would like to take more loans to continue expanding his business. He said that Le. 3,426,000 will help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: To increase inventory and diversify his business

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio lives in his parent’s house in the zone of Pasankeri, on the west side of the city of La Paz. Lucio is married to Paulina Arequipa, an artisan that makes folkloric suits for a branch store. The couple has two children and the husband does private consultations for handcrafted dental prosthesis (modern instruments are not available.)

Lucio’s parents gave him a space in order for him to be able to construct his home since now they only have one room for the entire family (it is necessary to mention that the past credits were used for the construction of a flagstone in the said room) They will construct walls and a roof for the two rooms. This is the third credit that Lucio has done with IMPRO he is well-qualified for this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Lucio vive en casa de sus padres la cual esta en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. Lucio esta casado con Paulina Arequipa, una artesana que realiza trajes folklóricos para una tienda del ramo. La pareja tiene dos hijos y el marido realiza prótesis dentales en forma artesanal (no dispone de equipo ni instrumentos modernos) para consultorios particulares.

Los padres de Lucio le otorgaron un espacio para que pudieran construir sus vivienda ya que sólo cuentan con una habitación para toda la familia (es necesario mencionar que créditos anteriores le sirvieron para construir una losa en dicho cuarto). Por eso, se construirán muros y techo para dos habitaciones. Este es su tercer crédito con nosotros y califica favorablemente para este nuevo préstamo.

loans.use: Construction of walls and a roof for two rooms

loans.name: Kossi Sotowou

texts.fr:
Mr Kossi Sotowou G. was born on March 4th, 1978 in Lomé. He is married and the father of one child. He is a miller and has maintained his own business since 2004. This business provides considerable revenue as cornmeal is a basic food in Togo and is consumed by most of the population. He is planning to give his old grinding machine to his younger brother and purchase a new one. For this plan to succeed Mr. Kossi Sotowou G. is requesting his first loan to purchase a grinding machine and will then locate himself in a new area to serve the local population.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur G. Kossi Sotowou est né le 4 mars 1978 à Lomé. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Il est meunier et travaille pour son propre compte depuis 2004. Cette activité lui procure beaucoup de revenu car la pâte du maïs qui est un aliment de base au Togo est consommée par la plupart de la population. Son projet est de céder son ancien moulin à son petit frère et d’acheter un nouveau. Pour pouvoir réaliser ce projet, monsieur G. Kossi Sotowou sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter un moulin afin de s’implanter dans une nouvelle zone et de pouvoir servir la population.

loans.use: Purchase of a Grinding Machine

loans.name: Diaraye

texts.fr:
Diaraye S., 42 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkané 3 depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter des graines d’arachide et les griller pour faire de la pâte d’arachide et vendre. Elle vend aussi des légumes par moment. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de contribuer aux charges familiales. <b>Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
.
texts.en:
Diaraye S. is 42 years old and married with five children under her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Kounkané 3 for six years. She wants to purchase peanuts so she can grill them, make peanut butter, and sell it. She also sells vegetables for the time being. The money that she makes allows her to support her family. The loan she’s requesting will be paid back in one lump sum in six months’ time. .

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and selling of peanut butter

loans.name: Luafulu

texts.en: Luafulu T., 49, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to relatives and to the village community 5 days a week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Luafulu's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Laufulu would like a loan to purchase fertilizer, a spade, bushknifes, a sharpener, a weedkiller sprayer machine, a wheel barrow, taro tubers, bananas and barbed fence.  This loan will help her support her kids at school and keep her church commitments.  She is fully committed to her business because this is the main source of income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, a spade, bushknifes, a sharpener, a weedkiller sprayer machine, a wheel barrow, taro tubers, bananas and barbed fence.

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: Gina tiene 44 años, vive con una de sus 3 hijas. Siendo consumidora, la invitaron a vender cosméticos, e inició esa actividad para solventar las necesidades económicas que estaba pasando, 6 años después ve los resultados de su perseverancia, ahora tiene mayor capacidad de ventas, además ha formado su grupo de vendedoras de estos productos de belleza, las cuales, al mes, venden buena cantidad de productos, de esa manera la línea de productos que vende la ha premiado con incentivos por ser una de las vendedoras estrella. Su trabajo es caminar diariamente para obtener clientes,  sus habilidades para las ventas le permiten poder llegar a sus metas. Esta mujer se esfuerza porque desea seguir apoyando los estudios universitarios de una de sus hijas, además, el mismo trabajo la motiva a seguir adelante. Con el préstamo que obtenga, invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza, también en mejorar la infraestructura de su casa construyendo cuartos y posteriormente darlos en alquiler.
texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old and lives with one of her three daughteres. Being a consumer, she was invited to sell cosmetics and she started these activities in order to help settle some financial needs that she was experiencing. Six years later, she sees the results of her perserverance, and she now has a greater capacity to make sales. In addition, she has formed her group of saleswomen for these beauty products which she sells a great deal of on a monthly basis. For this reason, the line of cosmetics that she sells has rewarded her with incentives for being a stellar salesperson. Her work involves walking every day to build her customer base, and her ability for sales has helped her achieve her goals. This woman works very hard because she wants to continue supporting the university studies of one of her daughters and, in addition, the work itself motivates her to forge ahead. With the loan she obtains, she will invest in the purchase of beauty products and also in making improvements to the infrastructure of her home by building additional rooms to later offer for rent.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of beauty products that she sells and to add some rooms to her house to rent out.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is is a member of the Torcaza (“Wood Pigeon”) Village Bank. Gladys is 23 years old and single. She is currently studying to be a high school teacher. Gladys and her fiancé have a small stand on a very busy street in Ayacucho where they sell cell phones, prepaid phone cards, and accessories, and offer technical assistance.  Gladys needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy cell phones. Her dreams are to finish college, to be a good teacher, and to help her family. 
 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow 
 
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Torcaza.
Gladys es soltera, tiene 23 años y estudia educación secundaria en la universidad, Gladys junto a su novio tiene un pequeño puesto en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende celulares, recargas, accesorios y también servicio técnico.
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de celulares.
Los sueños de Gladys son culminar sus estudios, ser una buena profesional y ayudar a su familia.

loans.use: Buy cell phones

loans.name: Mamuna

texts.en:
Mamuna A., 45 year old, is married with three children.  She trades in cassava powder and also operates a grocery shop in Ejura, a community where majority of the population are farmers. She has been trading for the past 20 years. She has been very resourceful to her family through her business.  
She runs a small provision kiosk in her neighbourhood. She also sells cassava powder on a table top in front of her grocery kiosk. She has been in business for fifteen years. She says that she also supplies cassava powder to food vendors in her community. Mamuna wants a bigger working capital. She desires to buy purchase more groceries and cassava powder to serve her community during the festive season. 
She is a member of the trust group called "Rely on God." In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support for one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and cassava powder.

loans.name: Abdulaha Group

texts.en:
There are five members in this group called Abdulaha Panjshiry. All of them would like to receive money for his or her business to purchase more materials for their businesses in order to provide a good income for their families in the future. 

Arozo and Mayda Bibi want to buy one or two new sewing machines for their tailoring businesses. Shakarya and Saltana want to buy more stock for her husband’s general store business. Nazefa wants to take out a loan for her tailoring business. They all want to see their businesses expand so that they can earn more money to support their families.

With this loan they will be able to develop their businesses and support their families, to provide them with a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 41 años, vive con sus dos hijos en su casa propia, ella es una buena madre de familia, siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos y es que desea darles lo que ella no pudo tener. Comienza su negocio de venta de cosméticos visitando a sus clientes, es una vendedora muy persistente y convincente, disfruta de hablar con ellas y aconsejarles sobre lo que mejor le quedará a su rostro, su negocio es muy rentable ya que cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes. Lo más difícil es cobrar, ya que no siempre sus clientes tienen plata para pagarle, pero con los 3 años de experiencia que tiene, se las arregla para que le paguen completito todas sus ventas, ella quiere poner su puesto de cosméticos donde pueda vender más cómoda y sin la necesidad de ir casa por casa. Con su primer préstamo, Maritza quiere hacer crecer su negocio, es por eso que desea pagar a tiempo todas sus cuotas para poder acceder a otro préstamo, además sabe que cuenta con el apoyo de su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más cosméticos, y con eso espera incrementar las ventas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maritza is 41 years old and lives with her two children in her own home. She is a good mother, always worrying about the well-being of her children, and she wants to give them all that she couldn't have herself.

She began her cosmetics sales business by visiting her customers. She is a very persistent and convincing salesperson, and she enjoys talking with her customers and giving advice about what would look best on their faces. Her business is very profitable as she can count on a robust portfolio of customers. The most difficult is to charge for her products as her clients don't always have the funds to pay her. But in her 3 years' experience, she has arranged to be paid in full for all of her sales. She would like to locate her cosmetics sales business where she can sell them more comfortably, without needing to go door-to-door.

With her first loan, Maritza wants to grow her business, and wants to repay all of her installments on time, so that she can receive an additional loan. She knows she can also count on the support of her communal bank. With this loan, she will buy more cosmetics and hopes to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Musharraf

texts.ru: Мушарраф 57 лет, у нее 5 детей. Все ее дети уже имеют свои семьи и живут отдельно. Основной доход семьи составляет заработок ее мужа. У Мушарраф есть свой маленький бизнес – она занимается куплей продажей национальных платьев. Она закупает их как на местных рынках, также привозит их из других дальних базаров. У нее бойкая торговля, она получает хороший доход. С Микроинвест сотрудничает уже 1,5 года. Мушарраф подала заявку на новый займ и собирается закупить весенний ассортимент платьев.
texts.en:
Musharraf is 57 years old and has 5 children. All of her children already have families of their own and live separately. The primary family income comes from her husband; however, Musharraf also has her own small business. She buys and sells traditional dresses. She buys them at local and out-of-town markets. Because her business is busy, Musharraf receives a good profit from it. She has been partnering with MicroInvest for one and a half years. Musharraf wants to obtain a new loan in order to purchase spring assortment of dresses.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For wholesale purchase of spring dresses

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells tailoring materials and is also a fashion designer.  She has been in this business for the past 8 years. Mary is 35 years old and married with 4 children and lives in Badagry. Mary is very energetic and business focused. Mary needs requests a loan of $550 to purchase more tailoring materials and an industrial weaving machine. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and an industrial weaving machine

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Муборак Ахмедова - женщина 41 лет. Замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Занимается продажей детской одежды на рынке Фаровон. Закупает товар из рынка г. Истаравшан. За 1 год кредитования она хоть и немного, но расширила свой бизнес. Этот и последующие займы она хочет использовать для расширения своего бизнеса и улучшить свой уровень жизни. Она благодарит все микро-финансовые организации за то что они дают возможность людям повысить свой уровень жизни.
texts.en:
Muborak A. is 41 years old. She is married and has four children. She sells children's clothing on the Favoron market. She buys the merchandise on the market of the town of Istaravshan. During the one year of lending she has expanded her business even just a little bit. She wants to use this loan and future loans to expand her business and improve her living standards. She is very grateful to all of the micro finance organizations for giving people an opportunity to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Hakika Group

texts.en:
Evodia has been a animal feed seller in the JNzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 3 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 25. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.
