She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more animal feed to increase her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Evodia is 27 years old and single. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Agness, who owns her own small business selling bites (cakes) in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more animal feed to increase her current stock

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha vive junto a su esposo, y ambos, tratan de brindarle a su hijo lo necesario para su crecimiento y desarrollo. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, actividad en la que se ocupa todas las tardes, después de atender a su pequeño hijo sale a las calles a ofrecer sus prendas a sus amistades y vecinos, las cuales cobra semanalmente. Esta actividad la ha ayudado a relacionarse mejor con las personas y le ha brindado la oportunidad de ser una gran comerciante y otra fuente de ingresos económicos para hogar. Martha tiene proyectado salir de su localidad y de su ciudad para vender su mercadería en otras provincias, ya que allí puede subir el precio de sus prendas, para cubrir sus gastos de transporte y obtener mayores ganancias, ya que comprará la ropa en el centro de su ciudad, donde los precios al por mayor son bastante cómodos. Martha es una de las fundadoras de su banco comunal, este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, lo que la motiva a seguir trabajando junto a sus compañeras, quienes también se esfuerzan por  hacer de su grupo uno de los más productivos de la institución. Los 3500 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de mercadería acorde a los días festivos que se aproximan, como el día del padre, donde hay mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Martha lives with her spouse, both of whom try to give their child everything necessary for his growth and development. For the past 6 years, Martha has worked selling clothes, which she does every afternoon, after attending to her small son. Afterwards, she visits friends and neighbors to offer her garments, and she charges them weekly. This activity has helped Martha better relate to people, and has given her the opportunity to be a good businessperson and brings in another source of income for her home. Martha has thought about leaving her city and visiting other provinces to sell her garments, as she can charge more in these provinces in order to cover her transport costs. She can also increase her revenue buy selling her clothes in the center of the city, where the prices are higher. Martha is one of the founders of her communal bank, and this is her 13th credit with MFP, which motives her to continue working with her companions, who also work hard to make sure that their group is one of the bank's most productive. The 3500 Soles that she is requesting will be invested in raw materials for the coming festival days, such as Father's Day, when demand is high.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Mkorofi Si Mwenzetu Group

texts.en:
Halima is single. For many years, Haliama has been a juice and bites (chapati) seller in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Mkorofi si mwenzetu group loan (group code: 2071). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $125. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can add to her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Riziki and Angela. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more flour, sugar, fruits, and other items to expand her business

loans.name: Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
Here are the members of the Sorbeh group, Adama Kamara, Sallay T. and Marie K.. They are businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. These women have come to SMT for the first time to seek a loan in order to boost their businesses. With a loan, they will be able to expand their businesses in terms of both quality and quantity. This will in turn enable them make better sales, more profit and improve on their standard of living. 

Adama K. (pictured at left) is the leader of this group. Adama was born in Makeni about thirty-three years ago. She is married to a tailor and they have four children together. One of their children is now in Junior Secondary School III (JSS III), and the others are in primary school. Adama sells sugar, rice, palm-oil and other goods. She has been a businesswoman for five years now.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 26 years old. He distributes water in Nyalenda, a neighborhood outside Kisumu, Kenya. John operates a tap from Kisumu Water and Sanitation Company, where he buys the water and fills large jerry cans that he sells to customers. He has been doing this business for one and a half years.

John is married, and he has a nine-month-old child. He will use this loan to open more taps to have more water distribution points. He does have competition, but hopes that his growing business can help him cater to the needs of his family.

loans.use: To pay for access to water taps.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 40 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children.

Cecilia owns and operates a business running a stall, primarily selling dried fish products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Cecilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Yến Thị Nguyễn (ID number: 010102150010) was born in 1960. She lives in Cho village, Co Loa, Dong Anh, Ha Noi, with her husband and two children. She and husband sell noodle soup but their main job is farming and, every day, they have to get up early in the morning. They have a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. This time, Ms. Yến wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND (about 400 USD) to invest in her restaurant.

Ms. Yến is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA:

Nhàn Thị Nguyễn (ID number: 010102150019) was born in 1969. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (about 290 USD) to sell sedge mats in the market.

Lan Thị Tuyết Trương (ID number: 010102150006) was born in 1965. She is a worker and, besides that, she raises chickens. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND (about 320 USD ) to buy feed for her chickens.

Thức Thị Trương (ID number: 010102150011) was born in 1964. She is a farmer and wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND (about 320 USD) to raise pigs and poultry.

Tĩnh Thị Trịnh (ID number: 010102150012) was born in 1963. She wants to borrow 4,578,000 VND (about 270 USD) to raise pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To invest in her restaurant

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
"Malia H. (0) is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Vaitoloa.  She is married and has 2 infant-aged children.  To make a living, Malia owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community.  Malia has been engaged in this business for over 1 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

Malia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Malia has successfully repaid a previous loan from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  Malia is now requesting a new loan of 1750 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Malia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys sells provisions retail to her customers in Sapele, Delta State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She is 40 years old and married with 6 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Danelia

texts.en:
Danelia Umana is a 45-year-old mother of 3 children, ages 13, 15, and 18, all of whom are in school. For the last four years, she has made a living selling clothing and shoes around the town of Nagarote, Nicaragua. She walks door-to-door selling her shirts, pants, t-shirts, shoes, and other types of clothing. The longer she does this, the easier it gets, she says, because now she has a client base and enough money to invest a little back into the business. Before she started this business, she was a seamstress. 

Danelia is planning to use her loan to improve the house that she lives in with her husband, children, and father. It is her father’s house and they have lived there for the past 35 years. The loan money will go towards building the walls for a new room to help make life more comfortable for her family. She says that her loans have a very positive impact, because they give her the freedom to do what she wants with her house. Without loans, she would not be able to make any improvements. 

This is her second loan with CEPRODEL, a Kiva field partner that is headquartered in Managua, Nicaragua.

loans.use: To build walls for a new room in her house

loans.name: Jennifer Amunga

texts.en:
Jennifer Amunga A. is married with three children and describes herself as hardworking, friendly and intelligent. She is a tailor and sells trousers, shirts and dresses to schools and walk-in customers. She has one employee. Her main business challenge is customers delaying their payments.

Jennifer is using her 20,000 KES loan to buy material to make trousers, shirts and dresses. In the future, she wants to expand her business and employ more people.

loans.use: To buy material to make trousers, shirts and dresses

loans.name: Robinah's Group

texts.en:
Robinah is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a friendly and devoted lady and married with five children, ages 20, 17, 15, 11 and 9 years, who are all in high school and primary schools. 

She is a business lady who makes ice for children and has supplied to schools in Seeta, Bweyogerere and Mukono for five years now. From her transactions, she makes 40,000/= as profits a week. She is a lady with very good conduct, yet very responsible in her community. Robinah hopes to expand her business to other schools in other towns so that she can have a bright future together with her children. 

She needs a loan to help boost her business by buying more food coloring and paying her marketing workers.

loans.use: To buy more food coloring and to pay her market staff

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora Martha Lorena B., desde hace quince años, se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas, el rubro que labora es el cultivo de piña, la mayor dificultad por la cual enfrentan son los recursos económicos , el cultivo carece de fertilizantes e insumos lo cual las plagas lo han invadido a la vez el humo del volcán  afecta  por que son tierras que quedan cerca de al volcán , ella quiere invertir su préstamo en la compra de fertilizantes para proceder a inducirlo y recuperar lo que con mucho esfuerzo logro gracias al apoyo de sus mamá.  ella habita en un barrio rural del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como guarda de seguridad para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos de doce y siete años , actualmente estudiante ,los planes hacia su familia es apoyarlo y mejorar las condiciones de vida . Doña Martha esta contenta por el apoyo que le brinda la institución ya que son muchas familias campesinas que se benefician con estos programas de desarrollo agrícola.
texts.en:
Señora Martha Lorena B. has been dedicated to agricultural work for 15 years. The production that she works on is the cultivation of pineapples. The greatest difficulty that she faces are the lack of financial resources. Her farm lacks fertilizers and supplies to combat the plagues that have invaded her crops. At the same time the smoke of the volcano affects her fields, because her lands are located close to the volcano. She wants to invest her loan in the purchase of fertilizers to improve her crop and to recover that which she has achieved with a lot of effort thanks to the support of her mom. She lives in a rural neighborhood of the municipality of Ticuantepe, along with her husband who works as a security guard, supporting him in providing for the expenses of the home. They have two children of twelve and seven years, who are students at present. The plans for her family are to provide support and to improve their living conditions. Señora Martha this happy with the support that the institution offers her since many rural families have benefited from these programs of agricultural development.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to kill the plague and improve her production of pineapples.

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Madame K. Toumagnon  est âgée de 24 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux au quartier Santoro de la ville de San, quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali
L’activité principale de Madame K. Toumagnon est l’achat et la vente des articles d’alimentation et des condiments alimentaires tels : les cubes magies, les boîte de concentrée de tomate, les boîtes petits pois, des poivres, poivrons, moutardes, vinaigres, sounbala, oignons, sels de cuisine, spaghettis etc. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle a pris une boutique au grand marché de San où elle exerce ses activités. Très sollicitée et appréciée dans son activité qui devient de plus en plus fructueux, Madame K. Toumagnon a  décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
Madame K. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, différentes sortes de colis de condiments alimentaires auprès des grossistes de Ségou, Sikasso  et des paysans producteurs des villages environnants et effectue sa vente au comptant en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Le bénéfice estimé par mois par Madame K. est de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des échéances, l’entretien des enfants et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. K. Toumagnon is 24 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She lives with her husband in the neighborhood of Santoro in the town of San, the fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali. Mrs. K. Toumagnon's main business is the purchase and re-sale of foodstuffs and various condiments (eg stock cubes, tins of concentrated tomato sauce, cans of peas, peppercorns, peppers, mustards, vinegars, "sounbala" (a West African condiment), onions, cooking salts, spaghettis etc. In order to satisfy her growing clientele, she opened a store in the large market of San, where she does business. She is highly sought-out and appreciated for her business, which is becoming more and more productive. Mrs. K. Toumagnon has decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom this is her first individual loan. Mrs. K. intends to use this loan to purchase various types of packaged condiments from the wholesalers in Ségou, Sikasso and from the local farmers from neighboring villages. She will sell her products for cash and credit to a clientele composed mostly of women. She estimates that she will earn an average monthyl income of 60,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay her loan, support the needs of her family and she will re-invest the remainder in her business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase condiments

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is married with 4 children. Her youngest child is 13 years old. She is 39 years old. She is a LAPO client. (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Florence sells groceries and food items to earn a living. She has been in this business for a long time.  She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. Florence hopes for a loan amount of NGN 170,000 to purchase more groceries and food items to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and food items to sell.

loans.name: Placida

texts.en:
Placida G. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Placida is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Placida owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Placida has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Placida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Placida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Placida is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Placida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: La Superacion 5 Group

texts.en:
Eufrecia, 36, lives in Samana, Dominican Republic with her husband and two children. She leads a loan group called La Superacion (Overcoming), and her story is typical of those told by the people in this group as well as of other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Samana is a small city in the northeastern region of the Dominican Republic. Life here can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (assuming one has power to begin with) and inadequate health care. Despite these difficulties, Eufrecia runs a successful business selling interior decorations to her friends and neighbors. She has applied for this loan to buy fabric, thread, lace and trim in order to make new products to sell.

This is Eufrecia’s second loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to qualify for additional loans in the future so that she can continue to grow her business and improve life for her family. She has high hopes and believes that by worK. hard, she will one day finish construction of her home, buy a small car and get a computer for her children. She also hopes to have many employees and take out loans of greater and greater sizes. Eufrecia has lofty dreams, and with your loan she will be well on her way to achieving them.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Eufrecia and La Superacion group!

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, trim and lace she can use to make products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Hongor

texts.en:
Hongor is 41 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Uvs province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. She retails household products by herself, and her husband is a herder in the Tarialan soum. They have been living in their current home for seven years and their health is good. She has been operating her retail household product business since 2000. Originally, she worked with her brother at his counter, but in 2004 started working separately. Hongor built her own shop at the “Itgelt” market in 2008, and her business is healthy now. Her brother Hishigee supports her and her business, and he purchases inventory for her business.

Hongor is a decent person and she is good at accounting for her own products. She says, “I would like to work hard to buy a car for my family.” She is requesting 300,000 tugrug to purchase products in China.

loans.use: To purchase household products for resale.

loans.name: Mahawa

texts.en:
Mahawa B. is happily married with three children. She is 37 years old, and she has been in business for 20 years. She owns a big shop, where she sells herbal medicine, native soaps, cooking pots, insecticides, melons, cosmetics, dyes, and honey. She has been a member of LAPOSL credit group for two years. She has reinvested the profits from a previous loan back into the business in order to achieve her dream of having a large retail shop. With this loan of 4,000,000 SLL, she will purchase herbal medicine, native soaps, cooking pots, insecticides, sewing materials, honey, melons, and dyes.

Mahawa B. has determined that through adequate access to credit, she will break out of the grip of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase herbal medicine, native soaps, cooking pots, insecticides, sewing materials, honey, melons, and dyes

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem L., age 38, is married and resides with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in the agriculture sector growing fruit and earns an income of USD 2.5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a skilful chef for wedding ceremonies, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Their standard of living has improved since L. and her husband have had these businesses. L. is requesting a loan of 900 USD to purchase a water pump, fertilizer, and seeds to expand the farming output. This is her first loan from Kiva partner CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a water pump, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu T. is married with six children, all of whom are attending school. She started her business from funds she got from her husband and has been in business for the past fourteen years.

Knowing fully well that the sale of foodstuffs is lucrative, Mariatu has decided to maintain the same business but this time round wants to buy more stock. Hence she is in dire need of a loan to be able to buy more stock in large quantities.

With the proceeds from the loan, Mariatu intends to educate her children and construct a dwelling house for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona S. is from the village of Poblacon,Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Chona is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Chona owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Chona has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Chona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Chona is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used additional capital for her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Chona from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria vive en casa propia en la zona de Irpavi, ladera sur de la ciudad de El Alto con su hijo. Ella es rentista del sector comercio, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para el colocado de ventanas y puertas en dos habitaciones de su vivienda, que se encuentra a media construcción.
Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria lives with her son in her own home in the Irpavi district, which is south of the city of El Alto. She is a commercial property owner and uses the rent to support herself.

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase windows and doors for two rooms in her house, which is halfway built. This is the fourth time she has requested a loan. The socioeconomic analysis indicates she has a favorable rating and is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase windows & doors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Amparo De La Concepcion

texts.es: Amparo de la Concepción tiene 49 años. Pues de desde muy joven le ha gustado el trabajo, este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita con Fundación León, que es su mayor ayuda que tiene hasta los momentos pues ella ha demostrado que han sido para la inversión de su negocio. Ella se dedica al destace de cerdo negocio que lo realiza desde hace 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad, por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes siempre están visitándola por los buenos productos que ofrece. Ya que es el único oficio que conoce y que le ha generado ganancias. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos. Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Amparo de la Concepción, 49, has enjoyed working since she was a young woman. This isn’t her first loan request from Fundación León, which is her major help at the moment, because she has demonstrated that the loans have been to invest in her business. She has been butchering pigs for over 4 years and most of her customers come to her due to the high quality of the product she offers. This is the only work she knows how to do and it has produced profits. She will use the requested funds to buy pigs. Her dream is to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a member of the Gathiruini B group, whose members are dairy farmers in Faulu, Kenya. The group members supply their milk to Fresha Co-operative, a well-known milk processing company in Kenya. 

Hannah has been in this business for nine years. She also earns additional income from dress-making. She has requested a loan in the amount of Kes. 50, 000 through this lborrower group. With the money, she wants to buy two dairy cows to improve milk production. 

She hopes to become a large-scale dairy farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Hort

texts.en: Hort Y., 43, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known as the most favorite tourist place in the country. Y. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns an income of USD 4 per day. Y. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase water buffaloes to help plow the rice field. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy water buffaloes.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en: Tuyet T. Dinh was born in 1974. She has four children (two sons and two daughters). She breeds poultry (about 60 chickens). Her husband is a carpenter. He earns a monthly income. Her family has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 5,450,000 VND in order to breed poultry.

loans.use: To breed poultry

loans.name: Meoun

texts.en: Meoun P. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells groceries for an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband transports water for the people in the village, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  P. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia V. is from the village of Don Carlos Sur, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Nelia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Nelia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Nelia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nelia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Nelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr:
commercant de 40 ans,père d'un enfant de 8ans celibataire s'est lance dans la  fourniture scolaire et divers il ya 17 ans, tres jeune n'ayant aucun soutien,il ouvre un etalage, avec 35000 de capital.Ses ventes sont de 25000 frs par jour.

pour sa strategie il se leve de bonne heure et se rend au marché pour acceuillir les premiers clients ainsi que avoir une diversité des marchandises.

Avec le pret qu'il compte recevoir il va acheter des cartons de cahiers, de livres, ardoise, crayons de couleurs, bic, sac,calculatrice.

Son  ambition est d'avoir une boutique de fournitures scolaires et se marier ainsi de bien scolariser son enfant.
Dans le quartier tout le monde le connait du plus petit au plus grand.
texts.en:
his 40-year old business man is unmarried and the father of an eight-year old child. He launched a business selling school supplies and miscellaneous goods 17 years ago, lacking any resources in his early youth. He started selling from a street stand with 35,000 West African Francs as his starting capital. His daily sales volume is about 25,000 West African Francs now. His strategy is to get up early, arriving at the market in time to greet the first customers, as well as to offer a wide variety of merchandise. With this anticipated loan he will purchase boxes of notepads, books, boards, color pencils, ball point pens, bags, calculators, etc. His goal is to open a school supplies store and be able to get married as well as to provide an education for his child. In his neighborhood, everyone—young and old--knows him well.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing notepads,  bags, books, sets of ballpoint pens and pencils etc

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 52 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos menores hijas a quienes desea darles una mejor vida. Los hermosos campos del poblado de Villa Visca (pueblo de la provincia de Tarma), han sido en la vida de María, el lugar que la ha visto crecer y formar su familia, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la chacra y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar arvejas, papa y choclo, lleva 27 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta el lugar donde los vende en el mercado de Tarma. Con el tiempo, espera poner un pequeño puesto en el mercado, ya que siente que pierde mucho al vender sus productos al por mayor. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Dentro su banco comunal siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que esta planta leguminosa se esta vendiendo muy bien en el mercado.
texts.en:
Maria, 52 years old, is a very simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her 2 minor daughters for whom she wishes to provide a better life.

The beautiful fields of Villa Visca (a town in the province of Tarma), have always been a part of Maria's life.  She has seen it grow since she was very small and her parents taught her to work on the farm, and now she has her own lands on which she has worked with much pride and sacrifice since forming her own family.

What Maria likes most about her work is cultivating peas, potatoes and maize.  For 27 years she has been doing this.  She considers the most difficult task to be transporting her harvest to market in Tarma.  In time, Maria hopes to establish a small post in the market, since she believes she is losing much by selling her products at wholesale.

This is Maria's 6th loan with MFP, and she is certain that she can take on responsibility for making all her payments punctually and she is disposed to do so.  Within her communal bank, Maria is always in compliance with all the decisions they make.

With the 2,000 new sols she solicits, Maria will purchase pea seeds, since this legume is selling very well in the market.

loans.use: BUYING PEA SEEDS TO PLANT IN HER FIELDS

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie L. is from the village of Babahagon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old. Elsie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, instant noodles and snack foods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and as working capital. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell and as working capital

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia A. is 53 years old, a caring mother and the loving wife of Frede A. from Malabor, Tibiao Antique, Philippines. She is a mother who always dreams for the betterment of the family and for the good future of their children. They have two children, namely Welbert, 23 years old, and Janet, 15 years old. Welbert is an elementary graduate while Janet is in her fourth year of high school and still studying.

Lilia dreams that at least one of her children will finished college because she did not finished her studies, even elementary school, so she did not know how to read and write even her name.  (During her training in ASHI, the staff taught her to write at least her signature.) That is why she and her husband strive to give their children a bright future through sending them to school through college so that they will never experience again the nightmares of poverty.

Lilia believes that through her membership in ASHI, with its partnership with KIVA, and through their industry they will achieve their dreams in life. She finished her first loan which was Php. 5000 with a very good rating in project, repayment, and attendance because they aspire to apply for Php 10,000  this time which will be utilized as additional capital for her piggery business .

loans.use: additional capital for her piggery

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia A. is from the village of Tupsan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old, widowed and has 4 adult-aged children. Virginia owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily traditional rice cakes known as bibingka, in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Virginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Margarita Del Rocio

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Monserrate se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Margarita, ella tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos dos mayores y dos de 17 y 8 años, uno está en colegio y el menor en escuela y ellos viven con ella, los mayores ya son independientes.  Su esposo es albañil.

Es una ama de casa que también se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, también vende productos de la marca Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería, y accesorios para damas) ventas que realiza al mismo tiempo que hace la venta de ropa. Trabaja 4 días a la semana, deja a crédito y cobra los fines de semana. Su mercadería la compra en Picoaza.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa,  cremas, perfumes y bisutería. Este  es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le ha gustado el banco por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos. Su sueño es tener un bazar en su casa.
texts.en:
The Maria Monserrate Communal Bank meets every 15 days at Canton Montecristi, well-known nationally and internationally for its rich, pre-colonial history and its crafts, home of the famous Panama hats. 

Here we meet Ms. Margarita. She is 40 years old, married, with 4 children--2 older and 2 ages 17 and 8. One is in college and the other is in grade school, and they live with her. The older children are independent. Her husband works in construction.

She is a homemaker who also works. She sells clothes door-to-door. She also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women) at the same time. She works 4 days a week, selling on credit and collecting her payments on weekends. She purchases her merchandise in Picoaza.

This loan is for the purchase of clothes, creams, perfumes and costume jewelry. This is her fifth cycle in the Communal Bank, and she has enjoyed the bank because of the speed at which she receives loans. Her dream is to have a store in her home.

loans.use: Purchase clothes, creams, perfumes and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Florecil

texts.en:
Floricel A. is from the village of Siare. She is 33 years old and married. To make a living she sells fish. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $100 a month for this activity.

In 2008, Floricel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cartons of fish.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel B. is from the village of Malintubuan, Labason, Zamboanga  Del norte. She is 63 years old. Isabel is a widow and has three adult children. To make a living, Isabel operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community. Isabel has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Isabel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Isabel is requesting a new loan of 60,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to raise. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Isabel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy, 27, earns her living by running a pharmacy. She has been in the business for the past five years. Nancy was previously employed before she decided to open her own business. Through Faulu Kenya, she has managed to increase her business inventory. She hopes to open a clinic with the support of her husband, who is a doctor. She has requested a 50,000 KES loan to add to her stock of medicine and to buy a blood pressure machine.

loans.use: to add to her stock of medicine and to buy a BP machine

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
This is Rosalina T., 43, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Jaime T., an entrepreneur. Together they have two children, one who is in college and one who is working and helping out with the family expenses. Rosalina, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosalina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Rosalina earns her income by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling the items separately. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosalina hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Martine

texts.en:
Martine O. M. is 61 years old, married and blessed with twelve children. M. is a farmer and he has been in this line of work for the last twenty-five years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan with which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming. M. is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Gladys Njeri

texts.en:
Gladys has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 13 years. She is 34 years old and married to David Nganga. They have 3 children.

Gladys was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Gladys hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Tuvshinjargal

texts.en:
Tuvshinjargal is 41 years old and  lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her children attend a secondary school. Tuvshinjargal rents a bar that she has been running since June 2010. She employs three workers. She invested in the pub by renovating it last year. 
Tushinjargai has a good reputation in the area and her number of customers is increasing. More and more people and organizations are coming to her pub to have a party. She is planning to add some new meals to the meal menu and to change the outside view by replacing the bar name and logo. The loan  will be used to buy some kitchen utensils, to renovate the outside of the pub and to pay for labor costs.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils, redecorate the outside  of the pub and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en general. Ella ofrece estos productos tanto al crédito como al contado y los ofrece principalmente entre sus vecinos y conocidos. Esta actividad es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y se vale de ella para ayudar al mantenimiento de su economía diaria.

Mabel desea adquirir más prendas de vestir para ampliar su negocio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo. Mabel  es una joven bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, las personas que le conocen admiran sus ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
texts.en:
Mabel, 30, is single living with her family in Olmos District, a farming area with quite a bit of commercial activity located in Lambayeque Province over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells assorted items of clothing both for cash and on credit primarily to her neighbors and acquaintances.  This activity is of great economic help for her family and she uses it to help cover daily expenses.

Mabel would like to acquire more articles of clothing to expand her business.  Because of this she’s thought it convenient to request a 600 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa that will help her reach this goal.  Mabel is a very hard working, enterprising young woman.  People who know her admire her drive to get ahead and make progress.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es:
Eddy B. M. es conocido por su taller de pintura Automotriz  en el Cimarron de Cartago.
El se había dedicado toda su vida a la pintura de madera, sin embargo hace poco inicio su negocio de pintura pero carros. Es por eso hoy necesita un préstamo  de de ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de  un compresor y equipo necesario para pintar carros.
El espera brindar un servicio que no existe en la comunidad y mejorar su calidada de vida.
El es socio   de la Empresa de Crédito comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Eddy B. M. is known for his auto paint shop in El Cimarron, Cartago.  He had previously spent his whole life painting wood.  However, a short while ago he started a business painting cars instead.  He now needs a loan for 500,000 colones to buy an air compressor and other necessary equipment for painting cars.  He hopes to provide a service that does not exist in his community and improve his quality of life.

Eddy is a member of the Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón community loan company which is one of the 110 member companies of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor and other equipment for painting cars

loans.name: Zorigt

texts.en:
Mr. Zorigt is 58 years old and lives with his wife, son, daughter and son-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Zorigt owns a plot of land and small house on it and the family live there all packed together. Zorigt’s wife is retired and Zorigt works at Ulaanbaatar city’s Musical College as a plumber. 

Next year, Zorigt is planning to build a house in his neighborhood for his son, who works at a supermarket retail chain as a delivery truck driver. The house where Mr. Zorigt’s family live was built in 1987 and it really needs some renovations now. The loan Mr. Zorigt is taking will be used to buy necessary building materials such as a cement, sand, plaster, gypsum boards, paints, wood, wallpapers and to do interior renovations to his family house.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials such as cement, sand, plaster, gypsum boards, paints, wood, wallpapers and to do interior renovations to his family house.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Résidant à Bè kpota(un quartier  du pays), Mme Ablavi est  mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle se donne à l’activité de revendeuse de pipettes et de sacs   depuis 2004 après avoir acheté au Grand Marché de Lomé. Ce premier prêt  lui servira à acheter  les articles afin de satisfaire ses nombreuses clientes.
texts.en: Mme Ablavi lives in Bè Kpota (an area of Togo), and is married with two children. She has sold pipettes and bags for a living since 2004. She sources these goods from Lomé's main market. This loan will enable her to purchase greater volumes of these products so that she can meet her customers' rising demand.

loans.use: to purchase pipettes and bags

loans.name: Luisa Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Luisa vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad  es muy visitada por su belleza natural y arquitectónica, es la tercera ciudad de más importante  del país, cuenta con una variada gastronomía la misma que cautiva a propios y extraños, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora. Luisa tiene 28 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 6, 4 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora prestando sus servicios como guardia de seguridad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña Luisa por el momento no se encuentra trabajando ya que esta dedicada al cuidado de sus hijos que son pequeños.

Este es su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar con esta actividad.

Su meta es crecer en el negocio que va a iniciar.
texts.en: Luisa lives in the outskirts of Cuenca, Ecuador. This city is a tourist attraction due to its natural beauty and architecture and is the third most important city in the country. It has a varied cuisine that captures natives and foreigners alike, and its people maintain their culture and traditions. Luisa is 28 years old, lives with her partner and has three children, ages 6, 4 and 1. Her eldest son goes to school in the city. Her husband works as a security guard, and they don't own a home so they rent. At the moment, Luisa is not working since she is dedicated to taking care of her young children. This is fourth loan from her community bank, and she plans to use it to invest in the purchase of chickens to start up that activity. Her goal is to grow this business that she is starting.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with five children. Three children attend school, and the other two are grown. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a business selling cashew nuts in the market to her neighbors and passersby. Asha faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and becoming a wholesale supplier in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, Asha wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Kanatbek

texts.en:
Kanabek is married and has three children. He was born in Kashkelen village in a large family and spent most of his time helping his parents in the household, pasturing cattle in the mountainous areas with native grasses, and helping his mother milk the cows. 

After graduating from secondary school, Kanatbek devoted his life to breeding animals and land cultivation. Gaining wide experience in this activity, the start-up of his own business was successful. With the initial capital of 2.000 KGS, which was spent purchasing seeds of clover and wheat, he managed to earn about 3,000 KGS each month. 
As farming is the major means of subsistence for Kanatbek’s family, he spends a lot of time improving his farm. Being a persistent and hard-working man, he has developed his farm and presently has one milk cow, calves and 2.4 hectares of irrigated land. 

Kanatbek plans to use this loan of 30,000 KGS to broaden his livestock business. In the future, he dreams of building a big house for his children and grandchildren. 

About Bai-Tushum and Partners:

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable members of the population. It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, it contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 30 years old. He in an honest, creative and hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with one child, aged 3 years. He has been meeting the needs of his family for the last three years by selling cereals. He supplements his income by the earnings he makes from the transport industry using his matatu (minibus) to ferry passengers. In the next five years, he wants to sell on wholesale terms, and his dream is to own a cereals godown (warehousing facility). He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy maize, ground nuts, etc. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching him business management skills.

loans.use: to buy maize, ground nuts, etc.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru, a hardworking and aggressive 27-year-old business lady, is married and blessed with two school-going children. To make a living, for the last four years she has been operating a beauty salon, and earns additional income by renting out houses.

Grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching her business management skills, Nuru is now requesting a loan of 35000 Kenya shillings to buy hair braids, chemicals and shampoos. Within the next five years, she wants to increase the size of her business so as to attract a larger clientele.

loans.use: to buy hair braids, chemicals and shampoos.

loans.name: Flor Jacqueline

texts.es:
Flor tiene 45 años vive cerca de Ibarra con sus papas, no tiene hijos, se considera una persona organizada, preocupada por su comunidad, es cooperadora y muy responsable.

Trabaja pesando cerdos sola por un tiempo de 10 años, le va muy bien tiene clientela.

Trabaja por dos años con FODEMI, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de cerdos y así mejorar sus ingresos para poder arreglar su casa; su sueño es de llegar a tener una tercena (carnicería).

Flor en la foto se encuentra cosechando aguacates que también es su fuente de ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Flor is 45, lives near Ibarra with her parents, and does not have children. She is considered an organized person who is concerned about her community. She is cooperative and very responsible.

She has been selling pork for 10 years. She has a clientele and has been doing well.

Flor has been working with FODEMI for two years. She is requesting a loan to buy pigs in order to increase her income so she can fix up her house. Her dream is to eventually have her own butcher shop. 

In the photo Flor is seen harvesting avocados which are also a source of income that helps to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodocia nació en la ciudad de Taray de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 49  años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Pisaq y donde realiza sus actividades, ella se dedica a  la venta de comida tiene un pequeño restaurante. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Teodocia requiere el préstamo para realizar uno de sus sueños que era casarte con su pareja. 

El Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Teodacia was born in the city of Taray, which belongs to Calca province in Cusco, Peru, and she is 49 years old. She has been living in a common-law relationship from which she has three children. Currently, she is living in the city of Pisaq where she works. She has a small restaurant and sells food. She has had this business for 10 years and it is going well, thanks to her dedication to her work.

Teodocia wants the loan to make one of her dreams come true; to get married to her common-law partner.

The “Mosoq Ñusta” Communal Bank meets every thirty days in the Pisaq area of Calca province (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is well known as a tourist and commercial area, as well as for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and as the site of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu

loans.use: to make her dream of marrying her common-law partner come true.

loans.name: Jairo Mauricio

texts.es:
Jairo tiene 25 años vive en Urcuquí que es a una media hora de Ibarra, vive con sus padres y se describe como una persona trabajadora, emprendedora y entusiasta.

Jairo trabaja solo en la crianza de animales (pollos) empezó a trabajar en la crianza cuando dejó de estudiar porque vio la necesidad de ayudar a sus padres. Es la primera vez que le solicita créditos a  Fodemi, el mismo que será utilizado en la compra de pollos para aumentar su negocio de crianza de animales al mismo tiempo que lograría mejorar sus ventas e ingresos.

Su sueño es poder volver a la Universidad para poder acabar su carrera y luego poder tener una familia.
texts.en:
Jairo is 25 years old and lives in Urcuquí which is half an hour from Ibarra.  He lives with his parents and describes himself as a hard-working, entrepreneurial and enthusiastic person.

Jairo's sole business is raising animals (chickens).  He started raising these animals when he left his studies because he saw that he needed to help his parents.  This is the first time that he has requested a loan from Fodemi.  He will use his loan to buy chickens to increase his animal-raising business.  This will enable him to improve his sales and income.

Jairo's dream is to be able to return to University so that he can finish his degree and then start a family.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Yamile

texts.es:
Yamile desde hace 5 años tiene un negocio de venta de mercancía al detal y por catálogo, ella se siente muy feliz porque puede manejar su tiempo además de poder estar mucho tiempo con pequeño hijo de 3 años.

Ella quiere que su negocio crezca y así poder mejora su economía para brindarle a su hijo cada día una mejor calidad de vida.

Su sueño es tener un local bien surtido de productos para tener buena clientela y con variedad de productos.
texts.en:
For the last five years, Yamile has had a business selling merchandise at retail and from catalogs.  She feels very happy, because she is able to manage her time and additionally she gets a lot of time to spend with her three-year-old son.

She wants her business to grow so that she can improve her financial situation, and provide her son with a better quality of life on a daily basis.

Her dream is to have her own premises and keep them well-stocked with products, so that she can have a good customer base and offer a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Liberathe

texts.en: Liberathe is 45 years old and has 7 children aged between 3 and 20. All of her children attend school.  She sells bananas and other food items. She would like to use the loan to buy more goods for her store and become a wholesaler. She has been running this business for 10 years. She would like to reinvest the profits into her business and double its size.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 56 years old and is married with two children. To make a living, he owns and operates a farm, raising crops. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn. Danilo has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earned approximately 80,000 PHP with his last crop.

At this time, Danilo wants a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his corn farm business. He dreams that his business will become more productive so he can give his family a progressive standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his corn farm business.

loans.name: Lobarhan's Group

texts.en:
Lobarhan is the leader of this group. She is 37 years old and divorced. She is raising a 10-year-old daughter who studies at school. Lobarhan works as a school teacher; her monthly salary is 6000 soms. She is also engaged in the cattle-breeding business. Through selling dairy products and some of the animals after fattening, she earns an additional 5000 soms to meet her daily needs. With money received from the loan, Lobarhan wants to purchase a calf for breeding. In the future, she plans to purchase a piece of land on which to build a house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: La señora Teodora vive en el Alto por la zona de Villa Ingavi se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo  su puesto es en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad de El Alto  es casada  tiene tres hijitos los dos ya van al colegio, su esposo es chofer el  crédito que solicito es para aumentar su capital de trabajo con la compra de carne de Pollo  por mayor ya que tiene mucha demanda de este producto, tiene muchos clientes y también entrega por mayor a las pensiones de la zona, la Sra. Teodora es una persona muy trabajadora y se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señora Teodora lives in El Alto in the Villa Ingavi area.  She makes her living selling chicken.  Her stand is in a strategic spot in the city of El Alto.  Señora Teodora is married and has three kids, two of whom go to school.  Her husband is a driver.  The loan Señora Teodora is requesting is to increase her working capital with the purchase of whole-sale chicken.  There is a great demand for that product.  She has a lot of customers and also delivers whole-sale to the inns in the area. Señora Teodora is a very hard-working person and she feels grateful to the institution for the help they are offering.

loans.use: to purchase whole-sale chicken.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with five school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Esther has operated a secondhand clothing business for the past twelve years; her potential clients are the local area women. The major challenge she faces is transportation. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase four bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial facilities to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase four bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en: Titus is a hardworking 42-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with five children who are in school. He has been selling clothes for the last ten years to support his family. He also practices farming to supplement his income. His potential customers are passerby. Titus is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy jackets, trousers and shirts for resale.  In the next 5 years, he plans to establish a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy jackets, trousers and shirts for resale.

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en:
Jackline's group is comprised of seven hard working women. Jackline is 22-years-old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her clothes store which sells various kinds of clothing. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bundles of clothes and will help Jackline to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Jackline hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a home. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Jackline's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 38 years old and is married with three children who range from six to twenty-one years old. She is a determined woman. She has been involved with farming and selling kale for the past two years. She faces the challenge of inadequate funds to maintain the business. 

Alice will use the loan of 10,000 KES to buy more kale and fertilizers. Her hope and dream is to expand her business and become a supplier for the big, nearby institutions such as the university in her home area in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and kale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 10 bags of corn, 2 boxes of milk and other items.

loans.name: Liduena

texts.en:
Liduena is a married woman with 3 adult children. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. Liduena primarily grows rice to sell. She earns about 4000 php per month. She works hard to keep her crops healthy and to have a better yield.

Liduena has requested this loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides. In the future, Liduena hopes to have a progressive business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Djawou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJAWOU est composé de cinq personnes qui sont membres d’une même association d’Eglise. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Chantal est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Chantal est âgée de 37ans et vit au Bénin. Chantal est mariée à un photographe du nom de Razack. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Chantal vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Chantal vend de façon ambulante des acajous. Chantal s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Chantal ensemble avec les membres du groupe DJAWOU, sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des noix d’acajous.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Realizar sumidero, baño e inodoro y todas sus condiciones, ya que la letrina en uso esta perdiendo capacidad de almacenar, con la obra mejoraria la higiene en el hogar.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
My name is Maria Cardon and I buy and sell shoes for women. I have had my own store for the last 2 years. My clients are very nice and my products have already been sold in the market of the capital city, allowing me to generate revenues to support my family. My goal is to increase the inventory in order to offer a wider selection of shoes to increase sales. I will use the profits to renovate my home and continue to support my family.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

mi nombre es Maria C. me dedico a la compra/venta de zapatos para dama, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi producto lo reparto en el mercado de la ciudad capital, actividad que me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una variedad de zapatos y asi tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que tenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion y mantener mi familia.

loans.use: To buy shoes, sandals, flip-flops

loans.name: Pamela Neh Akoso

texts.en:
Born in 1975, Pamela is a single mother of two children named Solange and Blaise. She perseveres in life although her boyfriend, who is the father of her kids, disappointed her. She took out her first loan in 2003, the same year she had her second baby. This is her fourth time borrowing. With her three previous loans she provided her community with fast-food services and fresh raw food from her farm. She is proud of having bought some kitchen utensils and paid her children’s fees.

Given a loan of $600, she plans to buy flour, sugar, oil, yeast, and cups to enhance her “achumbu” (convenient road side restaurant) activity.  The loan will also pay for labor to clear her farm and sticks to repair her existing pig fence. Her immediate goal is to continuously provide for her children while rendering the needed achumbu services to her community.

She plans to repay the loan in 18 months. The first installment will be four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: trading and farming

loans.name: Abdul Ghafor

texts.en: Abdul Ghafor lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a shopkeeper who lives with all members of his family. He was a business dealer in the past but his business was damaged and now he wants to start a new business from the beginning. He has a retail shop and he wants to take an individual loan to buy extra items like cola, baskets, shampoo, and matches. He wants to expand his business and enlarge his shop to find more clients and help his family like he did in the past. He would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy inventory items and enlarge his shop

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.en:
Maria R. is a busy woman! She lives in Ayacucho, Peru with her husband and daughter. She can almost always be found behind the reception desk at the “hospedaje,” or hotel, which the couple has owned for over 7 years. She works seven days a week checking customers in, overseeing improvement projects, and managing the hotel's 2 employees. Luckily, she has the help of her husband, who is a co-administrator for the hotel. Next door, also on the busy Avenida de Tres Mascaras, their daughter owns a shop specializing in gum, sweets, and beverages.

Maria is quite proud of her hotel, which contains 24 rooms. It is an upscale lodging, with hot water and private bathrooms. She says most of her clients are business people from all over Peru, along with visiting foreigners. Maria has many goals for the improvement of her hotel, which she says is an ongoing project. She hopes to receive a loan of $1,100, which she will use to put new tile on all 4 floors of the hotel, as well as the staircases. This endeavor is already underway, with beautiful blue hand-painted ceramic tiles replacing the generic white squares presently covering the floors. She is pleased with the new look so far, but the materials and labor are quite expensive, and this loan would allow her to finish the project.

loans.use: Put new tile on all 4 floors of the hotel, as well as the staircases

loans.name: Eang Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Eang Sok N., 35, works in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with her husband and four children. Her husband works as a construction worker, and earns $5 a day. Eang Sok N. has a grocery store, which brings the family an additional $1 a day.

She has applied for this loan so that she can expand her inventory to sell a greater quantity and range of products. This will help her meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: Purchase more grocery items to expand inventory

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema is a 30-year-old, hard-working woman and runs a shop selling both used and new clothes in the Vituka area in Dar Es Salaam city. She has been doing this business for the past 7 years. She is in need of USD 225 to help her boost her capital and expand her business.

loans.use: expand business

loans.name: Gavkhar

texts.en:
Gavkhar M. lives in Chkalovsk, Tajikistan; she is married and has 2 children. She has a supermarket in the bazaar in Ainy Park. She has a wide assortment of goods, and repeat customers. She has been in this business for 15 years. She wants to expand her business and open a new market.
