Gavkhar M. has received loans of increasing amounts from MicroInvest since 2006. Her business is stable and income keeps increasing. Now she requests a loan of 2000 TJS (about $600) to fund opening the new market.

loans.use: Fund opening a new supermarket

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 39 year-old Magreth M.. She is widowed with four children, aged 7, 12, 15, and 17. In 2002 Magreth established a charcoal business, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk.

These small, black and dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: Magreth would like to purchase additional stocks of charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Holishon

texts.ru:
Holishon M. lives in the Rudaki region. She is 40 years old, married, and has 2 children. She is in the business of cattle breeding and agriculture. These are the main sources of income for her family. Agricultural activities tend to be seasonal, so for this reason she is asking for loan to finance her cattle business. She plans to purchase a milk cow at a low price as in February they tend to drop down due to lack of food. This will give her an opportunity to get a good price and continuously have milk for both her family and for sales. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Махмудова Холисхон проживает в районе Рудаки, 40 лет ,замужем имеет 2 детей.Занимается животноводством и сельским хозяйством.Это основные источники дохода ее семьи. Сельское хозяйство является сезонным бизнесом, поэтому данный кредит клиентка запрашивает на животноводство. Она планирует на эти деньги купить дойную корову подешевле,т.к в феврале цены на животных падают в связи с нехваткой корма.Это даст возможность выиграть в цене и получать молоко,как для своей семьи так и для продажи.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea A. es madre de familia de 3 hijos, actualmente su marido trabaja como albañil por su cuenta, movida por la necesidad de apoyar a su marido en el gasto familiar y su gusto por las ventas emprendió un negocio hace ya 8 años.

Inicio con la venta de ropa posteriormente lo combino con la venta de zapatos por catalogo y actualmente cuenta con una pequeña mercería, realizando simultáneamente las 3 actividades. Desea el crédito de US $950 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 6 meses para surtir mercancía ya que espera un incremento en sus ventas.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Andrea A. is married with three children. Her husband works in construction.

Since her husband’s income was not enough to sustain the family, she started selling clothes and shoes by catalog eight years ago. Additionally Andrea has a little grocery store. At the present time she is involved with the three activities and would like to increase her sales for that reason she is requesting a loan of $950 to be repaid in 6 months to increase her inventory and income.

She started selling clothes and later selling shoes by catalog.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Mariam's Tusaidiane Group

texts.en:
Mariam, age 38, is married with four children, ages 17, 12, and 6 year-old twins. She has a charcoal-selling business which she started in 2005. She works from 7 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. daily, and makes a profit of about $55 a month from her sales.

In the past, Mariam took out a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more charcoal to sell. She repaid it, and now hopes for a new loan which she will use for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her group, whose members run businesses in which they sell items such as drinks, fruits and vegetables, and provide tailoring services.

In the picture, Mariam is in yellow on the right.

loans.use: To help several small businesses expand

loans.name: Aenah

texts.id:
The business Aenah is doing daily is to sell packed rice. Her husband's income as a driver is not enough to fulfill household needs. That is why she is also working. Every day she sells packed rice around her house in Mertasari Suwung street, Denpasar. Her customers are mostly workers who works in that area. Afterwards in the afternoon she moves to sell in Danau Tempe street. Her daily income is sufficient to fulfill household needs. Aenah hopes the help could be used to add business capital.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha yang dijalani oleh Aenah sehari-harinya adalah sebagai penjual nasi bungkus. Penghasilan suaminya sebagai sopir belum cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Karena itu dia juga ikut bekerja. Setiap hari dia berjualan nasi bungkus disekitar rumahnya di Jl. Mertasari Suwung Denpasar. Pelanggannya kebanyakan para pekerja yang bekerja dikawasan itu. Setelah itu pada siang hari dia pindah berjualan di Jl.Danau Tempe. Penghasilan yang didapatnya setiap hari cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Aenah mengharapkan bantuan untuk dipakai sebagai tambahan modal usaha.

loans.use: To add business capital (Manambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mr. Thol M., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Sam-at Tem (shown in the picture) were married in 2000. They have three children, one son and two daughters, one of whom is in school. The family lives along National Road number five, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Mr. Thol is not in the picture because he was busy driving villagers to Phnom Penh and we took his wife’s picture instead of his.

Mr. Thol has been in the business of driving a motor remoque (a motorcycle with a trailer at the back) taxi for many years. He transports villagers back and forth from his village to Phnom Penh, while his wife stays at home to take care of the children. Currently, his motorcycle is very old and he needs to buy a new one. Therefore, Mr. Thol is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase a new motorcycle to continue driving a motor remoque taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle for his motor remoque taxi business.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Saul C. and I work in the purchase and sales of vegetables.  I am 54 years old, married with four children—three of which are adults, while the smallest one helps me run the business.  My wife is a merchant and we help each other in sustaining our home. 

My customers are great since my business is located in the municipal market of Nacaome, a high-traffic market visited by many people from various communities.  Currently, I need to purchase more vegetables to satisfy the demand of my customers; also, I need to offer a greater variety of vegetables.  This is why I am requesting a loan to be able to continue growing my business and supporting what is most important to me in this life—my wife and children. 

 Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

hola mi nombre es Saul C., me dedico a la compra y venta de verduras, tengo 54 años de edad y estoy casado, tengo 4 hijos los cuales 3 son independientes y el pequeño me ayuda con mi negocio, mi esposa es comerciante y nos ayudamos mutuamente con el sustento de nuestro hogar, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicado en el mercado municipal de nacaome y este mercado es bien visitado por mucha gente de varias comunidades, en estos momentos necesito incrementar las compras de verduras esto es para satuisfacer las necesidades de mis clientes aparte que tengo que tener mas variedad de verduras, por lo que estoy solicitando una ayuda monetaria para poder salir adelante con mi negocio y lo mas importante en mi vida que es mi esposa e hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a 22-year-old married mother of 3 children. She lives in Nyalenda, Kisumu, Kenya. She used the funds from her own savings to start a small corner shop adjacent to her home, where she sells daily necessities, like bread, flour, cooking oil, soap, and fresh milk. She has since increased her daily income by 90% and managed to save a bit of her profits. She plans to move her business into a larger space and a more lucrative location with the US$500 loan she has applied for. She will use this money to pay rent for a larger shop, to increase her stock, and to obtain supplies that are in high demand within her community.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To pay rent and add stock and supplies

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa G. is twenty nine years old. She is married with two kids. She realizes the need to support her family with additional income so she decided to start a trade. She has been selling palm oil and bleaches like parazole for the past ten months. She buys her supply of parazole and palm oil from the local manufacturers and retails them to her customers who are mostly households, food vendors, and drivers.

With the loan, she wants to buy palm oil and parazole in bulk to cater for the demands of her customers. She wants to use proceed from her operation to support the kids in school. Theresa is a member of the group called Gift. Members agree to guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm oil and bleaches in bulk

loans.name: Thi Huong

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương 34 tuổi, Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003. Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đều đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi lợn và thêm vốn vào kinh doanh giết mổ lợn. Gia đình chị chăn nuôi với mô hình lớn bình quân mỗi lứa nuôi hơn 100 con lợn thịt, công việc kinh doanh của chồng chị phát triển rất thuận lợi bình quân mỗi ngày mổ 2 con lợn thu nhập khoảng 250.000đ/ ngày, chị có 2 con hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư mua lợn giồng và thức ăn chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thi Huong, 34 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2003. All the loans obtained from the Fund are used to invest in rearing pigs and butchering business. Her family rears pigs in a large scale, as each time she rears 100 pigs. Her husband's butchering business is also progressing smoothly. On average, they butcher 2 pigs everyday with the daily profit of 250,000VND (about 15.50USD). Mrs. Huong has 2 children who are still going to school. This time, she would like to borrow 10,000,000VND (625USD) to purchase breeding pigs and animal feed. Her family's average monthly income is 6,000,000VND (about 375USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pigs and animal feed

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam K. is a villager in Prey Preal village in Takeo Province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She and her husband, Mr. Bun Man, are farmers. With their businesses, they still do not earn enough money to live on. Thus, Mrs. Sam K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to raise to add to her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions. She is 50 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cow to raise to add to her business

loans.name: Egya

texts.en:
Egya E. is married and has three children. He attended school through senior high school.

Egya sells and repairs electrical equipment in Nyanta, near Elmina. He has been in this business since 2000. His wife is a trader.

Egya uses his income to pay for his children's school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. Egya will use this loan to purchase more electrical parts for his repair works. With the new profits from his expanded business, Egya plans to reinvest back into his business. This will allow him to increase his income so he can give quality education to his children.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical parts for his repair works

loans.name: Hop Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Hợp năm nay 53 tuổi, hai vợ chồng chị đang sống cùng 4 con đã trưởng thành. Hiện tại  chồng chị đi làm thợ xây còn chị và các con làm nghề dệt chiếu và chăn nuôi tại gia đình. Công việc chăn nuôi, dệt chiếu đang phát triển rất thuận lợi và đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng .
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 9.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi. Phần còn lại chị sử dụng mua thêm nguyên liệu phục vụ cho công việc dệt chiếu của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hop Thi L. is 53 years old. She and her husband live with their four adult sons. Currently her husband works as a construction worker and she and her children work weaving straw mats and raising livestock at their home. The livestock and straw mats businesses are growing very favorably and provides the family with an income of 2,500,000 VND/month. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND, part of which will be used to buy more pigs to raise. The remaining portion will be used to buy more raw materials to use in the mat-weaving business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs, buy raw materials for weaving mats

loans.name: 7-Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Loan Group 7 consists of seven poor women, all of whom live in Dong Hai commune, Thanh Hoa City. Thanh Hoa City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoa province, one of the poorest provinces in Vietnam. It is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam.

Mrs. Bui Thi Quynh Huong is the lead borrower of the group. She is 27 years old, married, and has a one year old daughter. This is Mrs. Huong's fourth loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women ("FPW") and she is borrowing 1,963,500 Vietnamese Dong ("VND") (~US$113). All of her previous loans have been repaid on time and in full. Mrs. Huong will use the proceeds from this loan to buy women's clothes in the Vuon Hoa market, which she will then resell from her stall in the Quang Hung market. Mrs. Huong will reinvest the profits from this loan in her business.

Mrs. Lê Thị Thảo is borrowing 1,963,500 VND to buy sugar, salt, towels, candy, biscuits and bread for resale.  This is her fourth loan; her previous three loans have been repaid on time and in full.

Mrs. N. Thị Hồng is borrowing 1,626,900 VND (~ US$94) to buy chicken and ducks that she will raise and then resell.  She will also buy fruit which she will then resell in her village.  This is Mrs. Hồng's first loan from the Fund for Poor Women. 

Mrs. Lê Thị Huệ is borrowing 1,626,900 VND (her first loan) to buy fruit such as apples, oranges and bananas for resale in her village.

Both Mrs. Lê Thị Ngọc and Mrs. Lê Thị Tươi are borrowing 1,963,500 VND to buy and raise chickens and pigs for eventual resale in the Đông Hải market.  Mrs Lê Thị Ngọc will also purchase fish to resell in the market.  For both borrowers, this is their fourth loan from the Fund for Poor Women; all previous loans have been repaid on time and in full.

Mrs. N. Thị Huyền is borrowing 1,626,900 VND to invest in her Cháo Lươn store, from which she sells swamp-eel, rice, onions and water.

loans.use: To buy sugar, oranges, bananas, fish, salt, and onions.

loans.name: Sola

texts.en: Sola B. is a 35-year-old married man with three children.  He lives in Ogbomosho, in the Oyo state of Nigeria, where he sells tailoring materials such as sewing threads and sewing needles.  In addition, he makes lovely designs for his customers.  He also explains that he has been in this line of business for a long time.  Nevertheless, he is hoping to expand his business, so he is seeking a loan in the amount of $350 (50,000 NGN) to purchase more tailoring materials for resale purposes.  He thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional tailoring materials

loans.name: Roly Jesus

texts.es:
Roly es socio del Banco Comunal Firmeza.
Roly es casado, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Roly se dedica a la venta de seguros contra accidentes, además de asesoramiento en temas de seguro, para lo cual cuenta con un local alquilado.
Roly necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago para adquirir una moto.
Roly sueña con tener una empresa de seguros de mayor cobertura y ofrecer mas productos.
texts.en:
Roly is a member of the Firmeza community bank. He is married, 24 years old and has two children. He makes a living selling accident insurance and consulting on insurance matters, a business for which he has a rented office. Roly needs a 1000-soles loan that he will use to partly pay for a motorcycle. Roly wants to own a bigger insurance business with larger coverages and more products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partly pay for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells drinks in wholesale and retail to her customers. She started this business in 2007. She requests a loan of $950 to purchase more drinks to sell. Grace is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Oibuvi

texts.en: K. Oibuvi lives in Taboshar, Tajikistan. She is married and has six children. As with many rural residents, Oibuvi is engaged in the livestock business. She makes and sells soured milk products. Oibuvi has been in the livestock business for 15 years. Her decision to start this business came from the experience of helping her mother to take care of home animals. Oibuvi applies to KIVA with a request for a business development loan of 2,000 TJS (~US$ 525) for 8 months, so that she can purchase milk-making equipment. She thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: To purchase milk-making equipment

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
Kwabena A. is a fifty-five year old married man and the father of six children, two daughters and four sons. The first daughter is married. Some are in senior high and primary schools while others are learning trades. His wife is a hard-working woman. She is a petty trader. She runs a provision store and sells fish on a table top in front of the store. Kwabena lives with his family in a rented apartment in a town called Takorase. Takorase is farming and a commercial community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Kwabena buys and sells palm nuts. He buys palm nuts from farmers in his community and other nearby towns and distributes them in a truck to retailers, food vendors and palm oil producers in other communities. Kwabena has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk. He is hopeful to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Santa Rosa

texts.es: Doña Santa C. cuenta con 55 años de edad, es casada de oficios Costurera, “Confección de delantales” cuenta con un taller de 3 maquinas, habita junto  con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, ella y sus hijos se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 18 años de elaborar delantales en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xeatzam del Cantón Nimapa , del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y tener mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Fifty-five years old, Mrs. Santa C. is married and a seamstress, a "maker of aprons." She has a workshop with three machines and lives with her husband and their four children. She, her children, and two employees work together. She has produced aprons in her residence for eighteen years. Her home is in the Paraje Xeatzam del Cantón Nimapa, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. The demand for her aprons has grown, but current economic conditions do not allow an increase of capital; therefore she has turned to the Asociación ASDIR and applied for a loan, with which she will purchase raw material. She will then be able to increase sales, hoping also to enable her children to advance and have a higher standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Craftwork (purchase of raw material)

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
N. Akram is 24 years old. He is married but has no children yet. Akram has worked as a barber for 4 years. He is very talented and maybe that’s why he has so many clients. Also he doesn’t charge much for his services. Now he wants to borrow money so he can buy newer instruments for hair cutting. This way Akram thinks he can offer a better service for his clients and earn more and improve his living standard.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new hair-cutting apparatus

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia B. is forty–six years old. She is widowed and has five children, two sons and three daughters, who are currently in the senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Leticia is a trader. She trades in meat. She sells on a table top at the market square. She also supplies to other retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys her goods from Kumasi. Leticia has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy meat in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en: Zaituni J. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and a married woman. She runs a business selling varieties of food products at Yombo Vituka Ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells varieties of food products in her shop including cereal products such as wheat flour, maize flour, cashew nuts, cooking oil, and sugar. She purchases the business goods direct from the producers and others from the city market. Her business plan is to run a wholesale food shop one day.  She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 to meet her business demand.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Hélène D. est âgée de 43ans, mère de 2 enfants avec 1 autre dont elle a la charge. Elle s’active dans l’aviculture et aimerait renforcer son activité pour mieux améliorer les conditions de la famille.
texts.en:
Hélène D., age 43 is a mother of two children plus one other she supports. She is active in poultry farming and would like to bolster her business to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For raising poultry

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia L. is from the village of Puntod. She is 56 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Lilia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. lives in Gudele, next to the market. She is 30 years old and is married to a secondary teacher who teaches in Supiri secondary school. They have seven children who all go to school. Esther has been retailing for almost two years, selling clothes and shoes at the market. She is requesting a loan in order for her to purchase and stock sandals to sell together with her shoes and clothes for better profits. In the future, the extra profits from her loan will be used for paying school fees for her children and to support them by buying them clothes this year for Christmas. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase and stock sandals to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita sells planks in wholesale and retail to her customers in Sapele, Delta state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more planks to sell.  Rita, who is 33 years old and married with four children, says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Guljan

texts.en: Guljan is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, ages 7 and 8, in a house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia. Her two children both attend a local secondary school and her husband works at a private company in town. Guljan is very busy running two businesses. During the day, she runs a clothing retail business located in a rented stall in the local market and at night she sews household goods like blankets, sheets and pillow cases. She started her retail clothing business in 2006 after working at her friend’s stall for three years. Guljan works hard so that she and her husband can afford their children’s school tuition and so that her children will learn to be self reliant when they get older. She is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~420 USD) loan to import more clothing from both China and Kazakhstan.

loans.use: loan to import more clothing from both China and Kazakhstan.

loans.name: Elba Ruth

texts.en: Elba Ruth G. L. is not married. Her three children are grown and are independent from their mother. Elba is 62 years old. For 36 years, she has run an eatery. She began her business with the idea of walking from place to place and selling her foods to customers as she found them. With the profits from the early business, Elba was able to establish a permanent location in the central market of Somotillo, near the city of Chinandega, Nicaragua. Her biggest customers are the other merchants at the market. Elba often extends credit to them. A good businesswoman, Elba dreams of improving her business with every passing day. She doesn’t rely on the support of anyone and is proud of her independence

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: El señor Juan Manuel Martínez es casado con su esposa la señora Lorena Patricia Aguinaga, el labora para una empresa como mecánico desde hace 9 años, su esposa se encarga de atender el negocio que acaban de iniciar de nombre “Abarrotes La Hacienda” con apenas 6 meses de inauguración, pero como son una familia muy unida y constante están luchando por salir adelante y por tal motivo solicitan este crédito para la inversión en la compra de mas mercancía por mayoreo para percibir mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Manuel Martínez is married to the Señora Lorena Patricia Aguinaga. He has worked for a firm as a mechanic for 9 years. His wife takes care of running a business that they are just starting called "La Hacienda Grocery"; it has been open for only 6 months. They are a family that is very united and they are striving to get ahead economically. For this reason they are requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise at wholesale, so that they can earn greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Mohammad Amen Group

texts.en:
M. Amen group is made up of three members. M. Amen, the group leader, is 53 years old.  He is married and the father of six children – four sons and two daughters.  He has a retail food shop. He wants to buy different food for his shop in order to expand his business capacity. 

The second member of M. Amen group Is Ulfat.  He runs a cosmetic-selling business. Through its income he supports his family members. 

The third member is M. Qaseem, who is a tailor. He is requesting a loan to buy new equipment and clothes to expand his business and increase his income. 

The three members of M. Amen group have requested a group loan of 42,000 AFN.  They would like to express their thanks to all Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: to expand the businesses of the group members

loans.name: Mariela Yaquelin

texts.es:
la joven Mariela Yaquelin O. tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y es dueña de una pulperia que esta ubicada en el barrio San Jose de la ciudad de Pespire, su deseo es que su negocio sea cada vez mas grande y hacerlo un mercadito, desea mejorar su nivel de vida y asi poder casarce y formar una familia, Mariela esta solicitando el credito para poder surtir su negocio en esta temporada alta
y con ello obtener un poco mas de ganancias.
nos comento que se siente mu feliz ya que a su corta edad ya tiene su negocio propio y que le esta dando frutos. su mayor deseo es casarse y formar una familia.
texts.en:
The young lady Mariela Yaquelin O. is 21 years old, single and owner of a small grocery store located in the San Jose neighborhood of the city of Pespire. She wishes to grow her business into a larger store. She wants to improve her standard of living and thus be able to marry and start a family. Mariela is requesting the loan for the purpose of supplying her store for this busy season and wants to be able to increase her income. She commented that she was very happy to be able to have her own profitable business at such a young age. Her greatest wishes are to get married and have her own family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the convenience store.

loans.name: Léa

texts.fr: D. Léa est née le 15 Juillet 1985 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Léa est mariée à AMOUSSOU  Georges, un employé à la pâtisserie "Gerbes d'or" à Cotonou. Le couple a deux enfants. Un des enfants est scolarisé, et l'autre n'a pas encore l'âge d'être scolarisé. Tous les deux enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à Agbodjèdo, un quartier de Cotonou, depuis 4 ans. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Léa vend divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, sacs de riz, conserves, boissons en cannettes, etc.) dans sa boutique size à Kpankpan à Cotonou. Léa fait ses achats à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est depuis 5 ans que Léa exerce cette activité. Léa voudrait renforcer son stock de marchandise afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients. C'est pour cette raison que Léa sollicite ce premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Léa was born on July 15, 1985 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to AMOUSSOU Georges, an employee at the "Gerbes d'or" pastry shop in Cotonou.  The couple has two children.  One of the children is in school, and the other is not yet school-age. Both of the children have been living with their parents in Agbodjèdo, a district in Cotonou, for four years.  The couple supports the family jointly.  To meet her needs, Léa sells a variety of goods (pasta, rice, canned foods, canned drinks, etc.) in her store located in Kpankpan in Cotonou.  She does her buying at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She has been in this business for five years.  Léa would like to bolster her stock of merchandise in order to satisfy her customers better.  For this reason, she's requesting this first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of rice, pasta

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline N. is a 36-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has six children who are all in school. She has owned a beauty salon since 2004. 

Pauline is using her loan to purchase cosmetics, such as hair chemicals, hair relaxers, hair extensions, and jellies. Her shop is located in the Abaita Ababiri trading centre. Her future plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo Leonidas, de 68 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales vive con dos: Romario de 15, Ada de 12 años. Su casa (propia) está localizada en una zona alta y apacible de la sierra del Perú.

Arveja, habas, papa, maíz y flores de gladiolo en sus diferentes colores, son los productos agrícolas que siembra desde hace 35 años. Su esposo menciona que se enamoró de ella por lo trabajadora que era, es por eso que en la actualidad siembran en mayor cantidad con miras a progresar cada vez más.
Lo que más le gusta a Lidia de su labor es cosechar porque ve reflejado su esfuerzo en cada fruto que retira de los terrenos y de los cuales obtendrá ganancias considerables al comercializarlos en el mercado de la ciudad.
Ella considera que la agricultura es rentable porque le permite pagar la educación de sus hijos y porque les da de comer a diario. “En la chacra difícil que mueras de hambre porque puedes vivir aunque sea sancochando papa”, comenta.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete ante su banco comunal a pagar puntualmente como hasta ahora lo hizo porque sabe que su palabra está empeñada. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará ½ bolsa de semilla de arveja, una lata de flor de gladiolo y un saco de abono orgánico que esparcirá en la tierra para evitar que las plagas invadan sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Lidia is 42 years old. She lives with her husband Leonidas, who is 68 years old. She has three children, two of whom she lives with: Romario, 15, and Ada, 12. Her house (her own) is located in a high and peaceful area of the sierra of Peru. Peas, beans, potatoes, corn and various colors of gladiola flowers are the agricultural products that she has been planting for 35 years. Her husband mentions that he fell in love with her because of how hardworking she is. That is why now they are planting in greater quantitites and looking to progress more every day. What Lidia likes the most about her work is harvesting because she sees her work reflected in every product she takes from the earth and from these she will obtain considerable profits when taking them to sell in the market in town. She considers agriculture to be profitable because it allows her to educate her children and it feeds them everyday. "In the field it's hard to starve to death because you can live even if it's by boiling potatoes," she comments. This is the second loan she has had with MFP and she is committed, before her communal bank, to pay on time. Since she has done it so far, they know that her word is good. With the money that she is asking for now she will purchase 1/2 bag of pea seed and a can of gladiola flower and a bag of organic fertilizer which she will spread on the earth to avoid her plantings being invaded by pests.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Tulio Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Tulio Alberto A. M. trabaja en la universidad católica agropecuaria del trópico seco (ucatse) como responsable de área en ganado bovino el cual se encarga de darle mantenimiento al ganado y mantener en orden todos los datos actuales que se dan sobre inventario y manejo del rebaño. El crédito se le otorgo para la compra útiles escolares de sus hijos y otros gastos personales como: compra de uniformes, zapato y  mochilas. 

Tulio tiene mas de 8 años de estar laborando para  la universidad y se desempeña bien en el trabajo él es originario de una comunidad del departamento de Estelí llamada el pino. Antes de trabajar para la universidad él se dedicaba a la agricultura ya que trabajo con sus papá por muchos años hasta que se dependisó. Este señor es casado y tiene tres hijos en edad escolar en el nivel de primaria y apoya mucho a que ellos realicen sus estudios y puedan llenarlo de orgullo algún día siendo esta una de las principales metas.

Tulio expresa que también ayuda a sus padres y que siempre estará con ellos. Este es el sexto crédito que se le otorga y a demostrado una buena capacidad de pago plantea que desea seguir trabajando con ceprodel por mucho mas tiempo ya que se le a ayudado a solucionar muchos problemas el cual esta muy agradecido
texts.en:
Tulio Alberto A. M. works in the Catholic Agricultural University of Trópico Seco (UCATSE). He is in charge of the livestock. He takes care of them, and he keeps all of the current data about inventory and management of the herd in order. The loan is to buy school supplies and cover other personal expenses for his children. He will buy things like uniforms, shoes, and backpacks. Tulio has been working for the university for over eight years, and he does a good job. He is from a community called El Pino, which is in the Estelí department. Before working for the university he was a farmer. He worked with his father for many years until he became independent. He is married and has three school-age children who are in primary school. He gives them lots of support so that they can go to school, and one day they will fill him with pride because that is one of his main goals. Tulio says that he also helps his parents, and he will always be with them. This is his sixth loan, and he has demonstrated good payment capacity. He wants to keep working with Ceprodel for a long time. Ceprodel has helped him solve many problems, and he is very grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies and personal expenses for his children

loans.name: Mrs. Sat Sem Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan includes 14 people who live in Trapeang Young village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sat S. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She is a weaver in the local village and her husband, Mr. Cheng Rort, is a Khmer teacher and a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice to support his family. In order to expand her business, Mrs. Sat S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk for weaving. She is the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving

loans.name: Ladislao

texts.es:
Ladislao tiene 49 años, está casado y tiene 3 hijos, 2 varones y 1 mujer. Se dedica a la fabricación y venta de chipas, en su domicilio tiene montado su horno a leña el cual es utilizado para hornear su chipa, sus 2 hijos varones heredaron la misma profesión quienes lo ayudan para fabricar en mayor cantidad su producto, sus ventas lo realiza en las calles de asunción y los fines de semana en las canchas de futbol. Comenta que los días y horas de oficina tiene una clientela formada que lo espera de las distintas empresas públicas y privadas de la capital.
Con los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo comprar, queso y almidón en cantidad ya que en estas épocas tiende a subir de precios.
texts.en:
Ladislao is 49 years old, is married and has 3 children, 2 sons and 1 daughter. He makes and sells "chipas," Paraguayan cheesy buns. He has set up his wood oven for baking the chipas at his home. His 2 sons inherited the same profession and help him to make his products in greater quantity. He makes his sales on the streets of Asunción and on weekends at the soccer fields. He says that on business days he has a customer base in the different public and private sector companies in the capitol. With the loans he obtained from Fundación Paraguaya, he was able to buy cheese and manioc starch in bulk since prices tend to rise these days.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for preparation of chipas (manioc starch, cheese, milk, fat)

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Tuya is 47 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in an apartment. Her daughter, Nyuamsuren, is 20 years old and currently attends university. They have been living together in their current home for 17 years. Tuya operates a meat trading business at a local trading center in her town. She sells a variety of meat to her many customers at a counter which she rents.

Tuya started her business in 2001 with working capital of 50,000 tugrugs (~ 35 USD). After years of hard work and determination, her business capital now exceeds 1,000,000 tugrugs (~ 705 USD). She has a loyal customer base and attributes her growing success to her good communication skills and experience as a businesswoman. Tuya is very hopeful for the future and says, “I would like to purchase a car with my business profit.” She is requesting an 800,000 tugrug (~ 562 USD) loan to purchase more meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase meat to sell

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 35 years old and is married. He runs a photography and video coverage business where he produces videos and photographs to earn a living. He has been in the business for fourteen years and has two employees. He also sells stationery to increase his earnings.

Josphat belongs to a young group of entrepreneurs in Faulu Kenya where he saves his money. He has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy an instant photo machine. He hopes to grow his business and improve his living standards in the future.

loans.use: To buy an instant photo machine

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita C. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old. Lucita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lucita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lucita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lucita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lucita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her retail shop

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy machines to make gold molds, car batteries, ropes and a car alternator.

loans.name: Shining Star Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Agartha is a 54-year-old woman who describes herself as loyal.  She is the leader of the group named 'Shining Star'.   For the past 4 years, Agartha has been a palm oil trader.  Palm oil is reddish flavorful cooking oil used frequently here in preparation of food and sauces, produced from palm nuts.  Agartha will use the loan to buy palm nuts for her trade.  

Agartha is married and has 8 children.  Her hopes include providing her children with educational opportunities.

loans.use: buying palm fruits to produce palm oil

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María Santos tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, un distrito de territorio bastante accidentado debido a su cercanía con la sierra, su actividad principal es la agricultura, la zona se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, ella tiene una clientela fija que siempre acude a su establecimiento ya que el tiempo que lleva en el negocio, la calidad de los productos que ofrece y el buen trato que brinda a sus clientes le han hecho conocida en el rubro. Las ganancias que percibe de esta actividad las utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias, para lograr su objetivo de ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer alegre y dinámica, en la zona donde vive es bastante conocida por sus vecinos que la consideran una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, su mayor anhelo es crecer como empresaria para otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Santos is 35 years old, single, and lives with her family in the district of Oyotún. This district is situated in rocky territory since it is located near the mountains. Agriculture is the main industry in the area, which is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than 10 years, María has been selling basic necessities and groceries from a store she operates from her home. She has an established customer base that has always supported her the entire time she has been in business. The quality of the products she offers and the good service she provides to her customers have allowed her to become recognized in the area. With the revenue that her business generates, María has been able to cover her personal expenses and support her family.

María wants to expand her business by acquiring more products to satisfy the demand of her customers, increase her sales, and earn more income. To accomplish this goal, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN.

María is a cheerful and dynamic woman. In the area where she lives, she is well-known among her neighbors who consider her to be a hardworking and enterprising woman. Her greatest wish is to grow as a businesswoman so that she can provide her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries & basic necessities for her store

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice K., age 29, sells green vegetables at her local market. She is requesting a loan because she would like expand her offerings to include dried fish. With this loan, she will be able to stock an inventory of dried fish to sell. Loice and her husband, who works as a driver, have one child. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up her own shop.

About BRAC:

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights services, and legal services, all of which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is paticularly targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock dried fish to sell

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 38-year-old mother from Jabalia, a city in the Gaza Strip. She is the mother of one son and three daughters. Muna helps her husband by working in the home accessories store that he owns in the city.

Summer is the wedding season, which means a high demand for home accessories. Muna and her husband decided to take a $2,000 loan from FATEN to purchase more goods to respond to the increasing demand.

Muna and her husband, Yaser, who appears in the picture, hope to have a small weaving factory and produce their own products.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. is a 39-year-old modest lady from Bungoma town, Western Kenya. She is married to Thomas Kennedy and they have three children, ages 15, 10 and 8. They reside in Bungoma town.

Rose has a cereal shop in Bungoma town center and she has been operating this business for the last six years. She sells mainly maize and beans to meet the market demand in the area.  She knew of Kadet through a friend who is a client, and she joined to access micro-credit. She is taking out her first loan and plans to use it to buy four sacks of cereals to sell. 

From the profits she hopes to make, Rose plans to open another shop in the nearby town. Cereals are in high demand in the area and she wants to capitalize on that to generate income and also bring her business closer to the customers.

loans.use: To buy four sacks of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn Bunthoeurn, 34, is a widow who lives with four children in the Takeo province. Since 1980, she has been making brooms and baskets to sell at the local market, making $3 (USD) of profit a day. Besides this business, she also has a plot of farmland, and now she would like to take out a loan of $900 to purchase fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a single man who has been running an internet cafe for the last year, his customers being passersby and neighbours. With the requested loan of Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase equipment, a printer and memory cards. Hamisi faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand his business and make it completely sustainable in the future.

Hamisi decided to work with Yehu in order to get financial support. He lives at a rental house with electricity but no piped water, and his greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for the cafe, a printer, and memory cards for sale.

loans.name: Pwani Group

texts.en:
Mola R. is in his early forties and is married with six children. He owns and runs a quarrying business, selling his output at his shop which he has operated for eight years. The business is open between 6 a.m. and 12 noon and 4 p.m. to 6 p.m., and makes an acceptable monthly profit.
 
This will be Mola’s 2nd Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania (a Motisha loan is a loan product offered by Tujijenge that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended). He used his previous loan, a loan which he has successfully repaid, to increase his stock of dynamite, which he uses to separate the big rocks. He wishes to use this loan to support his wife’s food shop. His dream is to help the poor.
 
Mola will share this loan with his loan group, Pwani, which totals eleven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for the repayment of their loans.
 
In the photo, Mola can be seen in the middle of the back row.

loans.use: To invest in his wife's food shop

loans.name: Janeth Natividad

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo en Km 5 vía Manta  encontramos el Banco Comunal Loma De Los Vientos que se reúnen cada quince días, lugar de gente dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.

La señora Janet tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 7 años de la cual ha procreado dos hijos de seis y cinco años, su esposo es chofer de una volqueta.

Tiene un criadero de chanchos, cerca de su casa, allí tiene cerca de veinte chanchos de diversos tamaños, los cuales los cría y luego los vende en pie a compradores que llegan a comprar a su casa y otras veces los faena y vende la carne a sus vecinos y a tiendas del sector. Trabaja todos los días por ratos ya que no necesitan de muchos cuidados, dice que compra los chanchitos pequeños y los cría durante seis meses y que llegan a pesar hasta 200 libras, es allí cuando los vende y obtiene buenas ganancias.

Este nuevo crédito lo quiere invertir en comprar alimento para sus chanchos y ropa ya que quiere dedicarse también  a la venta de ropa y al parecer tiene algunos encargos. Es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco y le gustan los beneficios adicionales que brinda la Fundación Espoir.
 
Su sueño es darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo, towards Manta at kilometer 5, we find the Loma de los Vientos (Windy Hill) Communal Bank, which meets every 15 days in this place where people are dedicated to agriculture and raising livestock.

Janeth is 25 years old and has maintained a common law marriage for 7 years now, with 2 children, aged 6 and 5.  Her husband is a dump truck driver.

She has a pig breeding corral near her house and is raising around 20 pigs of diverse sizes.  After breeding and raising them, Janeth sells the pigs live to buyers who come to her house.  On other occasions, she butchers them and sells the meat to her neighbors or to stores in the region.

Janeth works for a time every day.  The pigs don't need much care.  She says she buys little pigs then raises them for about 6 months,and when they reach a weight of around 200 pounds, she sells them for a good profit.

Janeth wants this new loan to buy feed for the pigs, and to buy clothing, since she wishes to take up selling clothes.  It seems she already has some orders.  This is her 4th loan cycle with the bank and she enjoys the added benefits offered by the Espoir Foundation.

Janeth's dream is to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: BUYING FEED FOR HER PIGS AND CLOTHING TO SELL

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia Y. is currently in the business of selling beans, maize, etc., and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize and maize flour to sell. Cicilia is 30 years old and married to a policeman. She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rental.

loans.use: To stock more bags of maize and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice I. is 38 years old and married. Her husband is a businessman. She has four children who go to school.

Alice is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to work on building a house.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Remigio

texts.en:
Remigio R. is from the town of Banga. He is 60 years old, married and has ten children. Most of his children are adults and married already. Remigio is a farmer and he earns money by planting and harvesting rice crops. At his age, he is still strong enough to keep up with farming duties. Remigio still wants to help provide for his family. He also wants to be able to extend his support to his grandchildren.

Remigio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Remigio is requesting a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers. This will be his first loan from CEVI. He plans to use additional revenue to support his family financially.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Mrs. Juliet F. is from the Barangay of Mayor’s Village,Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years-old and married to Cristituto F..  They are blessed with eight children who are all school age. To make a living, she is presently engaged in selling snacks particularly “puto and salad” business. Her husband is a construction worker. She’s been engaged in this kind of business for one year already. She’s earns an average amount of not less than P3,000.00 a month from this business. 

In the year 2006, Juliet joined Kiva parter PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet, as an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities, has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php6,500.00. She is now requesting a loan of Php6,500.00 as her fourth loan which will be used to provide additional capital for her snack vending “puto and salad” business. The future income of this business will be used to meet their basic needs, to make loan repayments and pay for the children’s education. She also joined PAGLAUM MPC because of the savings and insurance program offered by PAGLAUM MPC to its members. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her snack selling business.

location.town: Tudela-Mayor Village Lapasan, Clarin Mis Occ

loans.name: Togtuur

texts.en:
Togtuur D. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Selenge province, Mongolia. The family lives in the house of her husband's parents who both passed away. Her two sons attend a local secondary school and her husband works as a driver in his town. 

Togtuur operates a consumer goods trading business at a local market. She began her consumer goods sales business in 2006 after operating a grocery products trading business which was started in 2003. In addition, she purchases a variety of food products from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia and transports them back to her town in order to sell those products through grocery shops as a wholesaler. 

After years of successful operation, she has gained significant experience as a businesswoman. For the future, she plans to expand her business and have her own workplace. Togtuur is a hard-working woman and says, "I want to buy or build my own house and fence where my family can live in the future." She requesting a 800,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more underclothes and locks.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Ros L., age 42, is married to Savouern, age 41. She has three children, two of whom are single and one is married. Ros L. is a local farmer, and she grows rice crops as well as making baskets. Ros L. can earn an income of approximately $2.5 per day in order to help the whole family with daily expenses. Her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees in and around his community, collecting palm juice. This rice harvesting season, Ros L. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice is commanding the highest price. She will use the remainder fund for assisting her husband to buy containers for collecting palm juice.

loans.use: To stock up rice while prices are low, for future sales.

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en su tercer ciclo. Todas las integrantes son muy responsables y buscan el progreso de sus familias. La Sra. Carmen F. se dedica a la venta de comestibles, orgarganiza actividades como la creación de este grupo "Virgen de Fátima".
Económicamente cuenta con la ayuda de sus cinco hijos.
texts.en: This committee is on its third loan cycle. All of the members are very responsible and seek to make life better for their families. Mrs. Carmen F. sells groceries and organises activities such as setting up this group "Virgen de Fatima". She is able to save money thanks to the help of her five children.

loans.use: To buy the ingredients for empanadas such as meat, chicken, cassava, eggs and corn; also fruit such as bananas, pineapples, oranges, melons and apples, etc.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor J., from the village of Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro City, is 44 years old, married and has five grown children. To make a living, Flor owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including sardines and milk fish in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Flor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPF that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is now requesting her third loan for 11000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell including salmon and mackerel. Flor plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as salmon and mackerel

location.town: Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Liliya

texts.en:
Liliya is married with two sons. She lives in Gladkovka. Liliya is a farming entrepreneur. She grows early spring vegetables, i.e., tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, carrots, and peppers in her greenhouses. Liliya sells her produce retail and wholesale to vendors from other regions of Ukraine.  

Liliya has been in the trade for 6 years. She has invested about 100,000 Grivnyas in this enterprise. Her monthly net profit amounts to 5,400 Grivnyas. Currently, Liliya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase seeds, polyethylene film, wood, and fertilizers for her greenhouses. She loves running this business and is hoping to continue see it flourish and develop even further.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for greenhouse maintenance

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 39 years old, married, and a father of three. He has been doing carpentry for 12 years now. His previous work was supplying bread to earn his living. As a member of Faulu Kenya, he has benefited from their training in financial management. This has helped him run his business well. He hopes to become the leading supplier of furniture in his local area. With this loan of 40,000 Kes, he will buy timber.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: 050120- Bac Hai - Hoang Phong Group

texts.en:
Sam H. T. is  48 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. They live in the town of H. hoa-Thanh hoa.  Sam is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 050120-Bac Hai-H. Phong.

To making a living, Sam operates a family member's general store.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Sam has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, Sam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Sam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,616,900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This  will be Sam's second loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Sam plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the other borrowers in the group:
1.  Thuong L. T. is 41 years old and is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Ly L. T. is 46 years old and is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Thu L. T. is 54 years old and is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.

4.  Loi L. T. is 47 years old and is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

5.  Mai L. T. is 38 years old and is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla A. is from the city of Tabid, Ozamiz City. She is 44 years old. Perla is married with five adult-aged children. Perla owns and operates a motor transport service. Perla has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Perla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Perla is requesting her first loan from GDMPC in the amount of 5000 PHP to repair her existing vehicle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Nicida

texts.es:
Nicida tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el sector Laran del distrito de Monsefú, una zona conocida por sus festividades turísticas y religiosas. La zona se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí  ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con una antigüedad de 10 años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad ella ha podido sacar adelante a su familia durante todo este tiempo ayudando a su esposo para solventar los gastos familiares.

Nicida desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Nicida, 45, is married living with her family in Monsefú District’s Laran sector, a zone noted for its touristic and religious festivals.  The zone is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a general store located in her home.  She sells her neighbors various daily use items like basic need items and groceries.  The store has been in operation for 10 years and has a well established regular clientele.  Thanks to this activity she’s been able to move her family ahead helping her husband to meet family expenses.

Nicida wants to expand the business buying more merchandise to meet customer demand.  Because of this she’s deemed it advisable to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en:
Kazungu is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He rents a house that has electricity and piped water, and his greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past 10 years, Kazungu has operated a butcher shop, selling to his neighbours and other town dwellers. One of the major challenges he faces in his business is the high cost of transportation.  He decided to join Kiva field partner Yehu to access loans with the hopes of boosting his business.  With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings from this loan, Kazungu wants to purchase a freezer for his butcher shop. 

In the future, Kazungu dreams of expanding his business by establishing a slaughter house.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to use in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Lerina

texts.en:
Lerina is 34 years old, married and blessed with two children.  He is a farmer and has been doing this for the last three years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.  He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. 

This will be Lerina's second loan, which he is planning to use for maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and to educate his children.  His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home.

loans.use: buy maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Buscando El Exito (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Buscando el Éxito está formado por 11 mujeres que son amigas y vecinas, trabajan en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar  adelante a sus familias, son personas muy amables y cordiales. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad muy culta y llena de tradiciones,  cuenta con una variada gastronomía y también es reconocida por ser  cuna de grandes poetas y deportistas.

La Señora. Rosa vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 55 años, esta  separada y tiene 6 hijos de 33, 30, 26, 24, 17, 15 años de edad, tres de sus hijos son  casados e independientes, su segundo hijo es soltero, trabaja y le ayuda económicamente y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Rosa hace 6 años se dedica a vender pinchos (carne en palito) y maduros asados, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo. También se dedica a limpiar de casas y a lavar ropa.

En el banco comunal está en su cuarto crédito y fue invitada por su sobrina a ser parte del mismo, el dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de carne, papas, plátano verde, aceite, salchichas, cebollas, pimientos, pinchos de madera, etc. para incrementar y crecer en su negocio. 

Su meta es tener una tienda. 

En la foto nos acompaña un chico que está vestido con una chompa negra con mangas rojas, es el hijo una de las socias. Los otros niños tambien son hijos de las socias.
texts.en:
Eleven women who are friends and neighbors established the “Seeking Success” Community Bank. They work in different businesses, but all the business help them to economically support their homes and progress with their families. They are friendly and cordial people. They live in different places in Cuenca City, a city very sophisticated and full of traditions. They city has a variety of cuisine and it is also known for its great poets and athletes.
Mrs. Rosa lives in the outskirts of Cuenca. She is 55 years old, separated from her husband and has six children ages 33, 30, 26, 24, 17, 15. Three of her children are married and independent. Her second son is single, works, and helps her economically. Her last two children attend high school in the city. They don’t have their own home. They lease a house.
For the past six years Mrs. Rosa has been selling brochettes (meat on a stick) and roasted plantains. She works from Monday to Saturday but she doesn’t have a fixed schedule. She also cleans houses and washes clothes.
This is her fourth loan with the community bank. She was invited by her niece to be part of the bank. The money from the loan will be used to buy meat, potatoes, green plantains, oil, sausages, pimentos, wood sticks, etc. She wants to increase and grow her business. 
Her goal is to have a store.
In the photo there is a boy that is dressed in a black sweater with red sleeves. This is the son of one of the members. The other children also belong to the members.

loans.use: to buy meat, potatoes, green plantains, oil, sausages, onions, pimentos, wood sticks, etc.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is a 50-year-old married man living in Pinopoc Alcala, Cagayan. He has three school-aged children. Leonardo's spouse works as a housekeeper.

Leonardo has been in the business of hog raising for three years. As of now, all his hogs are disposed of and he earned PHP 5,000. He is requesting a loan as additional capital to purchase new pigs to raise and buy the necessary feed for maintenance. 

In the future, Leonardo would like to educate all his children by sending them to school and earn additional income to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva, 51, is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Cionito and the mother of two children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Minerva operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Minerva earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling each item. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Minerva hopes to be able to expand her business soon, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day, and finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her business's product inventory.

loans.name: Ganchina
