texts.ru: Ганчина проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 23 года. Она замужем. У нее детей нет. Она занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. В основном она закупает телят, откармливает и продает их по более выгодной цене. В этой области она уже два года. В продвижении ее деятельности ей помогает ее муж. Она берет кредит для закупа двух голов телят.
texts.en: Ganchina lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 23 years old, married and has no children.  She is involved in animal husbandry and breeds cattle at her home.  She primarily buys calves, fattens them up and sells them at a more profitable price.  She has been in this business for two years.  Ganchina's husband helps her with growing her business.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of two calves.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Benkola 6 Group

texts.fr:
BENKOLA 6 est constitué de 10 femmes mariées  qui  ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, KANIMAN,   la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare  de riz.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkola 6 Group are married women who, on average, are 38 years old and have three children. They live in polygamous families in Baou, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Kaniman, the second woman sitting at the left-hand side of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for labor to cultivate around 0.25 hectares of farmland to grow rice. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Baou, Koula, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 25,000 CFA francs by the end of the season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es:
María, tiene 32 años de edad, es originaria de chichigalpa un municipio de Chinandega pero vive en León, es madre de 2 niños, ella es comerciante, tiene un kiosko donde vende  comida desde hace 5 años. Su primer negocio fue venta de ropa a la edad de 18 años de edad, después decidió poner un negocio de venta de comidas y bebidas en la calle principal cerca de su vecindario donde su esposo la ayuda atender el negocio.   
Requiere el préstamo para hacer reparaciones a su local ,pues así le dará una mejor presentación a su negocio y podrá ser mas atractivo para los clientes, pues uno de sus objetivos es darle mas publicidad a su negocio y así vender mas su comidas. En sus planes futuros ella quiere poner una tienda de mercadería general y seguir mejorando su negocio de venta de comidas.
texts.en:
María, age 32, is from Chichigalpa, a municipality in Chinandega.  However, she lives in León.  She has two children, and she is a merchant.  She has a kiosk where she has been selling food for five years.

Her first business was selling clothes when she was 18 years old.  After that she decided to set up a business selling food and drinks on the main street close to her neighborhood.  Her husband helps her take care of the business.

She needs the loan to make repairs to her place of business.  This will give her business a better appearance, and she will sell more food.

In the future she plans to set up a general merchandise store and to continue improving her food sales business.

loans.use: to make repairs to her place of business in order to give it a better appearance.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with five children. Two of his children attend school and three have graduated from school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past seven years, he has operated a business buying and selling farm products at the market to her his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business.

With the KSHS 40,000, he wants to purchase sacks of maize for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Nuevas Emprendedoras 3 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Dignorah is one of 10 members in a group of business people called  "Nuevas Emprendedoras 3 & 5" (new entrepreneurs). She is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business of selling empanadas for 3 years. These round dumplings are filled with vegetables, meat or cheese, are fried or baked, and eaten as a snack or dinner.

Dignorah is 21 years old and says that her biggest challenges are to finish school and become a professional. She also wants to have a family and a successful bakery. Cooking is one of her favorite activities and that's why she is turning her passion into a business.

Dignorah plans to use this loan to buy flour, meat, vegetables, cooking oil, baking soda, eggs, and other ingredients. She will save the profits and reinvest so she can fill any need.

All the members in this group are taking the loan to improve their businesses and their lives. They are located in the city of Los Alcarrizos, a very industrial city, in northern Santo Domingo. Dignorah thanks all of you for such amazing support!!!

loans.use: to buy flour, meat, vegetables, cooking oil, and other ingredients for her empanada business.

loans.name: Nancy Piedad

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy es socia del banco comunal El Cisne, vive por una comunidad alrededor de la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia esta rodeada de montañas las mismas que nos regalan hermosos paisajes, su gente es muy amable, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La. Señora. Nancy tiene 36 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 18, 16, 8 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija es casada e independiente, su segunda hija trabaja y le ayuda económicamente y sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es labora en una carpintería, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Doña Nancy es negociante de cerdos hace 10 años y vende solo días de ferias, en su casa se dedica a la cría de cerdos, cuyes y pollos. También labora en la agricultura y lo que cosecha solo para su consumo.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 10 años y es una de las socias fundadoras de este banco comunal. Este nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos para continuar con el negocio. 

Su meta es ampliar su negocio y dedicarse a criar más animales.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of 'El Cisne' (The Swan) community bank.  She lives in a community in El Valle parish.  This parish is surrounded by mountains which provide us with beautiful landscapes.  The people are very kind and they maintain the culture and traditions of their parents.  They work in commerce, raise animals and farm.

Nancy is 36 years old, married, and has four children from her marriage aged 18, 16, 8 and 6.  Her eldest [daughter] is married and lives independently, her second [daughter] works and helps her financially and her two youngest children are attending an elementary school in the city.  Her husband works in a carpentry workshop and they own their own home.

Nancy has been a pig dealer for 10 years and she only sells on market days.  She raises pigs, guinea pigs and chickens at home.  She also farms.  What she harvests is for her family's consumption only.

Nancy has been a member of her community bank for ten years.  She is one of the founding members of the bank.  She will invest this new loan in buying pigs so that she can continue with her business.

Nancy's goal is to expand her business and raise more animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Dédé Abra

texts.fr:
Dédé est une femme  âgé(e) de 20 ans. Elle est mariée å un enseignant. Elle a 02 enfants.
Dédé travaille comme revendeuse de bijoux depuis 2004. Elle vend au Grand Marché de Lomé.
Dédé a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bijoux pour répondre à la demande de la population togolaise.
texts.en: Dédé is a twenty year old woman. She is married to a teacher. She has two children. Dédé has worked as a jewelry reseller since 2004. She sells at the Grand Marché in Lomé. Dédé requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy jewelry to respond to the demands of the Togolese population.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 56 years old. She is married with 1 child. Nora has a piece of land cultivated with vegetables and fruit trees, which in time can be harvested with the intention to sell. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy insect sprays and fertilizers. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides and fertilizers for the vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is married with 5 siblings. She is 48 years old from Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a motorcycle transport business in her community to make a living, and she has had this business for more than two years. Each month, she earns approximately Php 1,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan in the amount of Php 15,000 to pay for new spare parts and maintenance. Nenita has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She is hoping that her type of business will last. She will use her income for sending her five kids to school and to support their daily needs.

loans.use: to pay for new spare parts and maintenance.

loans.name: Eiva

texts.es: Eiva, de 39 años, esta separada desde hace diez años. Vive en compañía de sus tres hijos de 20, 18 y 15 años de edad en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Eiva es la elaboración de manualidades, como bolsones, zapatos; asimismol bisuterías, como: collares y joyas en plata, productos que elabora ella misma. Aprendió este oficio gracias a una capacitación a los que asistió con el fin de crear su propia empresa. Desde hace diez años que se dedica a esta actividad, y gracias al apoyo de su hijo que fue importante en éste trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el sentirse ocupada, además el de estar en casa para atender a sus hijos. Considera rentable su negocio porque gana hasta un 100% de lo invertido, además su elaboración es deacuerdo al pedido que le hacen sus clientes. Su plan es abrir una boutique donde pueda exhibir sus productos, y lograr ser una prospera empresaria. Este sería el préstamo número diez con la institución MFP, considera a los miembros de su banco grupal ser buenas personas y puntuales, y se apoyan entre ellos. Con el préstamo que solicita, comprará piedrecitas, alambres, cadenas, mostacillas y demás, que son accesorios para la elaboración de bisuterías.
texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year-old Eiva has been separated for 10 years now.  She lives in her own home with her three children, who are 20, 18, and 15 years old.  

Eiva makes handicrafts for a living, such as bags and shoes, as well as costume jewelry, such as necklaces and jewels set in silver.  She learned this profession thanks to a training she attended in order to start her own business.  She has been doing this for 10 years now thanks to her son's support, as he has been important to her work.  What she likes about this work is keeping herself occupied, as well as being at home to take care of her children.  She thinks her business is profitable because she gets back up to 100% of what she invests and she makes her pieces according to her customers' orders.  Her plan is to open a boutique where she can display her products and become a prosperous businesswoman.  

This will be her tenth loan with MFP.  She thinks the members of her communal bank are punctual, good people who support each other.  With the loan she is asking for, she will buy small stones, wire, chains, beads, and other things that she needs to make her costume jewelry.

loans.use: to buy precious stones, wire, chains, and beads to make costume jewelry.

loans.name: Emin

texts.en:
Emin, age 32, is a married man with two children. He hopes that this loan will help him to improve his income a little and improve his living conditions. 

From the time he was young, Emin was learning to work as a cattle breeder.  After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice.  He saw his family progressing more and more. 

He was introduced to AqroInvest by his neighbors and this is his first loan. Emin plans to use the loan of 1000 AZN to buy two more cattle which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.use: to buy two more cattle.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
This is Lani, who is 47 and a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Edgar, a vendor, and she is a mother to their four children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lani operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and resells it with a little profit. Her products are plastic tent roofing and other similar products. She attracts customers by offering low prices and many options. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy plastic roofing products and other items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lani hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and dreams of providing her children a bright future. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of plastic roofing products needed in her business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives in Kampala, Uganda .She is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Catherine has a restaurant at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for five years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested a loan of 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy rice, Irish potatoes and sweet potatoes and flour. Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her business so as to serve more customers. 

Catherine lives in a  rented house and the  family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rice, flour, Irish potatoes  and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Budiriro 1 Group

texts.en:
Rugare is a 50-year-old married woman from Zimbabwe with five children aged 28, 23, 21, 20 and 13 years old. Four of them are still going to school. 

She is into the agriculture business of poultry. The business has operated for 15 years. She has requested a loan of $400 to buy day-old chicks and feed. With the extra income from this loan, Rugare will be able to diversify into keeping layers and start another business selling eggs. The loan will also improve the standard of living of her family. She says the challenges faced are the unavailability of stock feed and in some cases, day-old chicks. She is planning to own a grocery shop in the Masvingo Central business district where she will sell both groceries and chicken meat.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 26 years old and is married to Daniel.  They support five people within the family.

Dorcas has been operating an M-pesa outlet (mobile phone money transfer service), depositing and withdrawing money for clients for the last two years earning a monthly income of KES 70,000.  She is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000.  She plans to use the profits to provide the family with basic needs. 

Her hopes and is to expand her business and open another M-pesa outlet in future.

loans.use: To add extra cash float for withdrawal by M-pesa customers (mobile money transfer).

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa is a petty trader. She trades in food warmers, plastic plates, trays and bowls. Adwowa is single and has four children.  Adwowa has been a petty trader for five years. As a single parent, she is responsible for feeding, clothing and paying her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase food warmers, plastic plates, trays and bowls to sell. She hopes to save the new profit from her expanded business to give her children the best education.

loans.use: to purchase a food warmer, plastic plates, trays and bowls to sell

loans.name: Javier Alberto

texts.es:
Javier tiene 49 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual es caracterizada por su clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Javier vive al lado de su esposa con quien tiene 2 hijos de 24 y 10 años, por quienes ha trabajo y sigue luchando para poder darles una vida digna y sean personas de bien.  Cuando dispone de un tiempito libre le encanta cocinar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”.

Con mucho entusiasmo Javier trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de leña y servicios de jardinería, el trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es honrado.

Javier está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar repuestos para su moto sierra, ya que es su herramienta de trabajo y actualmente se encuentra malograda, con esta ayuda el podra darle un mantenimiento y repararla y así seguir trabajando  con muchas ganas para poder salir adelante y hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y comprar un camión”.

loans.use: Para compra de repuestos de motosierra

loans.name: Miguel Alfonso

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del amor se encuentra ubicado al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha, este Cantón es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de la variedad de flora y fauna silvestre que en el mismo se encuentran.
En este Cantón vive y trabaja en una vulcanizadora y cerrajería Don Miguel, un hombre luchador de estado civil soltero no tiene hijos.
Don Miguel desea emprender en el negocio de producción de pollos broiler tiene mucho conocimiento de este negocio ya que sus familiares se dedican a esta actividad de aquí su experiencia el negocio lo tendrá en la finca de sus Padres, le dedicara un promedio de 5 horas diarias, su madre y su hermano le ayudaran en las mañanas,para este negocio tiene destinado el espacio suficiente y un galpón casi listo para iniciar en esta actividad.
El señor Miguel agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos, aka El Cantón del Amor (the Love Canton), is a canton located in the northwestern part of the Pichincha province. Many national and international tourists come to visit this canton to enjoy its wide variety of wild flora and fauna.

Miguel lives and works in this canton. He is a resourceful man, he is single and has no children. He works at a tyre repair and locksmith.

Miguel wants to start a new activity breeding broiler chickens. He knows a lot about this activity as his relatives engage in this business. He will set his activity in his parents' farm, and he will work in it for about 5 hours a day; his mother and brother will help him in the mornings. He has enough space and the shed he needs to start this activity is almost ready.

Miguel is grateful to Kiva for the support provided and the chance he has been given.

loans.use: Para la compra de pollos , balanceado y contrucción de los galpones para la crianza de pollos.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 58 years old, married with eight children.

Amy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other snack foods.

Amy has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Amy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, shampoo, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other snack foods

loans.name: Perla Edith

texts.en:
Perla is a friendly hard-working woman who lives in Monclava, Coahuila. She has three gorgeous kids (ages 3, 6 and 7) and she worries about getting her children a good education and a better quality of life. Her husband works at a private company but his salary is not enough to cover all the family’s expenses. This is why Perla started her own business. It is a way to support her husband. She needs $150 USD to buy merchandise for her lingerie business. She mentioned that she would like to get ready for this Christmas season when there’s a higher demand for her products. She and her family are hoping for your support and generosity. Thank you!

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva Volunteer.

Perla es una persona amigable y muy trabajadora vive en Monclava, Coahuila y tiene 3 hermosos hijos de 3, 6, y 7 años de edad, por lo que ella está muy preocupada porque sus hijos tengan una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Su esposo es un obrero de una empresa privada, sin embargo su salario no le permite cubrir con todos los gastos de la familia. Por esta razón Perla inició su propio negocio y de esta manera apoya a su esposo.

Ella requiere de $150 USD para comprar mercancía, ya que Perla se dedica a la venta de lencería y comenta que quiere prepararse para estas fechas navideñas donde la demanda por sus productos es muy alta. Ella y su familia esperan de tu apoyo y generosidad; gracias!

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
I have been running my small business, a general store that sells popular consumer goods, for five years. Because of my age, I had to look for a business in which I could work and also attend to my husband. The income from the store helps me cover our health and family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo cinco anos de tener mi pequeno negocio en donde vendo productos de consumo popular, por mi edad tuve que buscar un negocio en el que pudiera atender a mi esposo. Con los ingresos que percibo de esta pulperia me ayuda a cubrir nuestros gastos familiares y de salud.

loans.use: Buy milk, bread, eggs, beverages, coffee, sugar, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock for her green grocery business

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba K. is 40 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband works in Russia for a building company. She is a nurse by education, but because her hospital salary is not enough, she has been in this business 10 years.

Matluba started business with food stuffs and now also sells soaps, powders and other products. She wants to extend the assortment of goods she sells. She buys goods from suppliers on credit and wants to purchase in cash because it is cheaper. Her children help her every day now that they are on vacation from their secondary school. Matluba wants to enable her husband to return home.

loans.use: Expand the assortment of goods offered

loans.name: Elmin

texts.en:
Elmin M. is 26 years old.  He is single.  He was born in the Sumqayit region of Azerbaijan.  Sumqayit is situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan.  Currently, he lives in Sumgayit city with his family.  His father and mother live with him.  His parents are old and ill, therefore, he is the only breadwinner of his family.  

He is a cab driver.  He began his business 4 years ago.  Elmin is a good and experienced driver, but this job is very hard.  Elmin currently rents a car to be able to earn money for his family.  He has gathered some money to buy a car, but it is not enough, so he needs to borrow money.  

Elmin would like to receive a loan of $800 in order to buy a car, build a garage for his car and to buy necessary tools and equipment.  He will repay the loan within 12 months.  He hopes to eventually expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family.  He helps with the family’s expenses and with this income, Elmin will repay his loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy a car, build a garage for his car and buy necessary tools and equipment

loans.name: Maliana

texts.en: Maliana L.’s barbeque business generates most of her family income. She supports her husband who is unemployed, and her three children. Although it is difficult for Ms. L., who is 31 years old, she is determined to keep up her good work and earn more than 500 tala ($200 US) to cover her loan. She sells her barbequed food five days a the week by the road side in front of her house.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her barbecue business

loans.name: Naime

texts.en: Naime is a 64 year old grandmother who lives and works in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. Naime owns a grocery shop and is requesting $1,200, her  fifth loan from Al Majmoua, to buy merchandise for the store. Naime is a remarkable woman, a widow who is raising her grandson because his mother died. Naime is striving on her own  to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Vanny (age 28) and her husband, Mr. Pet Sophy (age 34) have been married since 1999. They have three daughters. All of her daughters are still young and stay at home. Vanny and her family live along national road 1, south of Phnom Penh. She is in business raising pigs. She started her business in 2000. Her husband is working for a company in Kean Svay district.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time for the amount of $700. She will use this loan to purchase baby pigs and feed for pigs.

loans.use: To purchase baby pigs and feed for pigs

loans.name: Busogo Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mariam K.. She is currently in the business of running a drug shop and is requesting a loan to buy more drugs to sell and boost business. Mariam is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 4 children ranging from age 3 to 14 and all of them go to school. Each week, Mariam makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. Mariam has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 450000 in order to by dental forceps and the loan was paid back on time.

Mariam is joined in her small group by Prossy N., Sylvia N., Sarah B., and Monica N.. Prossy N. has a business in poultry keeping and wants to carry out lumbering. Sylvia N. is currently operating a business selling snacks and wants a loan to expand her business. Sarah B. operates a drug shop business and wants to purchase more drugs to sell. Monica N. is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: To add stock to her drug shop

loans.name: Eshkuzi

texts.en: A. Eshkuzi is 52 years old and is married with three children. Eshkuzi has been raising and selling cattle since 2000. Every morning he gets up at 6am in order to feed the animals and look after them. Eshkuzi now sells 2 cows per month. The business is successful and generates a stable income for his family, allowing them to  improve their living conditions. Today Eshkuzi requests a loan of 2000.00 Somoni (600.00 US Dollars) for 12 months. The loan is required for the purchasing of  cattle and of fodder for them. This is the first loan for Eshkuzi and he thanks everyone for trusting and supporting him and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: To expand a cattle business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 29 years old, married and has a three-year-old son. She runs a beauty salon and a shop. She started these businesses a year ago, and works from 6:30 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. managing them. The salon brings her a monthly profit of about $35, and the shop brings in about $280.

In the past, Paulina used a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy products for her beauty salon. Having paid this loan back successfully, she has applied a new loan to buy more products for her shop.

Paulina belongs to a loan group known as Umoja, whose 22 members ensure that the loans they take out will be repaid.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell from her shop

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothea D. and her husband Mr. Thoeun SO have been married since 2000 and have two children: a son and a daughter. Their son is in school, while the daughter is still too young and stays at home. The family lives on an island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sothea has been running a grocery for four years. She buys grocery items from the market in Phnom Penh for resale at her store in front of the house. Her husband has been working as an ice seller for the past 7 years. He buys ice from a factory at a suburb of Phnom Penh for resale at his village.

Mrs. Sothea is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike for carrying goods from Phnom Penh to sell at her shop.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike for carrying goods from Phnom Penh to sell at a shop

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim H., 40, lives in small southern village in the Imishli region. He is married and has two sons.

He owns a store where he sells spare parts and other products for automobiles. This store is the only source of income for the family. Salim has applied for a loan to purchase spare car parts that are in high demand from his customers. These additional sales will increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase more automobile spare parts

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Mrs. Reyna belongs to the Las Kantuta de Willkauta Population Center Mulla Contihueco Communal Bank of the Juli district, province of Chucuito Juli, region of Puno. She decided to become a member because she lacked the capital to acquire more material for embroidery.

With the first loan of 300 new soles ($125) that she received, she bought 4 kilos of black yarn and 50 balls of colored yarn. With this loan of 800 new soles ($300), which she will repay over 6 months, she will buy 5 kilos of red yarn and a young bull to fatten in order to increase her income and production of embroidery.

Reyna is happy with her work and her greatest dream is to improve the production of her embroideries and sell them abroad. She would use the money to pay for her children’s studies, as tomorrow they will be professionals.

She is 24 years old, lives with her husband, and studied until the 11th grade. Her husband supports her in her embroidery art and he weaves cloth on a loom and makes polleras (pleated skirts) in order for the two of them to be united and excel together.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Reyna pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Kantuta de Willkauta del Centro Poblado Mulla Contihueco del distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito Juli y región Puno. Ella decidió ser socia por falta del capital para adquirir más material para producción de bordado.

Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles adquirió 4 kilos de lana negro y 50 ovillos de lana de colores. Con este crédito de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en un plazo de seis meses, comprará 5 kilos de lana rojo y un torete para engordar, así mejorará sus ingresos económicos y su producción de bordados.

Ella esta contenta con su trabajo y su mayor sueño es mejorar su producción de Bordados para comercializar a mercados externos y con ello solventar los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos, para que ellos mañana más tarde sean profesionales.

Tiene 24 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria, vive con su esposo quien le apoya en el arte del bordado, teje telar de bayeta y confecciona polleras, para sobresalir juntos y unidos.

loans.use: Buy yarn in bulk and buy a young bull

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is 50 years old. She married 18 years ago, but after many years separated from her husband. Since then she supported her children, but now she lives alone as her three sons are living independently.

Ana has always been dedicated to her work, but since she separated from her husband she had to work even harder in order to support her children. First, she started a business selling food. She rented a small place and set up a restaurant. As time passed and she was not able to meet the demands of the restaurant, Ana decided to change her business to something a little quieter, and set up a small grocery store which she named 'Anita'. She works almost all day long, opening at 8 in the morning and often closing at 2 in the morning. Ana likes to treat her clients well, and considers them her friends. The difficulty is that she is very tired at the end of the day and if she wants her business to run well she has to open seven days a week.

She has educated her children and they are independent, now Ana wants to make sure she is provided for in her old age.

With the money from this loan Ana will open a branch of her little shop 'Anita' which she hopes will generate more profits. She feels that with a lot of effort she will achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Ana tiene 50 años, se casó a los 18 años, pero luego de muchos años, se separó de su esposo, desde entonces tuvo que mantener a sus hijos, pero actualmente vive sola ya que sus tres hijos se independizaron.

Ana siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar, pero desde que se separó de su esposo tuvo que dedicarse mucho más, para poner mantener a sus tres hijos, primero incursionó en el negocio de la venta de comida, alquiló un pequeño local y puso un pequeño restaurante, al pasar el tiempo y no abasteciéndose para atender el restaurante Ana se decidió a cambiar de negocio por algo más tranquilo y poner una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, a la cual le puso de nombre “Anita”, le dedica casi todo el día, abriendo desde las 8 de la mañana y muchas veces cerrando a las 2 de la mañana, debido a la concurrencia de su negocio por los vecinos, a Ana le gusta tratar bien a sus clientes, a quienes considera sus amigos, lo difícil, es que termina muy cansada y si quiere que su negocio produzca debe atender de lunes a domingo. Al encontrarse sola, habiendo educado a sus hijos, siendo ellos ahora independientes quiere asegurar su vejez.

Con el dinero del préstamo Ana pondrá una sucursal de su tiendita “Anita” la cual espera genera mayores ganancias, se siente con muchas ganas y mucha fuerza para cumplir sus metas.

loans.use: To open another branch of her grocery store.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es productora de leche de vaca, percibe un sueldo quincenal por la venta de la leche, además cultiva flores y verduras  las cuales son vendidas en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de La Paz.

Tiene casa propia y vive con su hija en la población de Palomar (Rio abajo).

El crédito sera usado para adquirir una vaca lechera ya que desea incrementar sus ventas.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro, califica para obtener el prestamo .
texts.en:
Luisa is a milk cow producer. She perceives a fortnightly salary for the sales of the milk, also she cultivates flowers and vegetables which are sold in different fairs of the city of La Paz. She has her own house and she lives with his daughter in the city of Palomar. The loan will be used to acquire a dairy cow since she wants to increase her sales. This is her first loan with Impro, she qualifies to obtain the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta S., 32, is married with 2 children. She has many years of experience in the Pork Buns business. She sells to the village and the public 6 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Eseta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, dripping oil and a frying pan. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, dripping oil, and a frying pan

loans.name: Mr. Morn Chek Group

texts.en:
Mr. Morn C., the 26-year-old father of two childR. aged one and four years, is the group leader of four people who live in Niel Village in Takeo Province. Morn is an ice-cream seller who makes a small income that helps support his family while his wife, Mrs. Eim Ry, owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living. However, due to the infertility of the soil, Morn is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to revitalize it.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support his wife's rice field.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina, a member of the Dos Mil (Two Thousand) Village Bank, is 48 years old and married with five children. Selling potatoes from a stand in the Las Americas market, she also travels to regional fairs to sell clothing and buy grains.

Justina is now requesting a loan to buy more potatoes to sell, and her dreams are to expand her business, proviD. her children with a good education, and remain healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

loans.use: To buy potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Thảo năm nay 39 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và  2 con nhỏ tại huyện Quảng Xương tỉnh Thanh Hóa. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ đầu năm  2008. Hiện tại  ngoài chăn nuôi và trồng trọt gia đình chị còn làm thêm nghề in chiếu với tổng thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được  vay 5.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lê Thị Thảo, 39 years old, lives with her husband and two young children in Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hóa province. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2008. Presently, in addition to raising animals and growing crops, her family makes extra money printing decorative images onto bamboo sleeping mats. The total income of the family is about 3,000,000 VND (180 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 5,000,000 VND (300 USD) to invest in buying pigs to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul O. is 58 years old and married with 5 children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Paul sells building materials such as nails, paint brushes, etc. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia K. has been trading in the local market of Koforidua a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. She is a 60 year woman, married and the mother of ten children. Currently four of her children are in school.  
Afia  is a busy trader who sells rice, smoked fish, plantains, peppers, onions and other foodstuffs in the market. She does not have sufficient working capital. With a loan of $450, she wants to purchase more stock to revive her business. Afia  believes that increased profits will enable her to be able to pay for the educational needs of her children. She would be grateful for the loan assistance.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of palm oil, tin tomatoes, dried and smoked fish, onions, beans, maize, etc.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Las Hormigas.
Graciela es separada, tiene 41 años y 1 hija, Graciela vende productos naturales, tiene una tienda en la ciudad de Lima en un local alquilado, Graciela vive en la ciudad de Lima porque su hija esta estudiando en la universidad. Además Graciela en algunas oportunidades vende loceria de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes.
Graciela necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicina natural y loceria.
Los sueños de Graciela son comprar una casa en la ciudad de Lima y que su hija culmine sus estudios y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of Las Hormigas ("The Ants") Community Bank. Graciela is separated, is 41 years old and has one daughter. Graciela sells natural products. She has a shop in the city of Lima in a rented space. Graciela lives in the city of Lima because her daughter is studying at university. Additionally, Graciela, on some occasions, sells pottery according to orders from customers. Graciela needs a loan of 2,000 soles which will be invested in the purchase of natural medicine and pottery. Graciela's dreams are to purcahse a house in the city of Lima and that her daughter finishes her studies and becomes a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of natural medicine and pottery.

loans.name: Nelda

texts.es: Nelda cuenta con 38 años, vive con el padre de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a hilar la lana de carnero, después teje medias de lana apropiadas para el intenso frió de las alturas, y si le hacen pedidos de chompas demora unos 15 días, pero cobra entre 80 o 90 soles. Pero su especialidad son las medias de lana de cordero, cada par lo vende de de 15 a 20 soles dependiendo el tamaño. Esta actividad le resulta rentable, y más aun cuando su pueblo tiene días festivos o en semana santa. En el lapso de estos cinco años ya ha hecho clientela, pero su meta es llevar sus prendas al mercado de la ciudad todos los domingos para que aumenten sus ventas. Este es su 3er crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy responsable en cada uno de sus pagos. El dinero que está solicitando en esta oportunidad, es para la compra de pellejos de carnero y lanas trasquiladas, para convertirlas en hilos y le sirvan como capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Nelda is 38 years old and lives with the father of her 3 children in their own home. For the past five years she has worked spinning sheep’s wool. After spinning the wool she knits wool socks that are appropriate for the intense cold of the mountains. If people ask for sweaters it takes her 15 days to make them, but she charges between 80 and 90 soles. However, her specialty is making wool socks that she sells for 15-20 soles, depending on the size. This is a profitable activity for her, especially during holidays or Holy Week. In these five years she has built up a client base, but her goal is to take her products to the Sunday market in the city to increase her sales. This is her third loan with MFP and in this time she has proven to be very responsible with her payments. The money she is asking for is to buy sheep skins and shorn wool, to convert them to thread.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheepskins for making wool

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhoeun N., 25, and his wife, Mrs. Lalin Sor, 23, live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and have two young daughters.

Sokhoeun has been a mason for two years; he works in Phnom Penh. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. She used to be a garment factory worker. Sokhoeun is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase one generator for the family's use.

loans.use: To purchase a generator

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 25-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Samer has owned a cleaning station since 2008. He requested a loan of US $1000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and cleaning products for his work. This is the first time that Samer has requested a loan.

Samer is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulty. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Tools and supplies for cleaning business

loans.name: Ana Geissel

texts.es:
En el municipio de Chichigalpa de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Ana L. se dedica a su actividad de venta de tortillas elaboradas por ella misma todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana siendo elaboradas y vendidas por ella misma en su localidad.

La razón por la que Ana ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de maíz, leña y cal para la elaboración de las tortillas. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente porque permite adquirir ingresos para continuar manteniendo su hogar.
texts.en:
In the Chichigalpa of the city Chinandega, Ana L. sells tortillas she makes herself. Every day, starting very early in the morning, she makes the tortillas and then sells them in the area herself. The reason Ana has come to Ceprodel is to ask for a loan with which to buy corn, firewood, and lime to make tortillas. This loan helps her enormously because it allows her to generate the income she needs to continue maintaining her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing corn and firewood

loans.name: Ankabenkélenkan 2 .3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2.3 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Fonfona de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Elles cultivent principalement  du riz et de l’arachide en secondaire.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Ankabenkélenkan 2.3 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre premiers   prêts, elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de riz d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au marché de Fonfona, M’pessoba et Zansoni. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au marché de M’pessoba et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail et en gros, au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Ankabenkélenkan 2.3 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 70 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Ankabenkélenkan 2.3 Group is a group of married women from the village of Fonfona in the main city of Koutiala (in Mali's third administrative region). They live in large, extended traditional families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. They have an average age of 45 and at least six children each. Their main crop is rice, with groundnuts their secondary crop. Keen to make a profit from their agriculture business, the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2.3 Group decided five years ago to join Soro Yiriwaso’s loan program. Having fully repaid their first four loans, they are now on their fifth country loan. The current loan will be used to buy a decent quantity of rice and groundnut seeds, and small equipment and fertilizer for farming at the markets in Fonfona, M’pessoba and Zansoni. After the harvest season, the crops are placed in storage for a certain period of time to increase in value before being sold at retail and wholesale at the market in M’pessoba or surrounding markets for cash to a clientele composed of retailers, in general from the large towns. Once the crops are sold, the members of the Ankabenkélenkan 2.3 Group each expect to make a profit of CFA 70,000, which will be used to repay the loan and for everyday family expenses.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and small farm equipment

loans.name: Rita Mercedes

texts.es: Rita Mercedes R. Hernández tiene la edad de 59 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por la necesidad de proporcionarles a sus hijos el pan de cada día, a pesar de la edad y las enfermedades Rita es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable, por lo que decide salir a las calles a ofrecer productos como ropa interior y perfumes, Rita no posee niveles académicos por lo que se ve obligada a buscar de cualquier forma el trabajo y se gana la vida de una forma humilde pero honrada. Y es por ese motivo que solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de calzado, ropa interior y cosméticos. El sueño de Rita es que sus hijos tengan la posibilidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
Rita Mercedes R. Hernández is a 59-year-old married mother with 3 children. She has been selling general merchandise for a living for 7 years. She started her business out of the need to provide her children with their daily bread. Despite her age and ailments, Rita is a responsible and hardworking woman, which is why she takes to the streets to sell products like undergarments and perfume. She does not have an education, so she has to take any type of employment she can get, earning a humble but respectable living. For this reason, she is seeking a loan that she will use as business capital to purchase footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. Rita dreams of her children having the opportunity to study.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir S. has been dedicated to the business of cattle breeding for the last five years. This business requires a lot of dedication because it demands a lot of effort. It also requires strict control of every one of the animals in addition to feeding and caring for those that are older. It is necessary to emphasize that through this business Tahir is able to maintain his spouse and four children. The loan will allow him to buy more animals, which he will raise and sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Liberian United For Progress Group

texts.en: Samuel is single and currently at the university. He has been selling charcoal, bought wholesale, at retail prices for the past five years. He’s challenged by too many people's involvement in the sale of the business. His dream is to grow to the level of sustainability to enable him to sustain his business.

loans.use: additional bags of charcoal bought wholesale for resale retail

loans.name: Jyldyz's Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Jyldyz, a farmer’s wife who works on the land and raises cattle in order to share her husband’s hard labor. Fourteen years ago, Jyldyz and her husband obtained a piece of land upon which they began growing wheat. Since then, they have bought a car and raised four children, providing all of them with college educations. Three of her three children, two sons and a daughter, have already married and live separately with their own families, so only their youngest son, 23, who is a student, still lives with them. With only the three of them, it is easier to make ends meet, but as harvesting time is approaching, Jyldyz needs a loan to cover expenses on hired labor and fuel. With part of this loan she would also like to purchase wheat seeds in advance for lower prices. Among Jyldyz’s dreams that she is determined to fulfill are purchasing a house and car for her son and increasing the total population of their livestock.

Jyldyz has three partners: Elmira, Suyumkan and Ainagul. Elmira is 44, a widow and mother of three daughters. Having received a piece of land from the village council to farm on, Elmira needs a loan to purchase 1650 pounds of wheat seeds, pay for labor and buy fuel.

Suyumkan, 51, and her husband are farmers who grow wheat and sunflowers. Farming allows them to live independently, and Suyumkan needs a loan to purchase seeds and fuel.

Ainagul, 51, has raised five children. Having obtained land from the village council and investing in it, she has been farming for the last 18 years. Her monthly income is now $130, and she needs a loan to buy threads for stacking hay, fuel, to pay for labor and invest the rest in construction.

loans.use: To buy wheat seeds in advance and cover expenses on hired labor and fuel.

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymao Y., 40, and her husband, Mr. Lim Tang, 41, live along National Road Number five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, and were married in 1985. They have six children: one son who is married and lives in separate house, three daughters who work in a garment factory, and two daughters who stay at home.

Sreymao and her husband have been selling bricks they make in a kiln for five years. She now wants to create a new business selling fruits, so she is a asking for a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for carrying fruits to sell.

loans.use: For a motorbike and a trailer to carry fruits

loans.name: Malanga Group

texts.en:
Malanga is a group of 5 borrowers led by Robert F. K., who is 34 years old, married with 2 children.  His children are aged 2 and 4 years and their educational levels are kindergarten and 1st grade.

Robert is also a university graduate with a bachelor's degree in accounting. He feels that his education shouldn’t be forgotten and believes that with his level of education he can make the business a better one.

Robert lives and works on Johnson Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia, which is a community of poor people that depend on the government to take care of them.

Robert’s business is building materials. He purchases them wholesale and sells retail to the residents of downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He has been running this business for over 6 years.  He started this business with a small amount but is doing fine in business.

Robert attracts his customer because he knows how to talk to them and is sited at a strategic point so that if anyone comes to buy he will be the first vendor to be seen.

Robert needs this loan to purchase more building materials to sell for a profit.  Robert hopes to expand his business to owning a building materials store and become successful.  And he dreams of seeing his children having a good education and being in good health also.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell for a profit.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
58-year-old Lucita Juanillo is requesting for a loan amounting to Php15,000 through ASHI. The said amount will be used to increase the inventory of her variety to be able to get more profits which will enable her to augment her husband’s income being a carpenter and will be able to support the needs of her two children who are unemployed as well as her grandchildren who lives in their house.

Lucita’s variety store has been a great provider to her family for the past five years that she had put this up. However, income it generates as well as its profits are yet enough to bring her family out of poverty at the same time working out for its sustainability. Loans she would be receiving through ASHI would be a great means for her aspiration be achieved and for her family especially grandchildren to experience life away from being poor.

loans.use: Will be used to pay for purchasing piglets for a hog fattening business.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia Fortunata; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; ubicados en el distrito de Andahuaylillas a 5 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años de edad, ella es casada pero su esposo trabaja lejos y es como si estuvieran separados, según nos manifiesta la socia; tiene 4 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el el empleo de obrera, ella trabaja en el teatrin para terceras personas, nuestra socia embaza alcachofas, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde el año 2002. nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para uso personal.

Ella agradece y valora el préstamo del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is Fortunata. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Triunfadoras”, which is located in the district of Andahuaylillas and 5 minutes away from the city of Cusco.

Fortunata is 33 years old and married. Her husband works away from home and she tells us, “It is as if we are separated.” Fortunata has 4 children and divides her time between her household chores and her job as a contract laborer at a packing station where she packages artichokes. She has been doing this type of work since 2002.

Fortunata is requesting a loan for personal use. She appreciates and values the loan that has been provided to her, and agrees to make her payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Ahmad Khan

texts.en:
This is Ahmad Khan. He lives in the city of Jalalabad. He is a young man and he is the one responsible for his family members. He lives in a family of seven, which includes his father and mother. He is the oldest son in his family. 

Ahmad Khan owns a retail shop, where he sells different kinds of things. He is asking for an individual loan of 50,000 AFN for the purpose of purchasing more and better quality materials for his shop. His main purpose is to attract more clients and to purchase the things that are most in demand in his market. He hopes to grow his business and bring about new changes to it by taking the loan. He is confident that he can repay his loan on time. He would like to extend his gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more and better stock

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en: Khachatur B. was born in 1968 in Kapan. He graduated from the Technological Institute in St. Petersburg. He is married and has three children: two school-aged daughters and a 2-year-old son. Now Khachatur is a superintendent of the school in Verin Khotanan village, Kapan area. And his wife works in the same school as a librarian. Khachatur, having been a school superintendent, has engaged in bee-keeping and he owns 25 bee-families. The first part of the day Khachatur spends at school and after dinner he is busy with his bees. Every month he has approximately 50.000 AMD income from bee-keeping. Khachatur is requesting a 400.000 AMD loan to increase the quantity of bee-families. In the photo you can see Khachatur with one of his daughters.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of bee-families

loans.name: Doris Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Doris es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas” desde hace 8 años del distrito y provincia de Puno, y departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 02 hijos. Ella tiene estudios (secundaria completa), se dedica a la venta de artesanía.

Doris nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para poder comprar lana.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar lanas de todo tipo y todos los insumos para hacer las artesanías.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su tienda de artesanías y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros que gana y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Doris, 49, has been a member of the "Las Kantutas" communal bank, which is located in the district and province of Puno, Puno department, for the last 8 years. She is a single mother of two children. She finished secondary schools and sells handicrafts. Doris tells us that with her initial, 300 sol, loan from Manueal Ramos Movement she bought wool. She now requests a 3000 new sol loan which will be used to buy all kinds of wool and raw materials for her crafts. Her dream for the future is to have her own crafts store and that her children become professionals. What she likes most about her communal bank is the savings and the gatherings with the members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: El señor José Ángel Padrón está casado con la señora Virgen del Carmen y son muy trabajadores, él se desempeña como cobrador en una empresa de venta de libros y con gran sacrificio abrieron una tiendita la cual fue apoyada con un crédito de nuestra Institución y con esfuerzo y buen manejo lograron iniciar un nuevo negocio de abarrotes en otra colonia,  así que cuentan ya con dos abarrotes del patrimonio familiar; desean aprovechar las ofertas que se presentan en estas temporadas y están solicitando un préstamo más para la compra de mercancía a mayoreo y obtener buenas ganancia.
texts.en:
Sr. José Ángel Padrón is married to Sra. Virgen del Carmen, and they are very hard-working people. He works as a collector in a book-selling business, and with a great sacrifice he opened a small shop that was supported with a loan from our Institution. With a great effort and good management, they managed to open a new grocery business in another neighborhood, so they now have two family-owned businesses. For such businesses with the bargains that they offer in these times, they are applying for this loan to buy more wholesale merchandise for greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in his two grocery stores

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell bread and fruit

loans.name: Zakrya Raysa Group

texts.en:
This is the Zakrya Raysa group. The group leader is Mena Gull, who is married with five children, three sons and two daughters. His youngest son is a first-year college student and the others are students at school.She and her family live in 11th district of Kabul Afghanitan. Sh takes this loan for her husband who is a mechanic. He has a workshop in the city of Kabul where he repairs cars. He wants to expand his business and to support his family in a better way.By the loan he would like to purcahse parts of the car which are not avialable in his workshop.He would like to expand his business as well. 
Mena Gull is confident that will do the repayments on time and hope that her husband will expand his business soon.

loans.use: purchasing parts of the car

loans.name: Amor Y Paz 5 Group

texts.en:
Juliana is the coordinator of her group Amor y Paz (Love and Peace), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally.

Juliana’s group is located in the rural areas surrounding San Pedro, a town once famous for sugarcane production but which is now largely in decay, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, wooden structure with her longterm partner and their two children.

Juliana is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling basic Dominican staples such as ñame (yam), yuca (cassava), plantains (large bananas) and other vegetables. She will use the loan to purchase these items to sell.

Juliana will use the profits to invest in livestock to add to her business as well as her longterm goal of replacing the wooden walls in her house with concrete block. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a divorced mother with one daughter. She sells clothing from her home in the town of Kherson and in one of the local marketplaces. Olga launched this business ten years ago when she faced some personal and financial struggles. She managed to grow and develop her venture and presently, she has 25,000 Grivnyas worth of merchandise. Her monthly income amounts to 10,000 Grivnyas.

Olga believes a loan of 9,800 Grivnyas will help her diversify assorted merchandise and attract new potential customers as a result. She is very organized and responsible. She can always give a sober evaluation of a situation and make a wise decision having calculated costs and profit. We believe Olga will efficiently use the current loan, using it to benefit further expansion of her successful trade.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Paulina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qory Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 45 años, es casada y vive en la ciudad de Pucyura de la provincia de Anta. Paulina y su esposo Ángel tienen 5 hijas de los cuales la mayor Karen de 26 años es independiente y es profesora, los que depende todavía de los ellos son: Karla que tiene 22 años, Katia que tiene 18 años, Luz Ángela que  tiene 10 años y Paula que tiene 07 años, ellas viven al lado de sus padres. Los socios desean sacar profesionales a sus hijas menores.  Paulina es una mujer trabajadora, honesta, responsable que desde muy niña sus padres le enseñaron el valor de trabajo. La socia tiene un negocio familiar con sus hermanos es un grifo donde vende combustible. La socia también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. El sueño de la socia es abrir en su domicilió un restaurante donde pueda vender cuy al horno. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en el negocio de fabricación de bloquetas de cemento de su hija Karla y desea comprar más cemento. 
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(La ciudad de Pucyura es distrito de la ciudad de Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco).
texts.en:
Paulina, 45, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Qory Orcco" communal bank. She is married and lives in the city of Pucyura, Anta province. She and her husband, Ángel, have five daughters. Their eldest, Karen, 26, is a teacher and lives independently. Those still dependent on their parents are: Karla, 22, Katia, 18, Luz Ángela, 10 and Paula, 7. The members would like to see their younger daughters become professionals, too. Paulina is a hard-working, honest, responsible woman who, from a very early age, learned to value work from her parents. She and her siblings have a family gas station. She also raises small farm animals like guinea pigs. Her dream is to open a restaurant in her home serving roasted guinea pig. She needs funds to invest in her daughter Karla's brick-making business; she needs to buy cement. Paulina is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. (The city of Pucyura is a district of the city of Anta, Cusco department. Pucyura is 40 minutes away from Cusco).

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement.

loans.name: So

texts.en: So S., age 45, is married and resides with his wife in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. He has no children. He is employed as a  police officer in his province, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. His wife is employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of $2.60 per day. Their standard of living has improved since S. and his wife have had these jobs. S. is requesting a loan of $700 to repair the house. This is his third loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús R. G. es una persona muy  trabajadora que con esfuerzo fue haciendo un patrimonio para su familia, la vivienda que el tiene necesita algunos arreglos por fuera; como  enjarre en la paredes y pintura para que se vea presentable. Pues como se observa en la imagen la fachada de la casa ya se ve muy deteriorada a cauda de la lluvia hay algunas partes blancas y comenta que se ve mal y es por ello que quiere el préstamo para cambiar el aspecto de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jesús R. G. is a very hard-working person. With effort he has been making a legacy for his family. The house that he has needs some repairs on the outside. For example, it needs plaster on the walls and paint in order to look presentable. As can be seen in the photo, the house’s appearance is much deteriorated. Because of the rain, some parts are white. He says that it looks very bad. That is why he wants the loan to change the appearance of the house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plaster and paint his house

loans.name: Alda Lucia

texts.es:
Alda Lucia M. M., tiene la edad de 52 años, es acompañada por su pareja de vida, que habitan en el barrio Laureles Sur, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, que actualmente radican en Guatemala, ella se dedica a la costura y tiene más de 15 años en este negocio  y fue gracias a su mama que le enseño los oficios de la costura, dándole una fuente de trabajo e ingresos para poder brindarle el sustento diario a sus hijos.

Ella consiguió su primera máquina de coser, gracias a un crédito, ahora sus hijos le apoyan  económicamente a sus padres, a futuro desea comprarse una máquina de coser industrial, esta compra le traerá mayores ofertas de trabajo, que le den un mejor sustento, por ahora lo que más la tiene con inquietud  es el cambio inmediato, que deben de realizar al techo de su hogar  y es para este propósito que solicitan el préstamo para el repello y cambio de las laminas de zinc del techo de su vivienda.  Un mejor habitad les dará la tranquilidad de descansar en un espacio seguro y digno que les mejore los niveles de vida del matrimonio.
texts.en:
Alda Lucia M. M., 52, is accompanied by her partner in life, with whom she lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. They have 3 grown children who currently live in Guatemala. She works as a dressmaker, and she has more than 15 years of experience in this business. Her mother taught her the skills of dressmaking, giving her a source of work and income so that she could provide support to her children. Alda got her first sewing machine thanks to a loan. Now her children support their parents financially. In the future, she wants to buy herself an industrial sewing machine. This would bring her better work opportunities and provide a better income. But for now her greatest need is to replace the roof of her house, and to do this she is requesting a loan for the plaster and sheets of corrugated metal needed to complete that project. This will provide a better home environment that will give her the tranquility of being able to rest in a secure and decent space, and will improve the couple's standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials to replace the roof of her home

loans.name: Las Acllas Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Acllas inicia su cuarto ciclo con 16 socias, que son del Distrito de Vischongo, Provincia de VilcasH., que se encuentra a 3 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como es la venta de abarrotes en general, panes, quesos, animales menores, carne, golosinas, comida y servicios de carpintería.
Como es el caso de la Señora Aydee que es secretaria del Banco Comunal, Aydee es conviviente y no tiene hijos, socia hace 1 año, Aydee tiene una panadería, actividad que inicio vendiendo panes y pasteles de manera ambulatoria en una carretilla, actualmente tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde comercializa sus panes y además vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de harina por sacos. Los sueños de Aydee es tener un local propio para su panadería, tener 2 hijos educarlos y darles todo lo mejor.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total de 11,500 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The community bank Las Acllas is starting its fourth loan cycle with 16 members who are from the Vischongo district of the province of VilcasH., which is located 3 hours from the city of Ayacucho. The members run different businesses such as selling general groceries, bread, cheese, young animals, meet, candy, food, and carpentry services. This is the case for Aydee, who is the secretary of the community bank. Aydee lives with her partner and has no children. She has been a member of the bank for 1 year. Aydee has a bakery, and she started this business buy selling break and cakes from a small cart. She currently rents a small store where she sells her bread and also general groceries, which she does with the help of her husband. Her loan will be used to buy sacs of flour. Aydee dreams of owning her own bakery premises and of having two good children to whom she can offer the best in life. The members need different loan amounts like 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles, making a total of 11,500 soles for the whole community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of flour

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa, de 57 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida siempre ha trabajo muy duro para sobresalir, vive en su casa propia con sus dos menores hijas y lo que más desea es brindarles un mejor futuro. Los sembríos de Elsa son los mejores cuidados del poblado de Caritá, ya que ella los cuida y trabaja con mucha paciencia y cariño, es por ello que obtiene una buena producción, del cual son llevados a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios ofrece, resultándole rentable el negocio.  Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras, sin embargo considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus chacras, puesto que debe utilizar productos químicos que afectan su salud. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y está dispuesta a serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal es una muy alegre y responsable. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de alverja para sembrar, asimismo comprar abono e insecticidas para mejorar la productividad de su chacra.
texts.en:
Elsa, age 57, is a woman who has worked very hard throughout her life to get ahead. She lives in her own house with her two younger daughters, and her greatest desire is to provide them with a better future. Elsa's fields are the best-kept of the village of Caritá, since she takes good care of them and works with great patience and dedication. Because of this, she obtains good harvests, which are taken to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma for sale, since better prices are offered there, making the business profitable. She has worked in this area for 30 years, and what she likes best about her work is planting her crops; what she considers most difficult is fumigating her fields, since she has to use chemical products which affect her health. Over time, she hopes to buy more land in order to increase her production. This is her sixth loan with MFP; she has always been very punctual in making her payments, and she plans to continue in this manner. In her communal bank, she is known as a very cheerful and responsible person. With the two thousand Peruvian soles she is requesting, she will buy pea seeds to plant, as well as fertilizer and insecticides to improve the productivity of her farm.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pea seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: Segundina tiene 59 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene 32 años de experiencia en la ganadería y en la agricultura, junto con su esposo sacaron adelante a su hijo que ahora en mayores de edad. Ahora sigue dedicándose a estas tareas  para apoyar al menor que aún está estudiando. Es así que siembra papa, maíz, trigo y habas, adicionado a esto cría animales vacuno, ovino y aves, intensificándose más en está última actividad, principalmente pollos que tiene. De esta tiene muchas posibilidades de salir, y más ahora que su esposo es su principal ayuda, por ello desea dedicarse a esta labor hasta donde tenga fuerzas. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, es muy responsable con sus pagos y sabe que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima siembra, así como quiere comprar cuyes reproductores de raza para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Segundina, 59, lives with her husband and two children in her own home. She has 32 years experience in farming and cattle-raising. She and her husband raised their son who is now an adult.
