She continues to dedicate herself to these tasks in order to support her youngest child who is still in school. She farms potato, corn, wheat and broad beans. In addition, she raises cattle, sheep and barnyard fowl, especially chickens. All these activities provide her with several avenues to succeed especially now that her husband is her main help; she hopes to be able to dedicate herself to these activities as long as she has the strength to do so. This is her 6th loan with MFP. She is very responsible with her payments and knows that this loan will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the requested funds to buy sacks of manure for her next crop as well as to buy breeding, pedigree guinea-pigs to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy breeding guinea-pigs and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Ernesto Everaldo

texts.es:
Ernesto de 56 años, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son  comerciantes informales), el tiene una vulcanizadora “lugar donde reparan llantas de carros. Para comenzar con esta actividad el observo que por su casa pasaban muchos buses para pedirles reparación. 

Poco a poco el comenzó a repararles las llantas, hasta que este fue su trabajo principal. Ahora el trabaja desde las 08:30am hasta las 16:00pm todos los días.  Por la gran demanda de reparación, el tuvo que contratar a una persona para que le ayude. Pero para tener otro ingreso adicional el quiere comprar con el préstamo un asadero de pollos para tener otro negocio y asegurar su vejez.  

En el futuro quiere permanecer con su vulcanizadora y tener su propio asadero de pollos para asegurar su vejez con esos ingresos de dinero.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 56 years old and lives in Suburbio in Guayaquil (an urban area where most of the residents engage in informal businesses). He manages a vulcanization shop where he repairs automobile tires. When he started this business, Ernesto noticed that several buses pass by his house that are in need of repairs.

He gradually began fixing tires until it became his primary job. Now he works from 8:30am until 4pm every day. Since there is great demand for repair services, he had to hire an employee to work as his assistant. In order to generate additional income, Ernesto is requesting a loan to buy a chicken roaster so that he can start another business and secure his retirement.

In the future, he wants to solidify his vulcanization shop and have his own chicken rotisserie so that he can have a secure retirement using the income from both businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a chicken roaster so that he can start a new food business

loans.name: Shabirkul

texts.en:
Shabirkul D. lives in Chimkent village in the north of Kyrgyzstan. She is 56 years old, married and has 7 children. One of them is of school age and the others are grown up. After graduating from Trade College in the capital city, Shabirkul worked in the trade sector for many years. Her colleagues characterized her as a very diligent and responsible person.   

After the breakdown of the Soviet Union, Shabirkul and her family started their own business of cultivating kidney beans, wheat and potatoes. Using the small amount of 3,000 Kyrgyz soms to purchase and plant seeds, Shabirkul and her family worked hard to get a good harvest. 

Being a persistent person, Shabirkul organized a farmers’ group named “Fruitful Land” and applied for a group loan of 20,000 Kyrgyz soms. She bought a milk cow and fodder for her cattle. After that, Shabirkul applied for an individual loan of another 20,000 Kyrgyz Soms, which she used to cultivate beans and potatoes. Shabirkul used her loans as intended and repaid them without any delays. 

All these activities allowed Shabirkul to give a good dowry to her daughter, hold her son’s wedding and renovate her house. In 2009, life put Shabirkul through a severe test: her husband had a stroke and died. However, Shabirkul braced herself to make her children’s life stable.  

Shabirkul is applying for a loan of 25,000 Kyrgyz soms to purchase fertilizer to cultivate her plot of land with wheat, kidney beans and potatoes. With the revenues from the loan, she plans to broaden her business by purchasing cattle and building a barn.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Kiva borrowers benefit from a 5% discount on the interest rate if they pay back without delay.

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Agnetta Achieng

texts.en:
Agnetta has been selling fish in Naivasha town for the last twenty-one years.  She is 53 years old, married to Joseph O., and they have four children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her 1st loan.  She plans to use the cash as working capital, which she will use to pay for transporting her fish from the lake to the main market.

In the future, she hopes to venture into other markets and towns to sell her fish.

loans.use: To transport fish from the lake to the market.

loans.name: Faiupu

texts.en:
Faiupu P. is 49 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Faiupu has many years of experience in this business.  Faiupu needs a loan of WST 1200 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Faiupu joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faiupu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Martaba

texts.en:
E. Martaba is 34 years old. She is married and has two children. Martaba has been running a grocery store for the past 2 years. She sells sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks, perfumes and many others items in her grocery. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Martaba is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her vending facility to buy groceries again. Martaba is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of $3000 USD to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Martaba reach all of her aspirations.       


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing inventory to sell to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
el señor Pablo E. O. tiene 65 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Caimito, tiene 21 años de vivir en ese lugar en donde se a desarrollado junto con su esposa la señora Agueda Nuñes, tuvieron cinco hijos ya todos estan grandes y viven con sus familias.
Pablo se dedica a la venta de hamacas y lazos este producto (lasos) lo compra en el norte del pais y lo vende en las pulperias y clientes que el tiene en diferentes lugares.
el credito lo utilizara para compra de lasos y hamacas ya que tiene varios pedidos y necesita capital de trabajo para la compra de este producto.
su deseo es pasar una vida tranquila en estos años que le quedan.
texts.en:
Pablo E. O. is 65 years old and lives in the Caimito hamlet. He has been here for 21 years, where he and his Agueda Nuñes, have settled. They’ve had five children, all adults now. Pablo sells hammocks and whips. He buys the whips in the northern part of the country and sells them to different general stores and other customers he has. He will use the money from this loan to buy whips and hammocks because he has orders to fill and needs working capital. His desire is to have a quiet life in his remaining years.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Milagro De La Concepcion

texts.es: Milagro De La Concepción ha trabajado mucho para incrementar sus ventas y poder educar a su hijo. Su negocio es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que hace más de 5 años que se dedica a su negocio. Por lo que siempre está pensando en la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, ya que es una mujer muy carismática.  Su sueño ahora es tener varios puntos de venta y un gran almacén, en la actualidad quiere prepararse para la temporada de fin de año. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, cosméticos, calzado entre otras cosas. Porque su gran desafío es la gran competencia del sector y por eso ella venderá lo que su clientela necesite.
texts.en:
Milagro De La Concepción has worked hard to increase sales and educate her son.  Her business consists in general merchandise sales.  She has been in business for over 5 years.  She is always thinking of ways to improve her income because she’s a very charismatic woman. Her dream now is to have several sales points and a large store.  She wants to prepare for the end of year season now.

The financing she is requesting is to buy pants, shirts, cosmetics and footwear, among other things because her great challenge is the competition she faces in this area and that’s why she wants to have available for sale what her customers need.

loans.use: To buy clothing and other merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 56-year-old married man who has three children, one of whom attends school. 

He is the main income provider for his family. He has 25 years of experience working as a farmer, and he has been running his own farm since 1990. He cultivates all types of vegetables and fruit on his land, according to the season. He also uses plastic tents to grow his products. These tents also allow him to better monitor product quality, as well as grow his products for more months during the year. He works independently in his business. He distributes the harvest to a local agriculture market. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work. He estimates that his profit has the potential to increase by 18% after taking the loan.

loans.use: To purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah O. is married to Henry and they have three children; Grace 22 years, Joel 18 years, and Michele 12 years old. They live in the Luanda area in Vihiga.

Leah has a secondhand stall that she has been running for the past 11 years. She is applying for her second loan from Kadet Ltd after completing the first loan successfully. She is in dire need of more clothes to add to her stock, thus the need to apply for this loan. 

Her desire is to build a business premises that she can use and also see to it that her children are well educated.

loans.use: Buy more clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily M. is 36 years old and has a child aged 16 years who is currently attending school. She lives in Eldoret town, located in western Kenya.

She has been in the farming business for 11 years and also sells poultry and milk. Emily is requesting a loan of 36,400 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase a dairy cow.

In five years, she hopes to have expanded her business by purchasing four more dairy cows. The expected profits will be used to help repay the loan and pay her child's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Lonh

texts.en:
Lonh R. is a 35 year old married mother who currently lives in the province of Battambang. She is a local chef, and is always hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties and other ceremonies. Her husband works as a soldier as well as a motor taxi driver in his community. The family includes three devoted children, all of them single.

Lonh R. said that she wishes to build a new house for her family, but she lacks the funds. To solve this problem, Lonh R. would like a loan of $1100 in order to purchase some pieces of wood to build her new house. Lonh R. was not available the day of the photo, so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To purchase some pieces of wood for building her new house.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph D. is a farmer from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 38 years old and single. He owns and cultivates his own land where he plants and harvests rice crops. He sells his harvest in his community. His income from the farm enables him to save and help his family financially. Joseph works hard to maintain his rice farm and keep it productive.

Joseph joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joseph has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Joseph is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy hand bags and lappas

loans.name: Jaime Luis

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 37 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres en una de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona se clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por du producción de frutas como mango y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino. El cría ovejas en su domicilio, las alimenta en base a pastos naturales y cuando estas han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de sustento, y le permite solventar sus gastos personales, así como ayudar a sus padres. Por ello siempre trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible. 

Actualmente desea adquirir alimento balanceado para lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de un mejor modo y así poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jaime is 37 years old, he is single and he lives with one of his parents in a community belonging to the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is a semi-tropical region primarily known for the production of fruits such as mangoes and lemons. It belongs to the Piura region, which is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He raises and sells sheep. He raises livestock from his property, feeding them natural grasses. When they have reached a certain level in their development he sells them to the merchants who visit the region where he lives. This business is his primary source of income which is able to provide for his needs, and those of his parents. He always tries to maintain his business in the best way possible. 

He wants to acquire balanced feed to improve the development of his livestock, translating to improved sales and earnings. In order to meet his objective he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Nicaise

texts.fr:
Homme de 47ans, marié, père  de 2enfants qui a appris la maçonnerie et s’est spécialisé dans fabrication des buses, des poteaux, des balustres, pavés, des latrines  pour w.c. et  des briques.

Après ses études primaire, n’ayant pas reçus de soutient scolaire, il devient apprenti maçon auprès de son oncle.

Il a fait preuve de bon comportement durant les remboursements, vice-président du groupe, il a aussi dirigé ses membres sans difficultés.
Le premier lui avait permis d’acheter : du sable, du ciment, du gravier, des fers à béton, du ciment blanc. Avec ses vente journalières  de 20.000f, il veut passer au deuxième prêt et acheter plus de matériel comme 2 tonne de ciment; demi tonne du ciment blanc, fers de 10, 8 8m3 de de sable pour améliorer la qualité de son travail.     il compte fabriquer des buses, des pavés, des latrines turcs en ajoutant  des colories et décorations.

Très entreprenant, il compte former plus des jeunes pour élargir son activité afin de générer plus de revenus, et veut que cela contribue aussi a l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Nicaise is 47 years old, married and the father of 2 children. He learned masonry and became specialized in making pipes, posts, balusters, paving stones, toilets and bricks. 

After elementary school, and as he had no further means of support for education, he became an apprentice mason to his uncle. He repaid a previous loan correctly and, as vice-president, also managed the members of the group with no problems. With his first loan he was able to buy: sand, cement, gravel, iron bars for cement, and white cement. With daily sales of 20,000 F, he wants to obtain a second loan and buy more material such as 2 tons of cement,  half a ton of white cement, iron (10), and 8 m3 of sand to improve the quality of his work. He plans to make pipes, paving stones and Turkish-style toilets, adding decorations and colors. 

With his entrepreneurial spirit, he plans to train more young people in order to expand his business and increase revenue. He also wants to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a ton of cement, 8 m3 of sand, iron for cement (8) and white cement

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok L., born in 1962, is a villager who lives in Preaek Hour Lech village in Kandal province. She earns a small income to support her famiL. by working as a vegetable seller in the local market.

She is a widow with three children: one is a security guard, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the youngest is a student. 

The two eldest face difficulties in getting to their workplaces due to the fact that they work far from the famiL. home. For this reason, Mrs. Sok L. would like to ask for a loan in order to add to her savings in order to eventualL. purchase a motorcycle to provide her children with reliable transportation.

loans.use: To add to her savings in order to eventually purchase a motorcycle to provide her children with reliable transportation to work

loans.name: Calixto

texts.es:
El señor Calixto J. T. de 79 años de edad es un señor viudo desde hace 9 años, tiene 7 hijos los cuales todos ya estan casados; el pertenece a la poblacion del paso de la reyna en el estado de Oaxaca.
Claixto se dedica al campo, siembra maiz, frijol, calabaza, ajonjoli, chile. Ademas se dedica a la compra de cerdos para la venta. El solicito el prestamo para poder comprar mas cerditos y poderlos criar para despues venderlos. Calixto comenta que le ah ido muy bien en sus cosechas sobre todo cuando la epoca de lluvia es muy buena  porque asi toda su cosecha dda buenos frutos, así tiene para comer y vender.
A Calixto le gusta mucho el campo pero casi no le deja mucha ganacia es por eso que el decidio invertir en la compra de cerdos. Para que asi pueda mantenerse ya que el vive solo. Sus hijos de vez en cuando le mandan un poco de dinero es por ello que el tiene que trabajar para poder sobrevivir.
Calixto quisiera tener un gran establo para poder criar mas cerditos y así poder tener mas ganancias y poder sobrevivir economicamente.
texts.en: Calixto J. T., 79, has been widowed for 9 years, and has 7 children who are all married. He lives in the village of Paso de la Reyna in Oaxaca. Calixto works the land, growing corn, beans, pumpkins, sesame seeds, and chiles. He also buys pigs to resell them. He requests the loan in order to purchase more piglets to raise and then sell. Calixto says that he has had very good harvests, especially when the rainy season is very good, because then all his crops have a good yield for him to eat and to sell. Calixto likes farming very much but he doesn't make much profit, which is why he decided to invest in buying pigs. He can support himself this way since he lives alone. His children occasionally send him a little money but he still needs to work in order to survive. Calixto would like to have a big stable so he could raise more piglets and make more money and be able to make ends meet.

loans.use: Purchase pigs to sell

loans.name: Maura Leticia

texts.es:
La señorita Maura Leticia es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, compañía Espartillar, tiene 19 años y vive con sus padres, es estudiante.
Manifiesta que desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar como tejedora, ya que es un trabajo que aprendió de su madre y con su esfuerzo y dedicación logra obtener su propio ingreso que le ayuda para solventar sus gastos.
Los trabajos de artesanía que realiza distribuye en las casas comerciales y a los macateros (vendedores ambulantes) para su venta.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad brindada y promete cumplir con puntualidad con el pago de sus cuotas y la de sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Srta. Maura Leticia is from the neighborhood of Espartillar in the city of Carapeguá. She is a 19 year old student who lives with her parents.

Maura says that as a young girl she began working as a weaver. She learned this skill from her mother and, with effort and dedication, was able to generate her own income to help cover her expenses. Her creations are distributed to trading houses and traveling vendors for resale.

Maura appreciates Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity given to her, so she promises to complete her payments on time and accomplish her objectives.

loans.use: To purchase yarn and fabric.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
O. Mavjuda is a 50 year old woman. She is married and a loving mother of 3 children. Mavjuda is a market vendor. For the last 15 years she has sold cottonseed oil at the local market.  In the traditional Tajik cuisine, the majority of the meals are fried or cooked using cottonseed oil, especially our national dish “Pilaw” which needs lots of cottonseed oil in order to be delicious.

So, the goods that Mavjuda sells are popular and in demand among the population. Today, Mavjuda is planning to increase her business. For this reason she is requesting a loan of $1,100 USD. Mavjuda thanks you for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cottonseed oil in order to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Ainabubu Abdykerimova's Group

texts.en:
Ainabubu A., 63, is the leader of this group. Ainabubu is a typical senior citizen in the town of Bokonbaevo. She and her husband have lived a long life of hard labor in farming during a changing national political and economic situation, which led to changes in agriculture too. At this moment both of them are pensioners, but still enjoy farming and rely on it financially. Ainabubu is getting ready for spring field work and has good expectations for the upcoming season. Ainabubu’s son also helps in taking care of the land and gives advice about effective land cultivation and watering. The business is 15 years old and generates 4,000 KGS monthly. Ainabubu hopes to use the loan provided by Kiva lenders in order to purchase seeds for spring field work.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used shoes from China for resale.

loans.name: Peter Gikonyo

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the past four years.  He is 28 years old, married to Dorcas Wanjiku and they have one child.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of his friends and this will be his third loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 3 years, Habiba has operated a food stall business, selling to her neighbors and schoolchildren. In addition, she sells stationery as a second source of income. Habiba faces the major challenge of seasonality because of high and low seasons in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Habiba plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase books, pens, pencils and rulers for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase books, pens, pencils and rulers for sale.

loans.name: Nelsie Grace

texts.en:
Nelsie Grace is 47 years old.  She is married and has 5 children, 1 of whom is in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nelsie Grace has a bakery business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 8 years.  She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.   In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 45 years old.  He is married with 4 adult aged children.  Eduardo's wife works as a full time house wife.  He wanted a progressive living for his family and so he is working hard for it through farming.

Eduardo is a farmer working in the Philippines.  Eduardo grows rice and has been doing it for 10 years.  Eduardo is asking a loan to buy seed and fertilizer to maintain his farm.  In the future, he hopes that his farming business will expand so that he can sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to maintain his farm.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been running a spare parts shop for the last six years in C.B.D Nairobi capital city.  He earns an income of KES. 60,000 per month.  He is married to Grace and they have two school aged children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a Kadet staff and he is applying for his second loan after paying back his previous loan in good time.  John plans to use the entire loan amount to buy car spare parts and motorbike spare parts.

The anticipated profits will be used to add more stock and in the future he plans to grow his business and own a big spare parts shop.

loans.use: To buy car spare parts worth KES 40,000 and motor bike spare parts worth KES 40,000

loans.name: Ork

texts.en: Mrs. Ork is a rice farmer who lives in the Prey Chor district. To make a living, she and her husband have experience in the farming business. She learned how to plant crops from her parents when they were young. On average, Mrs. Ork can make around $1 per day. Mrs. Ork will be using the loan that she is requesting to buy some farming material and seeds for planting during the heavy rain because it is good for planting her crops. The humble couple has three single children. Mrs. Ork, her husband and her two kids appear in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy some farming material and seeds for planting

loans.name: Egnonam

texts.fr:
Egnonam est une femme âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée à un peintre.
Egnonam travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006.elle vend de la farine de manioc, du maîs,de l’oignon,de la tomate, de l’huile d’arachide et plein d’autres choses. Elle achète à Lomé puis revend sous un apatam à Avépozo.
Egnonam a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin de renforcer son commerce.
texts.en: Egnonam is 48 years old and married to a painter. She has been a merchant since 2006, selling cassava flour, corn, onions, tomatoes, groundnut oil and many other items. She gets her supplies in Lomé and resells under an awning in Avépozo. Egnonam came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and cassava flour.

loans.name: Caritas Alegres (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Caritas Alegres está conformado por 11 socias, quienes son amigas y conocidas hace muchos, laboran en diferentes actividades  en un mercado de la ciudad,  estas actividades les han permitido mejorar  económicamente, viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad cuenta con una hermosa estructura colonial, una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es amable y cordial quienes mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Señora María Adelina, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia Turi, tiene 59 años, está separada y ha concebido 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados e  independientes. La casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, actividad que la desempeña hace 27 años, tiene un puesto propio y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. En su casa se dedica a la cría de gallinas y cuyes, también se dedica a la agricultura y las   verduras que siembra las vende en su puesto del mercado.
 
En el banco comunal esta reingresando y su nuevo crédito lo va a  invertir en la compra de frutas y verduras para tener una mejor variedad para su exigente clientela.
 
Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Caritas Alegres” (Cheerful Little Faces) communal bank has 11 members who are friends and have known each other for many years.  They work in different activities in one of the city’s markets.  These activities have made it possible for them to improve economically.  They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a beautiful colonial structure, a varied cuisine; its residents are kind and cordial and maintain their culture and traditions.

One of the group members is María Adelina.  She lives in Turi Parish and is 59 years old.  She’s separated and has five children who are all adults now, married and independent.  She owns the house she lives in.

She sells fruit and vegetables, an activity she’s been carrying out for 27 years.  She has a stand of her own and she works from Sunday to Sunday with no set work schedule.  At home, she raises chickens and guinea pigs and also farms.  She sells the vegetables she grows in her stand in the market.

She is rejoining the communal bank and will use her new loan to buy fruit and vegetables to have a better variety available for her demanding clientele.  Her goal is to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Avec un appui de 30000F de son mari,elle a commencé un commerce de produits vestimentaires et de chaussures.Elle place ainsi ses produits à crédit et se fait payer au bout d'un mois.Elle a aussi reçu une formation en coiffure et pratique cette activité à domicile.Elle dispose par ailleurs de deux jardins ou elle cultive des légumes destinés à la vente.Toutes ces activités lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins, ceux de ses enfants et de soutenir son mari dans les dépenses alimentaires.Elle sollicite un crédit de 100000F pour acheter à l'occasion des fetes, 50 pièces d'habits pour enfants et 50 pièces d'habits pour adultes. Son ambition est d'ouvrir un salon de coiffure.
texts.en: The borrower is a married women who is mother of 2 children. With 30000F support from her husband, she began a business selling clothing and shoes. She places her products on credit with a monthly payback period. She is also a trained hairdresser and works from home. She has two gardens where she grows vegetables to sell. All these activities enable her to provide for her needs and those of her children, and to support her husband with the food expenses. She is requesting a loan of 100000F to buy 50 children's clothing garments and 50 adult's clothing garments. Her ambition is to open a hairdressing salon.

loans.use: to buy 100 clothing garments

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en:
Mykola is married with grown-up children. He owns a small business selling clothing and shoes, as well as seeds and fertilizers, in seven small towns in Nova Kahovka area. 

Mykola started this business five years ago. Today he's got many repeat clients. Mykola goes to each place once a week to bring his inventory. He also takes individual orders from people and brings them what they ask for.

Mykola is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnas to increase assorted inventory. He is hoping to make additional profit and use it to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase assorted inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 29 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de nueva fortaleza, Pichari. Ella proviene de una familia que por tradición se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ahí aprendió a arar la tierra y sembrar cacao, desde entonces continua con éste trabajo introduciendo nuevas técnicas de cultivo, con la ayuda de su padre y hermanos. Pero hay veces en que tiene que contratar jornaleros, para que se encarguen de la cosecha, ya que es un trabajo que requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico. Ella se mantiene segura con su trabajo, pues el grano de cacao tiene mucha demanda a nivel nacional e internacional, y las ganancias que percibe de su comercialización son considerables. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera la colaboración de cada uno de ustedes, para desarrollar su trabajo. Con los 1,000 soles que solicita, comprará una terreno para ampliar la siembra de cacao.
texts.en: Mary is 29 years old.  She is a single mother of 4 children.  They live together in their own home in the Nueva Fortaleza community in Pichari.  Mary comes from a family whose members have traditionally made their livings in agriculture.  From them she learned to plow the land and to plant cocoa.  She has continued in this line of work and, with the help of her father and her siblings, introduced new farming techniques.  But sometimes she needs to contract day laborers to take care of the harvest, since that's a job that requires a lot of physical strength.  Mary feels confident in her work.  The cocoa grain is in great demand both nationally and internationally, and she earns a considerable amount from its sale.  This will be her first credit with MFP.  As such, she hopes for a contribution from each one of you to develop her work.  With the 1,000 PEN ($375 USD), she will purchase a plot of land to expand her cocoa plantings.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos de 31 años de edad es casado, tiene una hija, labora para como Perito Agricola de hace 6 años. Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de continuar mejorando su casa construyendo un pequeño anexo para la cocina pues la casa es pequeña y necesita mas espacio para brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, age 31, is married and has one daughter.  He has worked as an agricultural expert for six years.

He is requesting his third loan in order to continue improving his house by building a small addition to the kitchen.  The house is very small and needs more space to make the family more comfortable.

loans.use: to build an addition to the kitchen.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with five school-going children. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Saumu has operated a fried fish selling business for the past ten years. Her potential clients are local people at the market. She faces a major challenge with competition from other operators. She dreams of establishing another different type of business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase more fish, a frying pan and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it offers quality and a variety of services.

loans.use: To purchase more fish, a frying pan and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old and married. She has seven children aged 28, 25, 23, 20,18,16 and 12 years. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 10 years. She gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 from the business.

This is her third loan with KADET LTD. She repaid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan amount to plant more cabbages on her farm.

She will use the anticipated profit to purchase a piece of land for her farming. Her dream is to increase her income and raise her family in a comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to plant more cabbages

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg is 49 years old and lives with her husband and four kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her husband is a cab driver, her elder two kids are college students and her younger two are in school. She started her fruit retailing business in 2007 by renting a counter in the market. Now that she has run a business quite a while, she wants to expand her business by selling vegetables. She is a strong and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my kids are grown, they need my support more than anything now. In order to support them I will do everything I can." She is requesting 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy apples at a wholesale price.

loans.use: To buy apples at a wholesale price.

loans.name: Oposilan

texts.en:
Oposilan is 40 years old, and a married woman with one child who is in school. She has had a business of a food stall in Kator, South Sudan for one year.

Oposilan requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase tomatoes and green vegetables. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Magbéfon

texts.fr:
Magbéfon est une femme âgé(e) de 26 ans. Elle est mariée à un  photographe. Elle est mère de 02 enfants. 
Magbéfon travaille comme revendeuse d’alimentation générales et produits congelés depuis 2000. Elle vend à domicile et achète ses produits à Lomé. 
Magbéfon a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits congelés et des produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Magbéfon is 26 years old. She is married to a photographer, and is the mother of two children.

Magbéfon has been working as a retail merchant of grocery products and frozen foods. She sells from her home and gets her supplies in Lomé.

Magbéfon requested her second WAGES credit loan to buy frozen food and grocery products.

loans.use: Buy grocery products and frozen foods

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Christine est mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente de maïs, haricot , gari et huiles dans une baraque . Elle détient également en portefeuile un centre d'élevage de volaille qui fait la provenderie. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés de la ville.  Dans le but de renforcer ses activités, dame Christine cliente sollicite le concours de Finadev pour l'obtention d'un prêt afin de pouvoir faire face aux charges personnelles et familiales.
texts.en: Christine is married and the mother of six children.  She sells maize, beans, gari (flour made from cassava) and oil from a food booth.  Her portfolio also includes a poultry farm that produces livestock feed.  She buys her products at various markets in town.  In order to bolster her business activity, Christine is requesting a loan from Finadev.  This loan will allow her to cover personal and family expenses.

loans.use: To buy five bags of maize, two bags of flour, one bag of beans and other food products.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionicia es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik, tiene 42 años, se dedica a la venta de desayuno en dos puntos de ventas junto con su esposo, tiene 3 hijos, es casada,
Dionicia siempre valoró todo lo que hicieron por ella, las capacitaciones, la ayuda con los préstamos, le ayudan a poder ser mejor persona y mejor comerciante, antes solo tenia un puesto de venta ahora con el esfuerzo que puso tiene otro punto de venta, se siente tranquila por las cosas que esta logrando y todo es gracias al apoyo que le brinda Finca, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de los insumos  para los desayunos.
texts.en: Dionicia is 42 years old, married and has 2 children.  For a living, she sells breakfast with her husband at two different places.  Dionicia is a member of the communal bank Llapanchik. She always values everything they do for her such as the training workshops, the financial help, and they help her to be a better person and merchant.  Before she only had one sales stand, but now, with a lot of hard work, she has set up another sales stand. The things she is achieving give her peace of mind and all of this is thanks to Finca's support.  With her loan she will purchase supplies for her breakfasts.

loans.use: purchase supplies for her breakfasts.

loans.name: Rakia

texts.en:
Rakia is a single parent and has three children. Rakia makes and sells gari (a popular West African food made from cassava tubers), which she has done since age 20. 

Rakia uses her income in the general upkeep of her children. Rakia will use the loan to purchase cassava tubers to product her gari for sale. With the new profit she hopes to earn, Rakia plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava tubers to produce gari for sale.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 31 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Miguel pudo estudiar la carrera de música, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Miguel trabaja brindando servicios de transporte como chofer de mototaxi, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él sale a recorrer las diversas calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, Miguel puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes. 
Miguel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la refacción de su mototaxi, así también desea poder comprarle puertas para su vehículo; de esta manera Miguel tendrá su mototaxi en mejores condiciones para seguir trabajando, así el espera poder aumentar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda adquirir un auto para seguir trabajando y así él seguirá esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un músico reconocido.

loans.use: Para realizar la refacción de su mototaxi.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Zainab.  She is widowed and has three children who are 12, 7 and 3 years old. In 2008, Zainab established her clothing and textiles business. Being a single parent, she thought it fit to engage in a business as it is the only way out for her sustainability. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,401,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Zainab requires a loan in order to buy poplin and other materials that are not available in the shop. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock and raise more profit. In the future, Zainab plans to open an account for her children for their future education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for poplin and other materials

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emily works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Emily is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her business .

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Anton

texts.en:
Anton is single and lives with his parents and a younger sister. His father is retired, his mother is a housewife. His younger sister is a college student. Anton is the sole breadwinner in the family. Anton is also a college student and he pays his college fees himself. Anton is honest and hard-working. He is very creative and full of new ideas. When Anton was working in the sphere of furniture production and assembly, he was dreaming about starting his own business in this industry. However, he didn’t have sufficient capital and he realized he had to provide for his family and cover household expenses. That is why he opened a kiosk selling bakery items. Previous loans in “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped him to buy plastic windows and a door, do all the reconstruction work inside the kiosk, and invest in the inventory. Anton is requesting the above amount to reconstruct his kiosk into a little store and build up a stock of provisions. This loan would give him a chance to buy a larger assortment of goods, such as sugar, flour, vegetable oil, and cereals, which sell extremely well in winter. Anton is also planning to hire a second salesperson providing a stable source of income for one more family in the community. He believes the loan would boost his economic activitity and help him generate more profits. It will not only help him grow his business but also give his family a better quality of life. Anton’s dream is to open a small furniture production factory. He believes financial assistance in combination with his zeal, perserverance and diligent work will someday help his dream come true.

Антон – неодружений, живе з батьками та молодшою сестрою. Його батько – пенсіонер, мати – домогосподарка. Молодша сестра навчається в університеті. Антон – єдиний, хто працює в родині. Антон також навчається в університеті та самостійно платить за навчання. Антон – чесна та працьовита людина. Він дуже творчий, в нього повно нових ідей. Коли Антон працював на заводі з виготовлення меблів, він мріяв про свій власний бізнес у цій галузі. Однак в нього не вистачало коштів. Антон розумів, що йому треба дбати про родину та сплачувати рахунки. Тому він відкрив невеличкий кіоск та почав торгувати хлібо-булочними виробами. Позики в „Надії України” допомогли йому придбати пластикові вікна та двері, відремонтувати кіоск та придбати товари. Антон просить про позику для того, щоб реконструювати кіоск в маленький магазин та розширити асортимент продуктових товарів. Ця позика надасть йому можливість придбати різноманітні продовольчі товари, наприклад: цукор, борошно, олію та крупи, які користуються особливим попитом взимку. Антон також планує взяти на роботу ще одного реалізатора, а отже, забезпечити стабільний заробіток для ще однієї людини. Він вважає, що позика сприятиме розвитку його торгівлі та надасть йому можливість отримати гарний прибуток. Це не тільки допоможе його бізнесу, але й якісно покращить життя його родини. Антон мріє про власний маленький завод з виготовлення меблів. Він вірить, що одного дня за допомогою фінансової підтримки у поєднанні з його наполегливістю, ретельною та старанною працею він досягне цього та зможе втілити свою мрію в життя.

loans.use: To get an assortment of provisions for sale and reconstruct a kiosk into a little store

loans.name: Eroo

texts.en:
Eroo is married with ten children, and all are in primary school. She is a primary school dropout and has not undertaken any form of training. She started working as a businesswoman in 1999 in order to support her family in meeting their basic needs. As a fishmonger, she trades from market to market within her locality.

With this loan of $200 from PEMCI, she will increase her stock, which would cut down on the number of trips she has to make each week to the buying centers. This would lower her transportation cost and improve her profit margins.

To supplement her income further, Eroo also works as a local massage lady, mainly treating those suffering from bone-related illnesses. This enables her to play a very important role in her community as a healer. Eroo is well-worth the support from Kiva.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and selling grilled fish

loans.name: Ayten

texts.en: Ayten D. owns and operates a clothing stand in the bazaar of her hometown of Devechi, which is located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Ayten has already successfully repaid two loans with Norwegian Microcredit. She is looking for more funding so that she can further increase the quantity and quality of her inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and quality of her inventory

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Mrs. Edith U. a 51 year old woman, from a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells charcoal to people in her area, and she is a married mother of two (2) children. She needs the loan $800 to buy more charcoal and expand her business. She has been with LAPO for 4 years and has been in this business for 8 years.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Fialauia

texts.en: H. Fialauia is 33 years of age and is the mother of 3 school children. She and her husband tend to their taro plantation six days a week. She sells 3-4 bags of taro at the market twice a week for which she recieves 300-400 Tala ($120-160 US) a month. She uses this money to send her children to school, and she will use the loan to expand on her four-acre taro plantation.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Anju

texts.en: Mrs. Anju T., 50 yrs old, resides in Nakhu Tole. Nakhu is a village situated in the Lalitpur district. Almost all of the people around are envolved in local businesses. Mrs.T. has three members in her family including her. She has one son who is 21 yrs old and is studying in his second year of school (post-high-school). Her husband's name is Roshan T.. They do vegetable farming and even sell flowers. They need the loan of in order to buy the necessary things for growing vegetables like seeds, manure and pesticides.

loans.use: To buy necessary things for growing vegetables

loans.name: Mugema E(Iii) Group

texts.en: Annet is 46 years old and married with six children. She owns a small retail shop. With the extra business profits, she intends to support her family and pay the school fees so her children may receive an education.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her shop to increase profits.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Mrs. Vorn Ruom, 27, is a married with one little kid and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She works raising pigs on her piece of land and usually makes about $2 each day in revenue. Her husband works as a fisherman, making three dollars each day in revenue. Mrs. Von R. would like to ask for this loan to expand her livestock by adding more pigs. This will increase her family’s income.

loans.use: Needs more pigs to expand her livestock.

loans.name: Kurbonjon

texts.en:
Kurbonjon is 36 years old and is married with four children of school age. She runs a café where she provides meals of both the national and European cuisines. The café is located in the central local market, which allows Kurbonjon to have many clients from among the market's customers. The business has been generating a stable income for the past 7 years. Kurbonjon's husband is unemployed and the business is their only one source of income.

Kurbonjon plans to purchase foodstuffs including potatoes, carrots, onions, and oil at wholesale prices. For this purpose, she requests US $900.00 for 5 months. Kurbonjon has been provided with several loans by IMON and has proved herself to be a reliable client. She thanks all who have supported her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To enable the purchase of wholesale-priced foodstuffs for a cafe

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Mrs. Yat O. is a widow with eight children; one son and seven daughters. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. Four of her children work in a garment factory, two weave silk at home and the youngest one studies at university. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers frO. PhnO. Penh.

Mrs. Yat has been a weaver since 1979. It’s a skill she learned frO. her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then sells them in PhnO. Penh. 

She is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase material for weaving silk and pay school fees for her son.

loans.use: to purchase materials to weave silk and pay school fees for her son

loans.name: Mujeres Fuertes Group

texts.en:
Rosa is an ambitious 37-year-old woman who lives with her husband, Jose Luis, and her 6 children (10, 12, 14, 17, 19, and 21). Rosa has been selling food for almost 14 years, but she barely makes enough profit to just sustain her business like it is. With this loan she wants to buy a new supply of food, and also add new things to her store. In her free time she enjoys spending time with her friends, and watching TV. Her dream for the future is that she would be able to own a successful restaurant.

This will be the 2nd loan for 10 of the women in Tamarindo, and the 1st loan for the other 5. Esperanza looks forward to watching them grow and succeed, and we want to sincerely thank you for your support! God Bless.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Gonogorik 2020-3 Group

texts.en:
Hellen K., the group leader, currently has a business selling bread and has requested this loan in order to open a shop. Hellen is 24 years old, married, and has two children aged 2 and 8. Her husband is a businessman and her children go to school. Each week, Hellen makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Hellen is joined in her small group by Christine A., Cicilia J. and Mary L.. Christine A. sells sweets and chocolate at the market and wants to open up a bigger shop. Cicilia J. is currently operating a business that sells fish and would use this loan to import more fish from neighbouring countries such as Uganda. Mary L. sells local brew from home and wants to open up a bar.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys is a hard-working woman who, day by day, makes the effort to support her children so that they can live without economic deprivation. Every day, after preparing the day’s meals for her children, this devoted mother leaves the house early to perform her daily function—providing public transportation for the people of Juliaqueña. Thanks to her dedication throughout her years of work, she was able to build a home and provide security and tranquility for her family. Gladys’s children are now in university and need money for school supplies. She is asking for a loan to pay for these school expenses, and with the money she earns from her work she will repay the debt within the designated time period.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys es una mujer trabajadora que día a día se esfuerza para mantener sin privaciones económicas a sus queridos hijos, esta diligente madre, desde muy temprano, luego de preparar los alimentos del día para sus hijos, abandona su hogar para cumplir su función cotidiana, brindar servicio de movilidad urbana a la población Juliaqueña.Gracias a su dedicación y entrega a lo largo de estos años de trabajo pudo hacer construir su vivienda y ofrecerles seguridad y tranquilidad a su familia. Los hijos de Gladys están ahora en la universidad y necesitan compra los útiles necesarios, cantidad de dinero con la que Gladis no cuenta, ella pide este préstamo para comprar los útiles de sus hijos y con su trabajo diario promete pagar su deuda en el plazo indicado.

loans.use: To  buy school supplies for her children attending university

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam works as an employee in a store where she sells seasonal clothing. She is a student at the Universidad Pública de El Alto and lives with her parents, whom are senior citizens. Her salary, which is not much, contributes to the maintaining the family, whose house is located in the neighborhood of Villa Cooperativa Rio Seco in the city of El Alto.

The loan will serve to buy a computer, a tool that will help her with her work at the university.

This is her first loan with Kiva and the assessment favorably qualifies her to have her request fulfilled.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Miriam trabaja como empleada en un tienda donde se comercializa ropa por temporadas, es estudiante en la Universidad Pública de El Alto y vive con sus padres que son de la tercera edad. Su sueldo (que no es mucho) contribuye a la manutención de la familia, su vivienda esta ubicada en la Zona Villa Cooperativa Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito servirá para comprar una computadora, herramienta que le ayudará en la realización de sus trabajos en la universidad. Es su primer crédito con Kiva, la evaluación la califica favorablemente para aprobar su solicitud de préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer (for education)

loans.name: Erica

texts.es:
La señora Erica pertenece al BC “María Auxiliadora”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de refrigerios, como jugos de frutas naturales y sándwiches, en el frontis de su domicilio situado en el LR. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 947, lugar donde acuden sus clientes por ser calle principal de la ciudad.
 
En estos últimos meses el negocio ha aumentado gracias al clima y la buena atención. Los clientes son sus vecinos, estudiantes, motocarristas entre otros, quienes acuden todas las mañanas para disfrutar de los jugos de diferentes frutas y sándwiches de jamón, queso y huevo que oferta diariamente.

 Con el préstamo de S/. 600, el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de frutas para la preparación de los jugos como: papaya, naranja, manzana, guineos, maracuyá, betarraga, azúcar en saco, panes, huevo, jamón y queso. También comprará vasos descartables, servilletas, sorbetes, entre otros, para dar una buena atención a sus clientes.

Tiene 27 años, es una mujer muy optimista, sobre todo muy trabajadora, su meta es llegar a tener un local propio para instalar mejor y bien implementado su negocio de refrigerio.
texts.en:
Erica belongs to the Community Bank 'Maria Auxiliadora' and she lives in the region and province of San Martin, in the district of Tarapoto. She sells cold food and drink like natural fruit juices and sandwiches from the front of her house in the LR. Allfonso Ugarte No 947 is where she goes to get her clients as it is the main street in the city.

In the last few months the business has been growing thanks to the climate and the attention she's been getting. Her clients are neighbors, students and bikers among others, and they come to her every morning to enjoy the different fruit juices and ham, cheese and egg sandwiches that she offers daily.

With the loan of $600 which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will invest in buying fruit to make juice such as: papayas, oranges, apples, 'guineos' (green bananas), passion fruit, beetroots, sacks of sugar, bread, eggs, ham and cheese. She will also buy throw-away cups, napkins, sorbet amongst other things to serve her clients well.

She is 27 years old and is a very optimistic woman and, more than anything, she is very hard working. Her aim is to install and stock out her own store to sell cold foods and drinks.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits like papayas, oranges, apples, passion fruit, sugar, bread, eggs, ham, cheese etc/Compra de frutas como papaya, naranja, manzana, maracuyá, azúcar, panes, huevo, jamón, queso, etc.

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en:
Kalameli L., 47, is married with 2 children. She has many years of experience with the equipment used in her barbeque business. She sells to the village people and the public 4 days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Kalameli's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband and children help out with the business.

loans.use: buying equipment used in her business

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma M. has been selling clothing in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She works for eight hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $40 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes to sell and increase her profit. If her business expands, she hopes to use the additional money to buy more food for her family, save money, and reinvest in her business.

Salma is 23 years old, divorced, and has one, 1-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Abudul

texts.en:
Abdul W., 33, is married and a father of six children. The eldest five are all in school. 

Abdul is a palm oil producer in his town and has been in this business for fourteen years. He says it is through this business that he provides for his family and covers other expenses. He is the chairman of the palm oil producers in the community. 

According to Abdul, they are able to make good sales when the commodity becomes scarce in the system. He therefore wants to buy palm fruits in large quantity when it is plentiful and falls in price. Then he can prepare the oil, store it and sell it later when its price has risen. In this way, his profit margin will increase and can meet all his family expenses.

Abdul belongs to the “Dichem” group where the group members guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm fruits in bulk

loans.name: Benie

texts.en:
Benie G. is a 32 year old mother of three children from Butuan City in Agusan Del Sur. She owns a store. She has been dreaming of a good life not only for her but also for her children. Her husband has been helping her in her business. Together, they have worked hard to support their children’s education.

She started her business using a small amount of capital that she had saved. She eventually bought assorted goods and sold them all to her neighbors. She never stopped dreaming until she joined CEVI and availed herself of its credit program. She needs a loan to purchase dry goods to sell in her store. She believes that by displaying more goods in her store she could earn more and compete well with other stores.

CEVI helps her sustain her business. She continually receives credit assistance, trainings, as well as insurance coverage, which she uses to flourish in her business.

loans.use: To purchase drygoods to add to her store.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 51-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Jamal has been working in construction for ten years. He is a tiler. Jamal requests a loan of $900 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase materials for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time.
Jamal's previous loan has influenced him in a good way. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he worked on small projects because he didn’t have a lot of experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business by taking on more and bigger projects.

loans.use: Jamal will use the loan to purchase materials for his work.

loans.name: Margarita Verónica

texts.es:
Margarita es una dama originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega donde se dedica a su ardua labor de venta de electrodomésticos los cuales son comercializados en su propio tramo. 

Actualmente ella ha buscado la manera de como ampliar su negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la mercadería y así continuar comercializando sus productos. Es por esto que ella espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y de esta forma saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Margarita is a lady who comes from the city of Chinandega where she works hard selling household appliances which she sells from her home. She is now looking into how to expand her business and for this has approached Ceprodel for a loan to buy merchandise and thus continue selling her goods. Because of this she is very confidently optimistic that her loan request will be granted and in this manner she will continue to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Sing

texts.en: Sing L., 45, a married mother of five children, all students, lives in a medium-sized wooden house in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She currently breeds pigs next to her house twice a year, selling them for slaughter three months after she begins raising them. Her husband, Korn, 45, earns a living making and selling charcoal; the family also grows rice for sale, and the children help their parent's businesses when they are not studying.  Sing and her husband are now requesting a loan to buy a buffalo for transporting charcoal and rice.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for transporting rice and charcoal to market.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
ESTHER L. OLGUÍN, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amigas por Siempre” vive en el Jr. José O’Higgins Mz N Lt 15 del distrito de Yarinacocha, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 48 años de edad, 02 hijos, es viuda.

Inició el negocio de abarrotes con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró verduras, frutas y  un poco de mercadería, pero no le fue tan bien, por lo que busco dedicarse a otra actividad. Por lo tanto se dedico a administrar un motocarro, que le resulto mucho mejor.

Hoy, cuenta ella con 2 motocarros y se dedica a su administración, y justamente el préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en compras para el mantenimiento y renovación de sus llantas, tapices, y toldos, así como algunos repuestos y seguros necesarios.

Da gracias a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que está brindando a las mujeres de la región, dándoles una oportunidad de generar ingresos para sus familias.
texts.en:
Esther L. O. belongs to the communal bank, "Amigas por Siempre" (Friends Forever). She lives in the city of Pucallpa, is 48, has 2 children, and is a widow. She started her grocery business with her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, and bought vegetables, fruits, and a small amount of other merchandise. It didn't go very well for her, though, and she searched for another activity to do. She started to administer a motorcycle rickshaw business, which went much better for her. Today she has 2 motorcycle rickshaws, which she administers. Now with the loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, she will invest in their maintenance and replacing their tires, upholstery, and awnings, along with some parts and necessary insurance. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for its support because it is offering the best to women in the region, giving them an opportunity to generate income for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for maintenance and replacing tires, upholstery, awnings, parts, and necessary insurance

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia Z. is a 58-year-old mother of five. Her husband is a carpenter, earning Php 200 a day. Lydia sells food for snacks to support the needs of the family. Her five sons are only secondary school graduates as she was not able to send them to college because the family income is not enough to support their tuition. She dreamt of sending them even to a vocational course but credit was not available in their place before.

Just this time she got an opportunity to get capital from ASHI (Ahon Sa Hitrap, Inc.) which has opened in their village. She is applying for her first loan to be used in buying ice cubes, refined sugar, a water jug, plastic glasses and spoons, pineapple liquid, sticks, and condensed milk. She wants to grab this summertime to earn an income. She hopes that in the future, she can sell different food snacks to have a regular income.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for ice scrumble (a crushed-ice drink)

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda S. is 46 years old and a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children. She is very industrious, and runs a store where she sells food and household supplies while her husband is away working as a fisherman. Although her sales experience many ups and downs, business is doing well. 

Rosalinda believes this is a good time to expand her business, and is applying for this loan to buy new inventory to sell to her customers. Someday, she hopes to own a bigger store.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies such as canned goods, laundry and bath soap, shampoo, noodles, seasonings and beverages

location.town: Plaridel-Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.es: Juvenal A. tiene 57 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Cinda y tienen 3 hijos de los cuales niguno depende de ellos ya que son mayores de edad. Juvenal tiene su casa propia bien ubicada sobre una avenida asfaltada y en una zona populosa entre la Villa 1ro de Mayo y La Pampa de la Isla. En su domicilio tienen una tienda de abarrotes bien surtida y bien ubicada ya que queda en esquina y es bien visible por la vecindad. Juvenal es veterinario de profesion y tiene su pequeño consultorio en su domicilio. Adicionalmente a estas actividades tambien estan confeccionando prendas de vestir para damas las cuales en colaboracion de una de sus hijas llevan hacia la frontera. En su barrio tiene competencia con la tienda de abarrotes pero no hay ningun consultorio veterinario cerca.  El credito tiene como fin el inyectar capital de trabajo para su taller de confeccion y para su tienda de abarrotes lo cual le generara mayores ingresos. Juvenal ha tenido un buen comportamiento de pagos en todos sus creditos demostrando responsabilidad y organización.
texts.en:
At age 57, Juvenal is married to Cinda and they have three children, and none of them are dependent upon their parents since they are older now. Juvenal has his own home which is well-located on an asphalt avenue and in a populated area between Villa 1ro de Mayo and La Pampa de la Isla. In their house, they have a grocery store that is well-stocked and well-located since it lies on a corner and visible to the neighborhood. Juvenal is a veterinarian by profession and has his small office in his house. In addition to these activities, they are also making clothing for women in collaboration with one of their daughters, who carries the products to the border. In their neighborhood they have competition for their grocery store, but there is no other vet nearby. The loan's goal is to increase working capital for their clothing shop and for their grocery store, which will generate the most income. Juvenal has had a good record of making payments in all his loans demonstrating responsibility and organization.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma G. is 37 years old and blessed with two school-age children, ages 17 and 13. She is married to Ronnie G., a motorcycle transport driver in their village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City in the southern part of the Philippines. She engages in a sari-sari (variety) store and a carinderia (food stall).

Emma's business is getting better and she earns approximately Php 400 daily. The business has run for about ten months now.

Emma wants to provide for the needs of her family, especially enrolling her children in school. To earn more income, she wants to apply for a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) of Php 5,000 to purchase two piglets and also to purchase grocery items for her store.

She is hoping, that through HSPFI, Kiva lenders will grant her application.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets and to purchase grocery items for sale

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia A. has eight children--two sons and six daughters. all of whom are in school. She is 40 years old and married. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer. She is a fish monger who sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a tabletop at the market square. She also supplies fish to other retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes them herself. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
G. Hoàng Thị (525980650) is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has three school-aged children.

G. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately 4,900,000 VND a month.

In 1998, G. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

G. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 11th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Evelyn Carolina

texts.es: Evelyn Carolina M. D. P. resiD. en la Capital del país San Salvador, es una mujer casada con 42 años D. edad ,vive en casa propia  con su familia integrada por su esposo don Gustavo y sus tres hijos todos menores D. edad, quienes actualmente se encuentran estudiando.
