Evelyn posee su negocio es una tienda  que se encuentra ubicada en su casa, ya con 10 Años D. experiencia y por la cual ella ahora solicita este crédito ya desea surtirla D. productos en granos básicos que son muy solicitados por sus clientes, D. esta manera Evelyn logrará aumentar sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Evelyn Carolina M. D. P. lives in San Salvador, the capital city of El Salvador. She is a married woman of 42 years and lives in her own house with her family maD. up of her husband Gustavo and their three children, who are all minors and currently studying. Evelyn has a store in her house, in which she has been busy for ten years. She applies now for a credit which she will use to stock up her store with staple grains which are in high demand, so that she can increase her sales and get more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple grains for her store

loans.name: Saed

texts.en: Saed is a young man, 20 years of age, single, lives with his parents and three younger brothers , who are all in school. He owns a grocery store . He would like to use this loan to expand the capacity of his commerce by acquiring supplies of new products for his store. Given this chance, he will earn more funds and save more, so as meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: acquiring supplies of new products for his store

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Mrs. Visitacion S. is a 70-year-old widow from Brgy. Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has 3 adult children, all of whom are now professionals, thanks to her own efforts and the help of NWTF-Project Dungganon.

Mrs. S. became a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon Himamaylan Branch in 1998. She used her first loan to expand her "Sari-sari" or General Store. Later, she operated a coffee shop to increase her income capacity, using loans to fund her business expansion. When her husband died, she had to try harder to earn more to support her family. It was at that time that she started her food vending business by selling cooked food during lunch time and snacks.   

This is now her 13th loan from NWTF- Project Dungganon and she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to add to her revolving working capital for her food vending business.

Visitaction is not planning to retire any time soon. She is determined that, for as long as she is able, she will stay independent and earn her own living, and not be a burden to her children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for Food vending

loans.name: Maria Estebana

texts.es: La señora María López, 53 años de edad, soltera habitante del barrio 31 de diciembre en la ciudad de Managua, tiene dos hijos que se a ha independizado y le ayudan económicamente, como madre soltera Doña María trabaja como domestica y tiene en sus planes ir remodelando su casa, con quince años de trabajar tiene  estabilidad en el medio laboral, cual es de benefició. El préstamo que solicita será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, inodoro, bloques, láminas de zinc, hierro. Construirá una pared y le dará mantenimiento a su servicio. Obteniendo comodidad y seguridad para su familia. Gracias a estos préstamos lograra hacer las mejoras, siendo el único medio de prosperar mediante el financiamiento ya que resulta difícil construir ya que todo esta caro.
texts.en:
Maria L. is 53, single and lives in the December 31 neighborhood of Managua. She has two independent children who help her economically. As a single mother, Maria works as a maid and would like to remodel her house little by little. Her 15-year work history gives her stability in the labor market which is to her benefit. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase building materials like: cement, a toilet, concrete blocks, zinc plates, iron. She will build a wall and give maintenance to her toilet providing comfort and security for her family. Thanks to these loans she will be able to make these improvements because, without financing, this would be impossible due to the high costs of building materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a wall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy necessary things to build his house

loans.name: Niza

texts.en:
Niza T. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Niza is married and has 4 adult aged children. To make a living, Niza owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying & selling fish in the local community. Niza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Niza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Niza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Niza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Niza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 43 years old, married, and blessed with six children, namely: Temilyn, 26 years of age, a college graduate who is now working at a private company; Joel, 24 years of age, a college graduate; Jocelyn, 22 years of age, a college graduate; Mary-Ann, 19 years of age, a college student;  Antonette, 15 years of age, a junior high school student; and Simone, 8 years of age, a grade three pupil. They are happily living in the village of Baculud, Iguig, Cagayan.

Josefina has operated a sari-sari store business (community-based store) in their village for five years now. She wishes her business to grow for it is a great help in meeting the needs of their family. With her income, she is able to assist her husband in providing for the family.

In this regard Josefina wants to borrow additional capital for her business since she needs more stock for the improvement of her store. She is now in need of Php 25,000 and this will be used to buy more stock to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her business

loans.name: Mrs. Samnang Orn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen people, all of whom live in Kong Noy village in Kandal province. Mrs. Samnang O., who has been selected by the other members as the village bank president, is a 60-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. Both of her children are enrolled in the local school.

Mrs. Samnang O. makes and sells soup to generate income. Her husband, Mr. Lat Chork, is a farmer, who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. She is now applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes. With the loan proceeds, she hopes to increase her income and thereby improve her family's standard of living by selling the cow.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding purposes

loans.name: Ivette Maribel

texts.es:
La Sra. Ivette G. L. de 37 años de edad vive en Botijeria Angulo Norte - Cercado de Ica. Vive en casa de un familiar junto con sus 2 hijos uno de 18 años y la mujer de 16 años de edad .
Se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas,pollos brosthers, gaseosas y otros.
Su negocio se encuentra ubicado fuera de su domicilio, ésta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años.
Es bien trabajadora; en las mañanas se dedica a cuidar 3 niños y realiza trabajo de limpieza por las tardes y en la noche sale a vender sus hamburguesas.
Gracias a su trabajo y dedicación a logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos quienes van a postular a la universidad y por ello solicita el financiamiento para llevar acabo el sueño de poder brindarles una educación superior a ellos.  
La Sra. goza de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos y de sus comensales quienes manifiestan que es bien tratable y amable.
texts.en:
Ms. Ivette G. L. is 37 years old and lives in Botijeria Angulo Norte-near Ica. She lives in the home of a relative with her 2 children; one is 18 years old and the other is a young woman, 16 years old. She sells hamburgers, chicken, soft drinks and other things. Her business is located outside of her home and she has been involved in this activity for 5 years. She is very hard-working; in the morning, she takes care of 3 children and in the afternoon, she cleans and then in the evening, she goes to sell her hamburgers. Thanks to her work and dedication, she has been able to make progress and her children are going to apply to university. For this reason, she is requesting this loan in order to achieve the dream of giving her children a post-secondary education. Ms. G. L. has good references from her neighbors and her customers who say she is congenial and friendly.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to cover personal expenses

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel D. de 48 años de edad, tiene una casa de cemento con todos los servicios básicos su casa esta ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, Manuel comenzó su negocio porque quedo desempleado y necesitaba un ingreso para su familia con este empuje, dedicación y esfuerzo comenzó una pequeña tienda.

Ahora Manuel trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00 con su esposa, comprar arroz a $ 0.30 y los vende a $ 0.35 la libra, atún los compra a $ 0.80 y los vende $ 1.00 c/u, colas a $ 0.75 y los vende a $ 1.00 c/u una de las mayores dificultades de su negocio es la competencia ya que el negocio esta ubicado en un sector comercial.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, y otros víveres para el negocio, en el futuro quiere expandir más su negocio y poder así mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Manuel D. is 48 years old and has a house constructed of cement with all basic services. His home is located on the Perimetral (ring road) of Guayaquil. Manuel started his business because he was unemployed and needed income for his family. With this inspiration, dedication and effort, he opened a small store. Today, Manuel works from 6 in the morning until 10 at night, along with his wife. They purchase rice at 30 cents a pound and sell it for 35 cents; they buy tuna at 80 cents and sell it for $1.00 a unit; and they buy bottles of soft drinks for 75 cents each and sell them for $1.00. One of the greatest challenges for their business is competition, since their shop is located in a commercial zone. With the funds from this loan, Manual wants to buy rice, sugar and other food products for his shop; in the future he would like to further expand his store so that he can eventually improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul K. is a father of  four children, married to a woman who is a farmer.  All of his children are in primary school.  Abdul owns a store where he sells rice and other agricultural products.  He has had several other businesses until a couple of years ago when he started selling rice.  His wife, though a farmer, usually helps Abdul in the store, and its profits are used to care for his family.  Abdul is seeking a loan get more stock for his shop, thereby expanding his capital and income.

loans.use: to buy rice for his store

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with a 7-year-old son. She lives in Stryi, where she runs a souvenir sales business.  She has another sales location in the town of Truskavets, a popular resort in the Carpathian mountains. Olga sells paintings, woodcrafts and other retail souvenir items. She had experience working as a salesperson before she launched her own business. Olga has been in this trade for 3 years. Currently, she has about 10,000 Grivnyas worth of merchandise. 

Olga is requesting a loan of 9,750 Grivnyas to increase the assortment of merchandise she offers for sale to tourists vacationing in Western Ukraine. Olga usually makes a good profit in the winter,  when many tourists come to the Carpathians to ski. She is seeking to expand her small venture and generate additional income. Olga hopes to use additional profits generated by the loan to remodel her home.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
La Sra. Damaris, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 28 años y es madre de 01 bebe que aun depende de ella. Estudió Computación e Informática oficio que no lo ejerce.  

Damaris, es una mujer trabajadora y dado su espíritu optimista que siempre le ha caracterizado, hoy en día lleva 05 años dedicándose al servicio de lavado de motos lineales y motocarros, negocio ubicado en su misma casa, un lugar amplio y acondicionado. Nos cuenta que a diario acuden muchos clientes. Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles, compró detergentes en docenas, escobillas, insumos que le sirvieron para iniciar su negocio.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles comprará detergente en cajas, escobillas en docenas y una nueva manguera para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente.

Damaris, se siente muy bien al pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres, que le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece bastante al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial igualmente se siente respaldada por el nuevo producto que la institución esta ofreciendo que es el Micro seguro de vida, también es su deseo contar con en seguro de salud.
texts.en:
Damaris belongs to the Los Eucaliptos Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martin province, San Martín department. She is 28, in a common law marriage, and has one baby who is dependent upon her. She studied the field of information technology, but she does not work in that field. Damaris is a hard-working woman. Given her optimistic spirit, which has always characterized her, she has now spent five years in the business of washing motorcycles and “motocarros” (three wheeled motorized vehicles). Her business is located at her house in a well equipped area. She tells us that she has a lot of customers everyday. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought detergent by the dozen, brushes, and supplies that helped her start her business. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy cases of detergent, brushes by the dozen, and a new hose to be able to offer better service and tend to her customers in a much better way. Damaris feels very good belonging to a group of women that has helped her to better know her rights, and together they make sure these rights are respected. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start in the business field. Also, she feels supported by the new product that the institution is offering, micro life insurance. Also, her wish is to have health insurance.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy brushes and cases of detergent for her business

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim L. is 51 years old and lives in Chhoeng Chhorvin village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder and her husband, Mr. Ngorn Nut is a farmer who owns a two hectare plot of land on which they cultivate rice to support themselves.

In the rice field, they have some problems because the soil is infertile.  In order to improve the farm, Mrs. Sim L. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan money, she would like to buy hoses and plastic to protect the rice field.

She has three children, one of whom is a farmer, another a duck breeder, and the other a student at a local public school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Maria De Jesús tiene 38 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa y golosinas por lo que tiene más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, cuando inicio a vender fue porque no tenía el capital suficiente por lo que estaba atravesando una difícil situación económica por que tenia 2 hijos que mantener pues es una mujer muy responsable y disfruta mucho de tener este medio de vida, pues todos los días se levanta muy temprano ya que tiene que recurrir al mercado a realizar las compras de las golosinas además tiene que hacer los quehaceres del hogar. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Ella sueña con proporcionarle una educación digna a cada uno de ellos.
texts.en:
Maria De Jesús, 38, has sold clothing and snacks for over 3 years now. She started because she didn't have enough capital and she was going through a difficult economic situation: she had two children to support. She is a responsible woman, who enjoys her work very much, because she rises very early every day to go to the market to buy her snacks; she also has to do all the household chores. She is asking for funds to buy merchandise. She dreams with providing each of her children with a proper education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Azra Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Azra Parveen is a very hard working lady. She operates an embroider clothes business to share the financial burden with her husband. She earns approximately Pak Rs 8,000 from her embroider business. She also saves a part of her income after paying the expenses for rainy days.  
Her husband name is M. I. who has a cosmetics selling business. He sells the items on his cart by going to various places. By the grace of god he has obtained a good order from the cosmetic shops and to complete the order he needed of a capital therefore Azra has decided to apply for a loan of worth Pak Rs. 20,000 which would be a great help for I. to set a good reputation in the eyes of his new customers. 

She has applied with four other ladies. Zubaida wants a loan to buy an automatic sewing machine for her sewing clothes business. Shagufta wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and rice) for her food selling business. Nazia wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business. Mumtaz wants a loan to buy leather for her leather selling business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 31 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos, vive en el sector Huaca Blanca del distrito de Pacanga, en la provincia de Chepén, región La Libertad, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Hace tres años que llegó a la comunidad en donde vive y desde entonces se ha dedicado a trabajar en labores agrícolas y ganaderas. Actualmente sostiene a su familia con los ingresos que percibe de su negocio de crianza y venta de ganado vacuno y animales menores, ella cría los animales hasta que esten lo suficientemente desarrollados para vendérselos a los negociantes que visitan la zona, usualmente cría vacas, borregos y aves de corral.

Carmen ha estado ahorrando dinero durante los últimos meses y ha decidido incursionar en la agricultura: ha arrendado un terreno en el cual ha instalado maíz, ella desea aplicarle fertilizantes y riegos para asegurarse una buena producción, por este motivo se encuentra solictando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Carmen es una madre luchadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder asegurarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Durante el poco tiempo que lleva en la zona se ha sabido ganar el respeto y estima de sus vecinos los que la consideran una mujer de confianza.
texts.en:
Carmen is 31 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two children. She lives in the Huaca Blanca sector of the District of Pacanga, Chepén Province. This community is in the region of La Libertad and located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Carmen arrived in this community three years ago and has been engaged in farming and raising livestock ever since. She currently supports her family with the income she receives from raising and selling cattle and small animals. Carmen raises her animals until they have developed enough to sell to traders who visit the area. She usually raises cows, sheep, and poultry.

Carmen has been saving money over the past few months so that she could lease some land for growing corn. She wants to apply fertilizers and irrigate the land to ensure a good harvest. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to help accomplish this goal.

Carmen is a determined mother who is devoted to her family. Her greatest dream is to continue growing as a businesswoman to secure a better quality of life for her children. During the short amount of time she has lived in this area, Carmen has managed to gain the respect and esteem of her neighbors who consider her to be a confident woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for labor to prepare farmland for planting corn

location.town: Huaca Blanca - Pacanga - Chepén - La Libertad

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA CRISTINA ES VIUDA, SU ESPOSO FALLECIO HACE POCO PARA ELLA FUE UN MOMENTO DIFICIL YA QUE SE ENCONTRO SOLA EL ERA SU UNICO APOYO, YA QUE ELLA SOLO SE DEDICABA A LABORES DE LA CASA, PERO SUPO SALIR ADELANTE POR EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA YA QUE TIENE 4 HIJOS, SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE EDREDONES, TAMBIEN TIENE UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO EN SU DOMICILIO, DESDE HACE 3 AÑOS, LA SEÑORA ESTA EN SU SEGUNDA SECUENCIA DONDE HA DEMOSTRADO SER MUY RESPONSABLE EN SUS PAGOS, ELLA SOLA MANTIENE SU HOGAR TIENE CASA PROPIA, ESTE CREDITO ES PARA COMPRAR MERCADERIA PARA ASI PODER SURTIR SU TIENDA, ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE SIEMPRE VIENDO A QUE NEGOCIO DEDICARSE YA QUE EL DINERO NO LE ALCANZA CON 4 HIJOS ES DURO PARA ELLA, PERO LA SRA. CRISTINA SIEMPRE OPTIMISTA POR EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Cristina is a widow. Her husband died a short while ago. This was a difficult time for her because she found herself alone. He was her only support because she only devoted herself to the housework. But, she knew how to get ahead for the family’s well-being. She has four children. She buys and sells comforters. She has also had a neighborhood store in her house for three years. She is in her second cycle, and she has shown herself to be very responsible with her payments. She alone supports her household. She has her own house. This loan is to buy merchandise to be able to stock her store. She is very hard-working and responsible. She always sees which business to work in when there is not enough money. With four children it is hard for her. But, Cristina is always optimistic about the well-being of her family. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust given in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sopheap S. is 32 years old and is the group leader of a loan. He was selected by 5 members who are located in Chrey Young village in Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purpose. Mrs. Sopheap S. is a pig breeder and her husband, Mr. Bol Kann, is a rice wine maker. With both businesses they can earn a small income to support their family's living. Mrs. Sopheap S. is now requesting a loan for pig food to support her pig breeding. This couple has four children who all are students in the local school and who also support their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Midonia Haida

texts.es: Midonia Haida tiene 57 años, su actividad es la venta de productos lácteos. Hace más de 30 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que fue producto de la gran necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingreso que ayudar a su familia, poco a poco es que se negocio fue creciendo, la ubicación de su actividad es en mercado en donde circulan mucho clientes por lo que siempre se ha caracterizado por tener una gran carisma, ella le dedica esfuerzo y muchas horas de trabajo a este rubro. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y comprar leche, crema, queso, cuajada, leche agria entre otros productos, para el futuro le gustaría proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Midonia Haida is 57 years old. Her business is selling dairy products. She has had this business for more than 30 years. She started it out of the necessity of earning an income to help her family. The business has grown little by little. It is located in the market, where many customers pass through, which is why she has always been very charismatic. She puts in a lot of effort and many hours of work in this business. She is requesting the loan for working capital to buy milk, cream, cheese, soft cheese, and fermented milk [similar to yoghurt], among other products. In the future, she would like to improve her housing.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk, cream, cheese, soft cheese, and fermented milk [similar to yoghurt]

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn J. is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in Zone 2 Brgy. Tabao, Valladolid. She earns her living by running a general store. Lyn’s husband, Nestor, is 45 years old and a fisherman, and they have two adult children.

Lyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000 from her business activities.

Lyn is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 was used to fund the operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing PHP 19,000 for her sixteenth cycle loan which she intends to use to invest in her general store. Lyn is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To provide additional working capital

loans.name: Jose Jonathan

texts.es:
José de 21 años, vive en la perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y el estero que conecta al río, a unas cuantas cuadras). El y su mama tienen una papelería “bazar”, le ha ayudado para poder mantener su casa. 

Poco a poco José y su mama con esfuerzo han podido agrandar su papelería, trabajan desde las 08:00am hasta las 21:00pm todos los días, venden papelería, CD, cuadernos etc. En ocasiones su padrastro le ayuda cuando el sale a estudiar. Pero para tener mas artículos de bazar y mas ingresos el quiere comprar con el préstamo una vitrina y papelería. 

En el futuro quiere agrandar su negocio, y acaparar mas mercado para su negocio.
texts.en:
José is 21 years old and lives along the Perimetral Highway of Guayaquil (a periurban area with dirt roads and a stream that connects to the river and runs several blocks). He and his mother manage a stationery bazaar, which helps them maintain their household.

Little by little, José and his mother have strived to expand their stationery shop. They work from 8am until 10pm every day selling stationery, CDs, notebooks, and other products. Occasionally his stepfather will help out whenever he has to leave to go study. In order to restock their bazaar and generate more income, José is requesting a loan to buy a display cabinet and stationery.

In the future, he wants to expand his business and capture a larger share of the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stationery & a display cabinet

loans.name: Twefeeko Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Mukono Town, like any other metropolis in Uganda, is crawling with a commercial motorcycle craze, commonly known around the country as Boda Boda. Most people use this form of transportation to beat the gridlock traffic jams that are commonplace all over the country. One person who has developed an inclination towards this craze is 38 year old K. Wilson, a married man with 3 school-going children. It goes without saying that this business is lucrative and that is principally the reason why there are so many people joining this business. 

Wilson like many of his friends has his stage at Ngandu Trading Center. He took root in this business after a close friend gave him the idea. He was previously into fishing. At present, his business brings him weekly profits that total up to 105,000 shillings. With this loan, Wilson wants to purchase a second motorcycle. He anticipates this will help him earn more profits.

loans.use: The purchase of a second motorcycle

loans.name: Alida

texts.es: Alida, de 22 años, es una buena madre de familia, convive con Percy de 26 años y sus tres hermosas hijas, que son su razón de vivir, juntos viven en casa de su suegra. Papa, arveja, maíz y gladiolos, es lo que siembra desde hace 3 años, junto a su esposo, en los terrenos que le cedió su suegra. Ahora que nació la última de sus hijas, no puede realizar mucho esfuerzo físico, por lo que se limita a cuidar a los animales que cría, como: toros, carneros, caballos y asnos, que le ayudan a trasladar los insumos y herramientas agrícolas hacia los terrenos que trabajará. Lo que más le gusta, es secar el maíz que cosechó y vender las flores de gladiolos por paquetes en el mercado de su ciudad. Su esposo le gusta criar ganado vacuno, es por ello que desea comprar  toros, asimismo desea continuar con la siembra. Recientemente planea con su esposo conseguir un capital de trabajo y viajar a una localidad llamada “Cerro de Pasco”, donde tendría la posibilidad de instalar un restaurante, aprovechando que hay asentamientos mineros, en donde son muchas las personas que trabajaran en ese lugar. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y asegura que le gusta trabajar en su grupo comunal, porque está integrada por personal unidas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja y varios sacos de guano de corral para sembrarlos.
texts.en:
Alidia, 22, lives with her husband, Percy, 26, and their three beautiful daughters. She is an attentive mother and her children are her reason for living. The family lives with Alidia's mother-in-law. For the past 3 years, she and her husband have grown potatoes, peas, maize and gladiolus on land given to them by the mother-in-law. Since the birth of her youngest child, Alidia hasn't been able to work as hard as before and, consequently, she limits herself to taking care of the animals--bulls, rams, horses and donkeys--that help them to move agricultural tools and supplies to the fields where they work. The parts of the business that Alidia likes best is drying the maize after a harvest and selling gladiolus in the city's flower market. Her husband wants to raise cattle so she wants to buy bulls. She also wants to continue with the farming business. Recently, she and her husband have talked about pulling together enough working capital to set up a restaurant at a mining settlement called Cerro de Pasco where they could make the most of the demand among the miners there. This is Alidia's third MFP loan. She says that she likes working with her community bank because the members of the group support one another. With this loan, Alidia will buy seeds and bags of manure for sowing a new crop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seeds and manure for farming business.

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en: Fikret  S. is 52 years old and lives with his wife and three children. For about sixteen years, he has dedicated himself to farming wheat and vegetables. Fikret enjoys being a farmer and finds harvesting his crops especially gratifying. On the other hand, the most tedious parts of farming are the preparation of land for planting and protecting the crops from insects that spoil his harvest. Fortunately for Fikret, his products are in high demand in his area and fetch high prices at the market. His monthly income is about 250-350 AZN. He has applied for an 800 AZN loan to purchase more seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia N. is 46 years old, she is married to Nde John; they are blessed with four children. She shares four rooms with her four children and her husband. She lives in Alanbukam mankon, a quarter in Bamenda Northwest Region of Cameroon. Theresia has encountered difficulties in life ranging from the inability to meet her daily needs and the failure to attain a quality education. She reiterates, however, how happy she was when she gave birth to a set of twins. 

With this loan, Theresia plans to clear off weeds from her farm and to buy fertilizer to apply to the soil for a higher yield. She is convinced that the soil does not deceive anyone who works hard. She will also use part of the capital to buy vegetables seeds which she will plant, nurture, harvest and sell while she feeds her family on the surplus. The loan will help her community because she will be able to provide vegetables which are very good for health, and they will not incur transport costs to buy it elsewhere in distant places. 

Theresia will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She will use a portion of the profit to pay for her children’s education and upgrade their standard of living. 

Theresia prefers borrowing from GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the follow-up. GHAPE also does not ask for collateral securities, and its loans are low cost with a gradual repayment rate.

About GHAPE:

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business and financial management, basic health maintenance, life skills and family values. Clients are also required to deposit a small amount of money into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community among its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To enrich her farm and buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a sixty-year-old widow living with two grandchildren aged 6 and 14 and she is the head of six members of the family. She operates a confectionery business and has been in the business for the last six years. She owns a house in Fort Portal, Uganda and a bakery which has enabled her to sustain the family. 

She has a challenge of limited supply of raw materials and fluctuating prices of these commodities, thus making it hard to determine her income periodically. Her biggest dream is to have a variety of confectionery to supply in the region thus the need to acquire a loan to re-invest. Her family dream is to have a good  standard of living. The purpose of the loan is to buy wheat, cooking oil, and sugar for making confectionery to sell.

loans.use: Buying wheat, cooking oil, and sugar for making confectionery to sell

loans.name: Yolanda Eulalia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Yolanda que nos cuenta algo de su vida, tiene 62 años, es soltera pero en su juventud tuvo tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, su hijo mayor vive en Junín, la menor vive en Quito y solo uno  vive con ella.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 14h00, ella deja a crédito y cobra por semanas, dice que sus clientes son fieles a ella ya que son varios años que ella les entrega sus productos, se desplaza hasta Guayaquil a comprar sus productos una vez por mes cuando ya tiene algunos pedidos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en ir a Guayaquil a comprar más mercadería. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 9 años y le gusta por los créditos que llegan rápido y sin tantos tramites.

Sus sueños son salir adelante y tener un local para ya no recorrer más sino que sus clientes lleguen a su local.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" meets in the San Alejo neighborhood of the beautiful city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province, known for the beautiful beaches that line its coasts that are often visited by national and international tourists.

Here we find Yolanda, who tells us something of her life.  She is 62 years old and is single, but in her youth she had 3 children who are now adults.  Her oldest child lives in Junin, the youngest lives in Quito, and only one of them lives with her.

Yolanda sells clothing door-to-door.  She works every day from 9 in the morning until 2pm.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  She says that her customers are loyal to her, since she has been delivering their products for a number of years.  She travels to Guayaquil to buy her products once a month when she already has some orders.

She will use this loan to go to Guayaquil to buy more merchandise.  She has been a member of the communal bank for 9 years, and she likes it because of the quick access to funds without as much paperwork.

Her dreams are to get ahead and to have her own shop so that she wouldn't have to go around to sell anymore, rather, her customers would come to her place of business.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts and clothing in general

loans.name: Momodu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you the teachers of the Khulafai Rashideen Primary School. This school was founded on the 20th of September 1999 by the Khulafai Rashideen Mission in order to reduce the problems of overcrowding in the then-existing schools. The Khulafai Rashideen Primary school currently has twenty-four dedicated teachers and eight hundred pupils.   

This is not the first loan that teachers of this institution have borrowed from SMT/Kiva lenders. The previous SMT/Kiva loan made a lot of improvements in the lives of these borrowers. “This new loan will further improve the livelihood of our staff members,” said Momodu K., the leader of this group and headmaster at the school. The forty-seven-year-old Momodu was born in Port Loka, a town in northern Sierra Leone.  He has been in the teaching profession for twenty-six years now. Momodu is married to a businesswoman, and they have ten children – eight in primary school and two in secondary school.  Momodu K. is going to invest his share of this loan into a business. He will buy local produce to sell. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise have not been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. With the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, or house-building materials; still others invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: To buy local produce to sell

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en: Dolgor T. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her son, age 7, attends a local primary school. Her husband, Munhbat, supports the family by working at a variety of jobs. Dolgor operates a consumer goods sales business in a rented stall at a local market in the city. Currently her business is good, and she expanded her business by renting a stall in a different trade center. She started this business in 2007 and has built a stable and successful operation. Dolgor works hard to grow her business. With this loan, she hopes to expand her product line in the near future. She is requesting a 990,000 MNT loan to buy more products to sell.

loans.use: To buy more products.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah B. lives in the Kawempe Bubajwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has  4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members.  

Sarah has a business of owning a restaurant. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Sarah sells her products from home, by means of retail. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of cassava, sweet potatoes, bunches of bananas, and crates of soda.  She also generates additional income through selling firewood.  

The main business challenges for Sarah include transport and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked hotel.  

Sarah lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, sweet potatoes, rice, soda and passion fruits

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena N. is from the village of Olango. She is 51 years old. Nena is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Nena owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nena has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 45,000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2008, Nena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Nena is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Nena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mae Grace

texts.en:
25-year-old Mae Grace S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is still single and helps her family earn a living. She helps till their rice farm and make it productive. She also helps in selling their harvest at the market. Mae Grace also dreams of having her own family someday. She works hard to be able to save for her future family. 

Mae Grace joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mae Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mae Grace is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Carmela; ella tiene 37 años. La socia es conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos  la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene en casa un espacio para hacer manicure a las jovencitas que tienen un evento como una fiesta de promoción, quince años, matrimonios y otros y en su casa ellas las arregla, también la socia realiza caritas pintadas dentro de este espacio y para toda edad, la socia hace a pedido tortas para todo tipo de ocasión, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y confía en su habilidad y desea mejorar su espacio y en un futuro no muy lejano ella quiere poner una tienda en el centro de la ciudad ofreciendo su servicio. La socia desea implementar su negocio para estas fiestas navideñas y año nuevo es por esta razón que ella solicita el préstamo para comprar material para sus caritas pintadas y esmaltes modernos, escarchas y decorar también su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This member belongs to the Qorichuspa community bank. This bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco. Carmela is 37, lives with her partner and has 2 children. She works in retail. She has a space in her home where she does manicures for young women who have events coming up such as proms, fifteenth birthday parties, weddings and other events. She also does makeup in her home for all ages. She makes cakes for all occasions on order. She is a very hard-working person and trusts in her abilities. She wants to improve her work space and open a store in the city center in the near future. She wants to have her business running well for the Christmas holidays and new year, and so she is requesting a loan to purchase materials for makeup and modern enamels and glitter, and also to decorate her business. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for her business. She is happy to have this loan and promises to repay it as established.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Noreen's Group

texts.en:
Noreen lives in a small housing colony in the city Kamoki which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living here for over ten years in a two-room brick house. 

Her husband is a welder by profession and is the only earning person in the family. He started this business five years ago and it is working well for him currently. Through his business he offers iron and spare parts repairing services to his customers. 

Noreen herself is a housewife and prefers to stay at home taking care of her household responsibilities. She has given birth to a son and a daughter. Both are less than four years old and have not started attending school yet. 

Noreen has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, to financially assist her husband. He will utilize the loan money in purchasing another welding machine, and he will also hire an assistant. This will help him in completing his work in less time and provide better quality services to his customers. 

Noreen is hopeful that this investment will make a positive impact on her husband’s business and that she will be able to save enough money from his profits to pay for the admission of her children to school next year. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Noreen.

loans.use: To buy another welding machine for the business

loans.name: Qolquewasi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QOLQUEWASI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche también vende otro tipo de productos como golosinas, gaseosas, aceites, fideos entre otros más, la socia está contenta con su negocio ya que mediante este ella saca a su familia adelante, la socia es una persona bien perseverante en todo lo que se propone.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra  de más mercadería para su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y así poder tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de celulares, tienda de abarrotes, venta de insumos forestales, también hay socios profesionales como profesores y una enfermera.

La socia se siente feliz por el préstamo  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
These individuals belong to the communal bank named "Qolquewasi". It is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Elena: she is 39 years old, married common-law, and the mother of 2 children. She has a convenience store from where she sells basic needs products, such as rice, sugar, and milk but she also sells other types of products, such as snacks, soft drinks, cooking oil, pastas and more. She is happy with her business and it is through this business that she is able to support her family. She is someone who perseveres with everything she sets out to do. 

She requests a loan to purchase more merchandise for her convenience store, to add a greater variety of products to sell to her clients.

The other members have various businesses including, cell phone sales, convenience store, and timber sales. There are some members who are professionals, including teachers and a nurse. 

She is very happy to have the loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Cheng's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members living in Preaek Hour Lech village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Cheng N., born in 1962, is the group leader. She has been selected for this position by the other members. She earns her living by selling fish ìn the market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, which is why she has decided to ask for a loan in order to buy more fish to enlarge her business. 

Her husband, Mr. On Heng, born in 1958, helps to support the family by earning a small living as a wedding chef. The couple has two children: one is a policeman and one attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy more fish to offer for sale at market and to enlarge her business

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.fr: Madame  Nathalie   a 38 ans et est  mère de 3 enfants.    Elle  est  mariée  et  habite  quartier  Avépozo. Elle  vend  l’igname, patate  douce,  banane  et  maïs  pour  aider  au  foyer.  Elle  s’approvisionne  à  Assrama  et  revend  à la devanture  de  sa maison.  Elle  compte  3 ans dans  cette  activité.  Elle  sollicite  un  crédit pour  acheter  30 tas d’igname.
texts.en: Madame  Nathalie  is 38 years old and has three children. She is married and lives in the Avépozo quarter. She sells yams, sweet potato, bananas and corn in order to meet her family's needs. She sources her goods from Assrama  and re-sells from her home. She has worked in this field for three years, and is seeking a loan in order to buy 30 loads of yams.

loans.use: purchasing yams

loans.name: Lidia Ruth

texts.es: Lidia Ruth se ha caracterizado, por ser una mujer luchadora y que disfruta de interactuar con sus clientes. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo que se encuentra muy contenta por mejorar su negocio. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de calzado, ropa en general, toallas, sabanas, tratamientos, cremas, bolsos entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche que llega a su vivienda, pues sabe que tiene que salir todos los días para ofrecer sus productos y algunas veces ella vende ciertos productos en su vivienda, en donde ciertos clientes saben lo que ofrece.
texts.en:
Lidia Ruth is known for being a determined woman who enjoys interacting with her customers. This is not the first time she has received financing and she is very pleased that the loans have helped to improve her business.

She is requesting a loan to buy shoes, clothes, towels, bed sheets, treatments, crèmes, bags, and other items. Lidia begins works every day at 7am and returns home at 9pm. She knows that she must go out every day to offer her products. Sometimes she will sell certain products from her home since some customers know they can purchase them there.

loans.use: To purchase shoes, clothes, towels, bed sheets, treatments, crèmes, bags, and other items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 28 years old, married and a mother of one. She runs a salon for a living, and has been in business for seven years. She also relies on her husband's income.

She has learned how to manage her finances from the training offered by Faulu Kenya. Hence, she has improved her business. She hopes to open another outlet of her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kes to buy a steamer, flat iron and other beauty products.

loans.use: to buy a steamer, flat iron and other beauty products.

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara J., 48, is the leader of this group. She resides in the small town of Karabalta, is married, and has a twelve-year-old son. Her husband is a construction worker in another town and her son goes to middle school. 

For almost fifteen years Gulnara has been selling milk at home. The fact that she operates a dairy business is known to the whole neighborhood, so there is usually a constant flow of customers. An initial capital of 20,000 KGS was loaned by a local bank, and the family repaid it successfully. Now it generates $83 monthly, but it’s not enough to purchase calves for fattening. 

Therefore, Gulnara applied for a loan from Kiva. She is confident in every member of her group and believes in a high commitment in repaying the loan successfully. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en:
Nyamsuren B. is 26 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a house in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two sons, age 3 and 5, both attend kindergarten. 

She manages a refrigerator repair business with the help of her husband. She started her business in 2008. She advertises their business in newspapers and customers call her to give orders. She usually receives two or three phone calls about broken refrigerators each day. She fixes one refrigerator at a cost of 25,000 to 65,000 MNT. 

She is planning to have her own working place in the future. She is an honest woman who loves her job. She says, "I want to have my own working place where I can employ more workers in the future." 

She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to rent a workshop.

loans.use: To rent a workshop.

loans.name: Bernard Wachira

texts.en:
Bernard has operated his butcher shop in Naivasha town for the last 4 years. He also acts as a middleman in selling cereals. He is 37 years old, married to Sarah Wanjiru, and they have 2 children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid for his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more cereals to sell.

In the future, Bernard hopes to grow both his butcher and cereals businesses.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  None of her children is currently in school.  Betty has a business of outside catering, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food for cooking for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Betty hopes to own a retail shop.  Betty is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her to be hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more food for cooking for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with five children. Veronica is 58 years old and lives in Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental.

Veronica produces and sells sugar in the community to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 to purchase raw materials for her sugar cane maker.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her sugar maker

loans.name: Bathsebah

texts.en:
Bathsebah, a 34-year-old married mother of three children, all attending school, has a mixed farm in the town of Kisii that produces maize, beans, nappier grass and vegetables, all of which she sells locally. She earns additional income from her rental houses in the same town.

Bathsebah has made a loan request of 45,000 Kes through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will enable her to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The additional profits arising from this loan will be used to build more rental houses that will help increase her income.

Her biggest challenges have been poor market prices for farm produce and fluctuating weather conditions which affect her production.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: C4829Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Jeanne is 27 years old and is married with one child who is one year old. She owns a restaurant selling food and drinks.  Jeanne is the president of this group, called "TUZAMURANE" in local language. 

She is the first person on the left side. She has been in this business for about two years and her business is open from 6 am until 11 pm every day. Jeanne currently employs one person to help her.

Jeanne and her team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses by purchasing more drinks and food for sale. With any profits, Jeanne and her team will reinvest in their businesses and save for their family's future.

loans.use: To increase her restaurant by purchasing more drinks and food for sale.

loans.name: Farman

texts.en: Farman is a 46-year-old farmer who breeds and resells cattle and dairy products in a small village in Saatli region. He is married and has two sons. Farman usually buys cattle and breeds them for six months. After that, he resells them in the livestock bazaar. Milk selling is also one of the sources of additional income for his family. His profit from both businesses is $200 US. Now Farman would like to purchase one more milking cow and cattle to increase his profit. For this purpose, he applied for 1100 AZN. This is his second loan and Farman promises to repay as good as the first time.

loans.use: to purchase one milking cow and two cattle

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es una madre de familia de 46 años, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona tiene como principal actividad el comercio,la crianza de aves de corral y turismo.  

Celia se dedica  a la venta de frutas y verduras en forma ambulatoria en el mercado de la zona donde vive, con una experiencia de 5 años , es por eso que es conocida y tiene su propia clientela,  las ventas de sus productos se han ido incrementando; al igual que sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

El préstamo que solicitó a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla fue de 2000 nuevos soles, el cual lo va utilizar  para realizar algunas mejoras en su casa (como colocar puerta y ventanas de fierro) para que tenga mayor seguridad en su domicilio, el aumento de sus ventas le permitirá cubrir su crédito y cumplir con sus obligaciones de casa.  Celia es una persona con muchos aspiraciones y uno de ellos es que con su trabajo y esfuerzo pueda tener un  puesto fijo en el mercado y contar con más comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Celia is a 46-year-old mother living with her children in her own house that has all basic utilities located in José Leandro Ortiz District that belongs to Chiclayo Province.  This zone’s main activity is commerce, barnyard fowl raising and tourism.

Celia is a fruit and vegetable street vendor in her local market.  She has 5 years’ experience so is well knows and has her own clientele.  Sales have been increasing as well as her income to improve her family’s quality of life.

The loan she requested from Edpyme Alternativa through their Capital Seed program was for 2000 new soles which she’ll use to do some home improvements (like installing metal doors and windows) so that her house will be safer.  Increased sales will allow her to repay the loan and meet household expenses.  Celia is a person with many hopes.  One of them is that she’ll be able to install a fixed sales stand in the market and have comforts at home thanks to her work and effort.

loans.use: to install windows and metal doors on her house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, natural de la ciudad de San Francisco de 43 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado muy duro por sobre salir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo e hijos y lo que más desea es sacar profesional a sus hijos. La actividad a la que se dedica María es la venta de ropa, ella  todos los días atiende a muchos compradores, quienes sabiendo de la buena calidad y lo novedoso de las prendas que ella misma trae desde la ciudad de Lima, no dudan en comprarle más de 02 atuendos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es distraerse con cada uno de sus clientes a la vez aprovecha en aconsejar a sus compradores sobre las prendas que mejor las quedan, ya que así se gana la  confianza de cada uno de ellos, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer largas horas en espera de clientes. María agradece al apoyo solidario de los financistas ya que gracias al apoyo de ellos va progresando y obteniendo buenos bienestares. En adelante espera ampliar su tienda para poder mostrar mejor sus mercaderías. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP y por ello espera de su colaboración para poder comprar la mercadería a la vez se compromete pagar puntualmente sus cronogramas de pago ya que desea acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa de la ciudad de Lima, para implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
43-year-old Maria is from the town of San Francisco.  She is a woman who has always worked very hard to do well in life.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and children.  What she most wants in life is to see her children become professionals.

Maria's business is selling clothes.  She serves many customers every day who are aware of the good quality, very latest clothes that she brings from the city of Lima and don't hesitate to buy more than two outfits from her.  What she most enjoys about her work is chatting with each of her customers and advising them on which clothes would suit them best as, this way, she gains their trust.  Maria has been in this business for 15 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to stay in her business for long hours waiting for customers.

Maria is grateful for the support of Kiva lenders since, thanks to their support, she is making progress and doing well.  In the future she hopes to expand her store so that she can better display her merchandise.  This will be her second loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can buy merchandise.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time and in accordance with the repayment schedule as she would like to access other loans in the future.  Maria will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy more clothes in the city of Lima so that she can better stock her sales location.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Rosas De Saron Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE SARON” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Adela, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Inés. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Confección de polleras, tejido de mantas a máquina, venta de colchones, venta de regalos, venta de accesorios de celular, venta de edredones. 

La señora Inés,  indica que es el tercer año que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de una de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de colchones desde hace tres años, el que aprendió de una amiga.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar capital (compra de colchones), el que adquiere de la feria 16 de julio y lo comercializa en su puesto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Rosas de Saron” (Roses of Sharon) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Community Center. This group consists of seven members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Inés. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses in order to get ahead such as making skirts, weaving blankets with machines, selling mattresses, selling gifts, selling mobile phone accessories, and selling quilts.

Sra. Inés says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after being invited by one of her friends. At the moment, she has a business selling mattresses that has been in operation for three years. She learned this trade from a friend.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying mattresses. She acquires her merchandise at the July 16th fair and then sells these products from her vending post. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. Inés is in a common-law relationship and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Inés said that she enjoys the training classes and the savings.

loans.use: to buy mattresses to sell.

loans.name: Yaly Esperanza

texts.es: Yaly está estudiando para ser abogada, pero requiere de un crédito para pagar el curso de titulación. Ella trabaja y paga sus estudios. Dentro de algunos años se ve trabajando en su propio buffete, espera poder mejorar el nivel de vida de ella y su familia, para lograr mis metas me inspira las ganas que tiene de aprender y crecer como persona, y quiere que su hijo siga su ejemplo. Tiene la necesidad de recibir el préstamo porque tiene que cumplir una meta, un sueño, el cual he esperado cinco años conseguirlo.
texts.en: Yaly is studying to be a lawyer, but she needs a loan to pay for her thesis course. She works and pays for her studies. Within a few years she sees herself having her own legal practice. She hopes to be able to improve both her and her family's quality of life. Her desire to learn and grow as a person is inspirational, and she wants her child to follow her example. She needs a loan because she has to achieve a goal, a dream, that she has waited for five years to attain.

loans.use: to finish her studies.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Jeronimo en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Juana, la socia tiene 41 años de edad, la socia es soltera y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la construcción de paneles electrónicos, la socia trabaja con sus compañeros elaborando los diferentes paneles en todo tamaño para publicar anuncios publicitarios, propagandas de comidas, restaurantes, discotecas, bares, bancos y mucho mas; La socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de paneles electrónicos, para anuncios publicitarios.
La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Juana, 41, belongs to the “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank located in San Jerónimo District in Cusco Province and Department.

She is single and has three children.  She manufactures electronic panels used in advertising.  She works with her coworkers making different panels in all sizes to publish publicity ads, food propaganda and advertisements for restaurants, discothèques, bars, banks and many others.  She wants to use the loan to buy materials to manufacture electronic panels used in advertising.  She is grateful for the support she’ll get and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy materials to make electronic panels for advertising.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is too young for school. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to providing the family's basic needs. Umazi has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and medical facilities. 

She has operated a large scale farm for the past 20 years. Her potential clients are the people at the market. She faces a major challenge of lack of modern tools for farming. She dreams of being a leading produce farmer.

With the 10,000 KES, Umazi wants to purchase seedlings and hire a tractor for plowing the farm. She decided to join Yehu because of access to loan facilities of low interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and hire a tractor for plowing the farm

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school.  Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provisions of the families basic needs.  She owns a house with electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Riziki has operated a lesos selling business for the past three years.  (Lesos are also called kanga. They are the most prominent article of clothing for East African women.)  In addition she also runs a coconut and juice selling business.  Her potential clients are her neighbors and the local area residents.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality as she sells more lesos during the festive seasons.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop of selling lesos. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of lesos and coconuts for resale.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it has fair legal requirements.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of lesos (kanga) and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Limpia Concepcion

texts.es:
La Sra. Limpia tiene 56 años de edad, es una mujer muy humilde y sacrificada, es madre soltera de varios hijos que ya formaron sus hogares, tiene dos nietos a quienes cuida Luz Milagros de 5 años y Mario Michael de 15 años, viven en Coronel O. hace mas de 20 años.
La Sra. Limpia se dedicó a ser modista por 11 años, pero decidió invertir en un pequeño almacén en su casa para poder ofrecer a sus nietos todo el cuidado que ellos necesitan, ya que su madre los había dejado en busca de otras posibilidades de vida. Su sueño es tener una despensa bien surtida para poder ofrecer variedad y comodidad a sus clientes, es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de comestibles, como ser arroz, fideos, azúcar, verduras y demás.
Está feliz por la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya ya que de esa manera podrá obtener parte de su sueño tan anhelado del negocio propio.
texts.en:
Sra. Limpia is 56 years old and a humble woman who has made sacrifices. She is a single mother of children who have started their own households. Limpia takes care of two grandchildren, Luz Milagros (age 5) and Mario Michael (age 15). She and her family have lived in Coronel O. for more than 20 years.

Sra. Limpia has been a seamstress for 11 years, but she decided to invest in a small store in her home so that she could provide everything her grandchildren need. Their mother left them with her so that she could look for other opportunities in life. Her dream is to operate a well-stocked food pantry so that she can offer variety and convenience to her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy food products such as rice, noodles, sugar, vegetables, and other items.

She is happy for the opportunity that Fundación Paraguaya has provided. This has helped her achieve part of her long-anticipated dream of having her own business.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
18 mujeres de la ciudad de Caaguazú, todas ellas muy luchadoras y trabajadoras oyeron hablar del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya y decidieron agruparse y formar su grupo. Ellas quieren que por medio del trabajo en conjunto puedan mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 
Una de esas mujeres luchadoras es la señora 	Maura, quien se dedica a la venta de gallinas, ella comenta que este ha sido su trabajo por mucho tiempo, que le enorgullece lo que hace porque es muy honrado y porque además de eso me va muy bien. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de gallinas y después revenderlas, pues siempre tiene mucha clientela y quiere cumplir con ellas. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le está dando.
texts.en: 18 women from the city of Caaguazú, all of them enterprising and hardworking, heard about the program for Women Entrepreneurs of the Fundacion Paraguay and decided to get together and form their own group. They want to improve their living conditions by working together. One of those enterprising women is Señora Maura who sells chickens. She says that this has been her work for a long time. What makes her proud of what she does is that it is honest work and she is also doing very well. She is asking for a loan to buy chickens and subsequently resell them, as she always has a lot of customers and she wants to meet their demands. She is grateful to the Fundacion for the opportunity given her.

loans.use: to buy chickens for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Anjela

texts.en:
Anjela is single and blessed with two children who are in school. She describes herself as a hardworking businesswoman. She employs one person to assist her in the business. Since Anjela joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. With her loan of 20,000 KES, she intends to buy vegetables, fruits, and potatoes for resale. 
In the next five years, Angjela wants to expand her business. She dreams of buying a van for transporting fruits and vegetables to the market.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits and potatoes.

loans.name: Mahuclo Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MAHUCLO est composé de treize personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Jeanne Léocadie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jeanne Léocadie est âgée de 39 ans et vit au Bénin. Jeanne Léocadie a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Jeanne Léocadie est mariée à un entrepreneur du nom de Elias. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge.
