En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Jeanne Léocadie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Jeanne Léocadie exerce depuis quatre ans la couture à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Jeanne Léocadie vend des céréales, des chaussures et des tissus. Jeanne Léocadie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin et au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Jeanne Léocadie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement MAHUCLO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Mahuclo group consists of thirteen persons from the same neighborhood. This is the second time the group has sought financial support from ALIDé, to raise the level of its business activities.

The representative of the group, Jeanne Léocadie, is raisiing her hand in the picture. She is 39 years old and lives in Benin. She left school at primary level.

Jeanne Léocadie is married to an entrepreneur named Elias. The couple has three children; all attend school and are their dependents. In addition to their own children, the couple takes care of another child. Jeanne Léocadie lives together with her ​​husband and children.

To deal with various family expenses over the past four years, Jeanne Léocadie has been working at home as a seamstress. As a second activity, she sells grain cereals, shoes and fabrics. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin and also from Togo.

Seeking to satisfy customers and wanting to increase her turnover and income, Jeanne Léocadie, together with the other members of the Mahuclo group, is requesting a second credit loan from ALIDé. The first loan was repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy haberdashery items, bags and shoes

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en: Daphrose is 42 years old and married to a farmer.  They have four children aged between 2 and 14.  All of her children go to school.  She has sold handbags for the last four years.  She needs the loan in order to buy more handbags.  With the profits, Daphrose will build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more handbags to sell.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is from the village of Ruispiri, East Georgia. He is 56 years old and lives alone in the house. Nodar earns his living through trade of maize. He purchases maize in West Georgia and sells it at the local market. He also has a small poultry farm/incubator. He sells chickens to the neighborhood poultry farms. His total average monthly income is 900 Laris. Nodar has requested credit for purchasing additional maize for resale. 

In the future, Nodar plans to expand his poultry business to make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase maize for resale.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is 52 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. For the past seven years, she has sold snacks and food to earn a living. Constancia has been a member of PMPC for two years.

Constancia is requesting a 6,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients to make snacks to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make snacks to sell

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Claressa May

texts.en:
Claressa May is 26 years old and married with four children, two children are still in school, Claressa May works very hard to provide for them.

Claressa May runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo and other snack foods.

Claressa May has been in this business for 5 years, earns additional income from selling vegetables and pig raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future Claressa May would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, shampoo and other snack foods

loans.name: Maria Victoria Juana

texts.en:
Ms. Victoria, 60, is very friendly and hard-working; she sells \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"JAFRA\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" beauty products. She has been selling these products for 10 year and is currently also a distributor with other saleswomen under her. Ms. Victoria has given jobs to many women. She needs $500.00 USD to buy merchandise that will enable her to supply her saleswomen with products for this Christmas season. She says that the Christmas season creates the highest demand of the year; so, she and her saleswomen do not want to lose the opportunity to generate more income. Remember that you will not only be helping Ms. Victoria but also more women who look for work and want to succeed. Support them!

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Victoria tiene 60 años de edad, es una persona muy amigable y trabajadora; se dedica a la venta de productos “JAFRA” los cuales son productos de belleza y desde hace más de 10 años ella vende estos productos, por lo que actualmente ella también es distribuidora y tiene a su cargo algunas vendedoras. Doña Victoria ha dado empleo a muchas mujeres que se interesan por tener un trabajo, ella requiere de $500 USD para comprar mercancía que le permitirá abastecer a sus vendedoras de productos para esta próxima temporada navideña.

Ella comenta que esta temporada es la época con mayor demanda en todo el año, por lo que ella y sus vendedoras no quieren desaprovechar la oportunidad de generar mayores ingresos. Recuerda que no solo ayudas a Doña Victoria si no a más mujeres que buscan un empleo y su deseo de superarse. ¡Apóyalas!

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Manola

texts.en: Manola V. lives in the village of Boliartzi, near Asenovgrad. She has had her own business since 1995. Manola keeps a small hardware store in the village. She tills about 7 hectares of her own land and also breeds 12 cows and 5 calves in an own cowshed. Next to her cowshed she has opened a milk station where she buys milk from other farmers. Because of the enlargement of capacity of her milk station Manola V. needs a new pan for collecting milk. The loan amount is $1200.

loans.use: To buy a new pan for collecting milk
